name: Go with the Floe
description:
Go with the Floe is a two-player abstract chase game. The seal player wants to isolate the seals beyond the reach of the pursuing polar bears. The polar bear player wins if both seals are caught, otherwise the seal player wins.

Components
Modified 8 x 8 board with 52 ice spaces
2 black seal tokens and 2 white polar bear tokens.
50 hole-in-the-ice ring markers

Game Play
Starting with the Black player, players take turns moving one of their tokens. A player may pass a turn only if he or she has no legal move.
Either player tokens can:
1) Move one or two empty spaces in any one direction, like a range-restricted chess queen, or
2) Move by jumping over one ring marker in any direction into an empty space, as in checkers but without capturing or multiple jumps.

Captures
Only White may capture an opponent’s token and this can only be done from an adjacent space, like a chess king. On capturing both the white and black tokens are removed from play leaving the capture space empty.

After moving or capturing, the moving player places a hole-in-the-ice ring marker on the moving token’s starting space and any empty space passed over.

Game End
The game ends when one of the following occurs:
* The White player captures both Black tokens. White wins.
* The Black player has one token isolated and which cannot be captured. Black wins.
* Both players pass on consecutive turns. Black wins.

name: Montcalm & Wolfe
description:
A desktop strategic game on the Seven Year War in America.

13"x19" map

112 counters

name: Village in a Box: Water & People in a Box
description:
3 Expansions to Village in a Box.

1. People in a Box: introduces 10 unique Character cards, each with a unique hidden ability, to add a deep new layer of strategy and bluffing to the game!

2. Water in a Box: introduces the Water resource card and expands the tech tree to include the Great Hall, Harbor, Palace, and Mill.

3. Player in a Box: expands the basic card game to allow an additional player to join the game!

To play the expansions with the base game, shuffle all the green-backed cards together and deal 6 to each player as usual. Separate out the Character cards and deal 1 at random to each player, face-down. Your character will have a unique ability, available for you to leverage in your inevitable climb to conquest. These abilities may grant you extra points for building farms and shepherds, or they may allow you to exchange hands with an opponent between rounds!

Characters add depth to the game, as you explore the possibilities with each card and wrest victory from your unworthy opponents.

All three expansions come in one box.
categories: Bluffing, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Trading

name: Starlight Stage: Shining Star
description:
Starlight Stage: Shining Star, an expansion for Starlight Stage, includes 13 idol cards, 14 fame cards, 27 event cards, and 6 initial idol cards. With this expansion, you can play Starlight Stage with five people and give your talent agency a wider pool of starlets to put under those bright lights!

—description from the publisher
publishers: Japanime Games, シュレディンガーゲームズ (Schrodinger Games)

name: 5°Dimension Playing Card Game
description:
The 5th Dimension Playing Card Game is actually a five-suited deck of playing cards based on the traditional 52-card deck. In addition to the added suit (stars), the 5D deck gives each suit its own unique color and theme. It also adds a '1' card (distinct from the ace) and a 'P' (princess) face card, as well as including a joker for each suit. Thus, the deck includes 80 cards in total.

The deck has been made available in a number of different formats that differ in packaging, accessories (such as score sheets), and game rules included. The publisher's web site www.jeudecartes5d.com provided rules for 14 games as of the end of 2008, albeit only in French.

name: Striker II
description:
From the back cover:

Striker II is the miniatures combat rules of 58th century warfare, for use with Traveler:The New Era. Now the epic planetary engagements of the New Era, The Final War, or the Frontier Wars are under your control, allowing you to command battalions of lift infantry, drop troops, and grav armor. These rules are fully compatible with Traveler, and so also allow miniatures resolution of role-playing adventures.

Combat in the 58th century is fast-moving, and so is Striker II. Based on the award-winning Command Decision miniature rules, Striker II allows rapid play which replicates the rapid tempo and quick reactions of advanced technology warfare. These straight-forward rules allow players to concentrate on the mental dilemmas of tactics and command, not the interpretation of complicated rules mechanics.

Striker II is more than just rules, it is also an extensive source of military hardware and organizations-from the jeeps and tracked vehicles of Wilds units to the speeders and gray tanks of a Reformation Coalition Marine Brigade. Striker II also includes tables of organization and equipment listings for some of the most important military units from Traveller's long history: Zhondai Lift Infantry Battalions and Commando Groupments, Imperial Marine Task Forces, Imperial Guard Regiments, and the legendary 4518th Lift Infantry Regiment- "The Duke of Regina's Own Huscarls."

Striker II provides the full science fiction combat experience with rules on orbital bombardment, drop troops, anti-missle fire control, planetary environment, and orbital superiority. Campaign rules allow a sophisticated strategic gaming experience by adding the effects of combat engineers, maintenance, and quality of food and medical care.

Re-implements:

Striker

name: Fjord
description:
Published within A Book of Sandhurst Wargames.

A simulation the naval campaign around northern Norway. 1941-45.

Fjord is designed to represent a complete campaign which lasted for nearly four years and involved hundreds of ships. The overall game is played as a series of several small games some of which represent a sequence of action at the strategic level ('convoy operations') while alternate ones represent tactical actions (fjord raids) against Tirpitz in Altenfjord. In both types of action the rules for concealed movement are especially important.


2 maps: Strategic map showing the North Cape of Norway with a part of the Arctic Ocean, and a tactical map of Altenfjord.
1 die


Strategic:

2 score markers
1 ops marker
1 time marker
1 weather marker
10 German scenario cards
60 markers for stacks of units
40 British and German unit counters


Tactical:

72 unit counters including 16 dummies

name: Superfight: The Dystopia Deck
description:
ALL HAIL THE INSECT OVERLORDS!

With this 100-card Superfight Expansion you too can celebrate the new world order with cards inspired by the very best in dystopian and post-apocalyptic fiction. This deck can be played on its own but we highly recommend playing it with the Core Deck.

—description from the publisher

name: Spheres of Life: Mythical Forest
description:
The goal of the game is to collect an army of Noble Animals while Avoiding the Corrupted Animals. Simple, right?

In your quest to become the savior of the forest, you will venture through the realms of Day, Night, and Dream! During your adventure, you will team up with a powerful hero, use magical abilities, steal, and do everything in your power to overcome the evil forces that have corrupted the Spheres of Life!

But remember, although everyone wants to rid of the evil forces, only one can become the savior!

—description from the publisher

name: Subete al Troncal
description:
In this game players receive cards with people that want to travel across the city, either by bus or subway. Every passenger pays a different amount of money (for example, kids pay less). But because the service is so bad, most of the passengers seem very unhappy.
Each round players must chose one of the passenger cards he has in his hands and place them in one of the 3 transportation available. Once the capacity (11, 13 or 17) is exceeded, the player must take every passenger and put them in front of him.
There are also special passengers that affects the other ones (thieves, clowns, police and others)
At the end of the game, the player with the most unhappiness will be automatically eliminated. The other players count the money collected. The player with more money wins the game.

This game was inspired in the transportation problems that the new transportation system implanted in Santiago de Chile (TranSantiago) has had during this year.

name: Banned Books: Animals
description:
2-card animals expansion for Banned Books.


Characters:


Old Major, from Animal Farm, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club July 2018 package.
Tango, from And Tango Makes Three, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club December 2018 package.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Retro: Επιτραπαίζουμε!
description:
1.000 questions, that will bring to life your most vivid memories!

Everything that you and your friends loved from the greek 80’s, 90’s and 00’s! TV shows, Movies, Actors, Singers, Hits, TV spots, Cartoons, pick-up lines and everything you can imagine!
You heard about it. You lived through it. You have it in your hearts! If you forgot it, now is the time to bring it all back with this game of memories! Alone or with your teammates, choose wisely your questions, according to your opponents, and prepare yourself for answering your opponents questions.

Let’s BoardGame!

name: Pirates of the 7 Seas: Black Friday
description:
Pirates of the 7 Seas: Black Friday is a unique promo card specially made for the Pirates of the 7 Seas release at Spiel 2015. Its uniqueness, apart from its limited quantity, is the combination of two cards (Curse card and Port card).

Pirates, who brought rich booty to sell, are in despair. The time for Black Friday has come and all the goods cost just 1 chest of gold for each no matter its quantity. It is somebody’s bad intent, for sure! It’s probably a trick of those whose ships are carrying just air and rats into their holds.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Counterfeiters: Action Improvements
description:
This promo pack adds 10 cards to Counterfeiters. Action Improvement cards are chosen at the start of the game; they are NOT shuffled into the black market stack. Beginning with the starting player and going in clockwise order, players will each take a turn choosing one of the available cards. Then, starting with the last player and going in counter-clockwise order, each player will select one more card. Any cards remaining will not be used in this game.

The Action Improvement cards are marked according to player count. You will use 5 Action Improvement cards for a 2-player game, and 7 for a 3-player game. 4-player games will use all 10 Action Improvement cards. Players must place their selected Action Improvements face-up in front of them on the table, and visible to all players.

Each Action Improvement card may be used once per game, on a player’s own turn, in order to improve a specific action. Only one Action Improvement card may be used on a given turn. Once one of these cards has been used, turn it facedown.

—description from the publisher

name: Floresta Encantada
description:
FLORESTA ENCANTADA (Enchanted Forest) has quickly become one of the best seller games in Brazil.

The game mechanics is very simple, so that it can be played by 6 year old children, even those who still can't read. At the same time, each move is a tactical decision, so it can also interest older players.

It is a race game in which the goal is to collect point markers along the way.

The movement of the pawns depends on the card played. Each player has four cards in hand and on his turn he plays one card and advances the pawn to the next space with the card's picture.

Depending on the situation and on the card used, the player can advance faster or slower. As the markers towards the end of the way worth more points, the player would like to advance fast. But in doing so, he can waste the opportunity to earn some important points along the way.

name: Spot it! Fire & Ice
description: Spot it! Fire & Ice pits players against an electric timer. Race to spot matches and beat the buzzer, while looking for your chance to freeze and burn your opponents. Features more than 50 different images of hot and cold objects.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Electronic, Party Game, Real-time

name: Echelon
description:
From the box:

'After reading one of the 286 extracts from famous works of fiction, players must answer questions on what they have read. Unlike other question and answer games, no previous knowledge is required for play.

Questions are graded for difficulty, starting with simple either/or answers and working up to real tests of memory and understanding. Points are scored for each correct answer and each player's progress is recorded on the unique 3-dimensional Echelon board.

As well as being a test of memory, the game is also one of strategy and tactics as players compete to win valuable bonus points by being the first to answer questions at each echelon level.'

Simpler, edited extracts are included for younger players.

name: Pingyao: The Golden Pawner
description:
Banking was not the only business that Jin Merchants were running and profiting. They also held pawnshops all around China. After adding this expansion to Pingyao: First Chinese Banks, players can now open banks and pawn shops at the same time, and new elements such as Remaining Profit, National Loan and Pawn Collectors can help players find new ways to better organize their resources in the game. The player with the most victory points at the end of the game will become the most successful of all Jin Merchants and claim victory.
—description from the publisher

晉商不僅開票號賺的盆滿缽滿，同時他們的典當行也是開遍全國。平遙匯通天下在加入本擴展後，玩家依舊扮演一位晉商在固定的時間內（8個回合）發展自己，這次我們不僅能經營票號，還能經營典當行，通過平色餘利系統、全國放款和典當收藏家幫助玩家獲得更多的資源。遊戲結束後誰是最成功的商人（分數最多）誰將獲得遊戲勝利。
—description from the publisher (Chinese)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Zooloretto: Glücksschwein
description:
A post card format expansion for Zooloretto.
Glücksschwein (Pig of luck) is won by filling the 6-space enclosure first. At the end of the game, the money of the owner of Glücksschwein is doubled. The player that first won the Glücksschwein keeps it for the rest of the game night's Zooloretto plays.

Home Page & Newsletter:

www.zooloretto.com


(German, english, dutch, hungarian, spanish, swedish)

name: Kutná Hora: The City of Silver – Chartered Town Promo Card
description:
A new event card for Kutná Hora: The City of Silver that allows players to play a sixth action card as a part of an additional, fourth, turn.

—description from publisher
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Market, Tile Placement

name: Zig Zag
description: In this abstract strategy game players move their pawns and eat opponent's pawns just by falling over them. What's new and different is that you must draw a disc of the appropriate color to move to the corresponding position. This adds a luck variation to a standard checkers games.

name: Surprise!
description: You're invited to a Surprise party! There are lots of fantastic gifts—if you can find them. Is the Dapper Dinosaur in this box? Or is the Party Palace hiding there? Or maybe it changed into the Super Starship? Using memory and a little luck, try to uncover all the presents shown on the Party Cards. Make a match and you get to go again. Whoever holds the most cards at the end of the game wins. Get ready... the party's about to begin!

name: Score! Soccer Game
description:
Quote from the rules: "Score Soccer is an exciting simulation of the real game of soccer, NASL style, incorporating all the tactical moves of the game. This simulation is accurate enough to be used by coaches and soccer players to discuss and devise strategy for playing the real game."

Game uses players on triangular bases that can form to a square and both fit in one space as needed for tackles and such. Each team has 6 plays during a turn which may consist of moving, kicking the ball, headers, tackles, and more. A die is used to determine certain results on a table.

Advanced rules add shoulder charges, swerve kicks, tackles, yellow/red cards, substitutes, and high wind.

name: Golem
description:
Golem won the 2004 About.com Board/Card Games / Abstract Games Magazine Shared Pieces Game Design Competition.

Players take the role of wizards vying for control over a golem loose in the city. Golem features a unique shared-piece mechanic in which the players bid for control of the golem's movement, trying to harvest charms and foist curses upon their opponents. Along the way, players may gain control of powerful artifacts, such as the Amulet of Loki, that can change the game in an instant. With its modular board, Golem is never the same game twice. Golem features the haunting artwork of Niklas Brandt.

In the game, each turn consists of the following phases:

allocation
orientation
movement
harvesting
regeneration


Players have 20 units to allocate per turn (to orientation, movement, harvesting, and regeneration). Points are earned for harvesting charms. Play continues until one player reaches 30 points.

name: Micro Sci-Fi
description:
This wargame is a part of the Micro Warfare Series covering battles between the Earth (and its galactic allies) and the Zoltan Empire. It is a miniatures-style game that includes cardboard unit counters. The rules include a variety of fantastic weapons, including vortex beams, pluton flares, inertia weapons, and the ever-popular defense screens. Specific counters are included to fight small-scale combats, including attacks on colonies and police forts.

Supplements:
Sci-Fi
TTG-MA-S01 Xylon Vikings
TTG-MA-S02 Time Warriors
TTG-MA-S03 Kripton
TTG-MA-S04 Star Pods
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Tribes of Pangea
description:
Pangea is the prehistoric one continent world. Each time you open Tribes of Pangea, you will create a new one-continent world to explore. Players seed the world with unknown resources to explore and use them to either build their own infrastructure, or to conquer opponent tribes.

Players win by defeating all opponent tribes in Pangea. Victory is usually reached with a balanced strategy of war, economy, and fame.

Each turn your tribe is not starving, you get more population, which means you can gather more resources, build more infrastructure, and build more armies with which to gain control of even more resources... until Pangea is yours.

The game typically takes between 3 and 5 hours. While only having an 11 page rule book, the game does have some considerable learning curve.

The game features include:
* a random setup, to ensure a new game every time you play
* a battle resolution table to facilitate rolling dice for battles
* 3 types of military units, melee, ranged, and magic
* buildings and resources that can upgrade military units
* a system of fame and bribing, if you decide that war isn't going to work for you!

2-6 players, ages 12 and up
Contents: 56 building counters, 36 resource counters, 180 military counters, 5 dice, 6 tribe cards, 1 battle resolution table, 36 continent and ocean hexes, 18 roads, 66 counting chip counters, 11 page rule book, 6 page reference almanac.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Exploration, Fantasy, Prehistoric, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil

name: 1829 Conversion Kit
description:
1829 Conversion Kits were published to allow owners of the 1829 Conversion Kit to play the other 18xx games without having to buy another complete game as many of the parts were common to both the Southern and the Northern games. As such, the Conversion Kits are not standalone games, but rather contains those parts unique to the other 1829 [Northern or Southern] - the board and the shares for the companies. A copy of 1829 Northern Board is required to use the 1829 Southern Conversion Kit or alternatively a Southern Board can be used with a Northern Conversion Kit.

The Conversion Kits can be differentiated from a full copy of 1829 by the presence of either a large sticker to the right of the 1829 name on the box stating "Conversion Kit. This is not a complete game." [Southern Conversion Kit] or a larger diagonal sticker across the front of the box [Northern and Southern Conversion Kits]. See pictures. The inevitable scars left after removal of either sticker is the largest sign that this is the Conversion Kit and not the full game. However, on the side of the box where the Number of Players and Playing Time is indicated, there is also a sticker covering the Serial Number [Southern Kit] or no number at all [both kits].

name: Bid!
description:
An abstract auction game for the piecepack. Each turn consists of the following steps:

1. The player who won the last auction takes the four dice and rolls them. The rolls determine the rules of this auction.
2. All players take one tile from their hand as their bid, and place it face-down. When all players have chosen, turn all tiles face-up. The highest value wins the auction (null is zero, Ace is one).
3. The tile played by the winner is given to the second-highest bidder, who in turn gives their tile to the third-highest bidder, and so on. The winner of the auction takes the lowest bidder’s tile.

The first to reach 100 points is the winner.

name: Boom Town
description:
Players are rival Business Bosses in an old west boomtown.
Hire Gunslingers to do your Dirty Work.
The first player to acquire $100 becomes the new Mayor.
A complete copy of the rules is available for free.
categories: American West, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Deukalion: Whirlpool of the Charybdis
description:
This expansion for Deukalion consists of three vortex tiles that can be placed on a space near the edge of the gameboard, allowing for instantaneous travel but at the potential cost of some of your crew.

It has been a free gimmick at the Essen fair 2008.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Nautical, Print & Play, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver
publishers: Österreichisches Spiele Museum e.V., White Castle

name: Odd or Even
description:
This Sackson design is a simple abstract. Players take turns placing pegs on the board, with each peg having to be adjacent to the last one. If playing with the Odd rule, when a peg is placed it must be adjacent to an odd number of pegs. If playing with the Even rule, it must be adjacent to an even number of pegs (except for the second peg placed).

There are two further variants given in the rules, plus a solitaire version.

Part of Stancraft's Hoyle Official Games line.

name: Reverse Charades: Girls' Night In Edition
description:
Reverse Charades: Girls' Night In Edition, an expansion pack for Reverse Charades, consists of 220 cards that feature women-themed words.

Game play remains the same as in the base game, with players divided into two teams. On a turn, all but one player on a team give charades-style clues to that one person left out, and that person guesses as many words as possible in sixty seconds. After each player on both teams has had a shot at guessing (and both teams have had the same number of turns), the team with the most words guessed wins.

name: Trick Track
description:
A tile-laying game with a train theme. Players place stations and tiles to form a track layout, then take turns challenging their opponent to travel from one station to the other, picking up passengers on the way and modifying the track as required, in as few actions as possible.

Designed for the 2013 Two-Player Print-and-Play Design Contest.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: WordSmith Card Game
description:
In WordSmith, players continuously smith together cards to build words and score points. The game will challenge your literary skills and test your reflexes. Smith off against your friends and family to see who’s the best WordSmith.

All WordSmith cards contain different 2-lettered combinations. Players use a WordSmith Card from their hand with a WordSmith Card from the center play area (Workshop) to build words. Once a word is smithed, that player replaces the Workshop card with the WordSmith card used from their hand and keeps the Workshop card for points. A new WordSmith card is drawn to replenish the WordSmith card used from that player's hand.

name: Gunship: Green and White Carriers
description:
From the publisher's website

It’s every Gunship for itself in our highly-destructive Free-for-All Mode!

Form temporary truces as you must guard from attack from more than one direction. But remember: Only ONE side will be left standing when the debris field clears!

Set includes one Green Carrier Board and one White Carrier Board. Also includes two standard 12-sided dice.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Dust Tactics: Axis Kampfgruppe Stefan Starter Set
description:
The year is 1947. The war that started a decade ago has now spread worldwide. The discovery of a crashed alien spacecraft in the Antarctic has led to the development of revolutionary combat walkers that surpass the most advanced tank technology. Old alliances have fragmented and new ones arisen as three major blocs, the Allies, the Axis and the Sino-Soviet Union (SSU) fight the world over for VK, a valuable new resource that power their new fighting machines.

Dust Tactics is a miniatures board game for 2 or more players. The Axis Kampfgruppe Stefan starter set contains everything you need to start playing Dust Tactics, including 10 highly-detailed plastic miniatures, unit cards, terrain elements, special Dust dice, and the Dust rulebook. Enter the world of Dust and lead your Axis Kampfgruppe into battle against Allied or SSU Battlegroups.

Note: The rules and cards in this box are based on the version 2 rules, but are slightly different from and not completely compatible with the full Dust Tactics version 2 rulebook.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Lunte: Fire Distinguisher
description:
Lunte: Fire Distinguisher is an additional card for the game Lunte. It is a 10 point fire extinguishing card; the base game only comes with 6, 5 and 4 point extinguishing/defusing cards.

Lunte is a fast paced card game, in which players add cards to a burning fuse, until someone detonates a bomb or extinguishes the fire. The aim of the game is to accumulate the highest number of points, by choosing the right moment to detonate or extinguish the burning fuse. Detonated bombs gain the player points, whereas extinguished cards are removed from the game.

The Lunte: Fire Extinguisher card is a promo card that was first released at Spiel '14, in Essen.

name: Escape: Zombie City – Queenie 2
description:
This queenie has 2 alternate zombies, a street tile and eight new item tokens.

The two new zombies, Hammer-Zombie and Combi-Zombi, are tough and will each take multiple players to defeat (respectively 7 fists and 3 fists + 3 bats).

The new street tile is "the shack" which can be used as a safe house for one player who can not make it back to the church.

The new items give the player actions they can perform, but they can not be stored in the van:

flashlight: explore an empty location and take a new item. Discard the flashlight.
defibrilator: as long as the player is carrying the defbrillator, one calm face heals every panic face (this helps all players sharing a tile with its owner)
crossbow: counts as a fist or a bat whenever you fight a zombie
map: allows a player to move to any tile with 2 runner icons (even traveling through buildings to get there)
backpack (3x): allows the player to carry 2 more items
kevlar vest: players can use their calm faces when zombies are on the same tile as the player
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Zombies

name: Der König der Löwen: Das löwenstarke Familienspiel
description:
The cards are put on the suitable fields on the board. You roll a dice and move your pawn as many fields, fields with no card or an other player on it do not count. You take the card your move ends on and take the corresponding action.
The game persists of 3 chapters, Simba as a child in the steppe, as a teen in the jungle and as an adult at Pride Rock, fighting against Scar.
You can leave the steppe after you have found 3 pairs of animals, you can leave the jungle if you own 3 particular cards. At Pride Rock you have to find 3 cards with a lightning on it and then reach the scar field with the exact number on the dice.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Assumptions
description:
A party game where players take turns acting as judge by drawing a character card with image of a person and all other players play from their hand a description of that person and then the judge determines which player's card best fits or is most desired. Similarity in game play to apples to apples and other games

DETAILED GAMEPLAY


Everyone has 7 red assumption cards in hand. Assumptions cards have red backs, and simple text on the front. Some are ridiculous, some are serious.
Player A draws a black character card from the pile without looking, revealing it to everyone else. Closing your eyes works. Holding it to your forehead works. So does holding it out in front of you.
Everyone else plays a red assumption card from their hand about the revealed character by putting it face-down. Players draw a new assumption card from the red pile so everyone's hands contain 7 cards.
Player A, with the character card still a mystery, flips the played assumptions cards one at a time, reading them aloud (and inherently drawing their own assumptions about the character they haven't seen yet). Then, FINNNALLLLY, they get to flip their character card. Lol.
Player A picks the assumption they think best fits the character. The person who played the chosen assumption is the winner, and keeps the character card, collecting it as a point earned.
That's it! Rotate Player A and repeat. The game ends when X points are reached, or Y time has passed (you make up these numbers), or everyone hates each other. Preferably, before this last one happens. Enjoy!
publishers: You Think This is a Game LLC

name: Five!
description:
Five! is a game with five set of rules, based on the same set of gaming pieces.
These are:

A simple tile placement game
A simple memory game
A bluffing game
A strategy game
A solo game.


It is mainly targeted at the refugees currently coming to Germany.
A crowdfunding will provide the games to the refugees.

In addition to a German and English rules book there are also Arabic, Farsi, Tigrinya and Urdu rules.

name: Optimo!
description:
Description from the designer:

Optimo! is a fast-paced word game in which you have to be the quickest to find the best word with each round's setting.

In each round, you have a combination of six cards with constraints (letter or lexical). These constraints can be a requirement (i.e. you must use the letter "E" or you must have six letters in the word) or a ban (i.e. you can't use verbs or you can't have a word with 4 or less letters).

Then you must find a word that corresponds to at least 4 constraints, then trigger the timer to give the other players 30 seconds more to find a better word than yours. Pondering if you should find a 5(or 6)-constraint word or go fast with a 4-constraint word to get the fastest-player bonus but risk losing it all to a better word is the core mechanic of the game.

name: Madstone Chronicles
description:
Madstone Chronicles is game of army building and engine building.

Each player starts with a commander of one faction; Elves, Humans, Vampires, and Goblins. Each faction has strengths and natural enemies. Players can recruit combatants from any faction, but some work together better than others. Players gain points from members of their armies, creatures and artifacts they've destroyed, and gold crystals. Players place cards into field of play to gain red crystals, they use those crystals for special effects and capturing and killing creatures. They can only attack another player's army when darkness falls. Every card is different and has special abilities.

So build the best army you can and fight for the most points! The game contains 68 cards, 4 commander cards, a game board, 20 poison tokens, 40 red clear plastic crystals, 20 yellow clear plastic tokens.

--description from the publisher:

name: Stoner Loonacy
description: Stoner Loonacy is a rapid fire card game in which players race to be the first to empty their hand by matching one of two images on each card in their hand with the images on the face-up piles in front of them. The number of piles varies depending on the number of players, and if players ever reach a moment in which no one can play, everyone draws a card and adds it to their hand at the same time, then the game play resumes.

name: North-East Ohio (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
A fan-made expansion of Northeast Ohio featuring prominent cities and rivers in the region.
Some moderate rule changes like:
- Removes Purple from the cube mix.
- Interurban city lines that prevent you from using them.
- $3 payment to use an Urbanization, Engineer or Production action.
- Cash minus shares and locomotive level determine if you've won - and by how much.

Two Production dice used.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Spined Threshers – Unit Expansion
description:
Call forth the greatest demons of the Ynfernael with the Spined Threshers Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! These grotesque monsters raze villages and can tear down castle walls with ease. Destroy your enemies and make mortals tremble with fear before you!

—description from the publisher

name: Crazier Eights: Avalon
description:
Sir Percival, the Round Table, Avalon, and many other cards from the world of King Arthur can help you win by getting zero cards in hand first. Avalon can be played as a stand alone game or an expansion – you may shuffle the cards into a larger deck.

Crazier Eights is a fantasy card game featuring classic artwork. Every card has a unique ability and the first player to have zero cards in hand wins.

There are thirty three unique cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Solo Sonderedition
description:
Your goal in Solo is to rid yourself of cards as quickly as you can. Most cards show a color and a number, and on your turn you need to play a card that matches the color or number on the card currently on top of the discard pile — but many action cards await in the deck that change what you can do! You can force the next player to skip a turn or draw two cards instead of playing; you can reverse the direction of play, choose a color that the next player must play, or force everyone to give their hand of cards to a neighbor.

The Solo Sonderedition is a 25th anniversary edition of Solo that contains two new action cards: "Gift", which allows the player to give someone else two cards, and "Protection", which prevents the player from suffering whatever negative effects might be directed their way.

name: Olive et Tom Classico
description:
- Select your players in the Junior League of Captain Tsubasa
- Choose your tactic.
- The match begins… Roll the dice and make the best action to beat the goal !

The game is based on the soccer anime Captain Tsubasa.

The game covers 3 matches, the first two are friendly matches. The last one is the Classico.

Before a match is the select phase.
You can make 2 actions between :
- Draw a new footballer (player card)
- Select a footballer by paying its value with your other cards.
The selected footballer goes on the field.

When the "Match" card is drawn form the deck, the match begins.

For a match, first you have to choose your tactic by positioning the footballers on the field.

Each footballer's card show arrows with numbers. The arrow represent occasions to pass the ball to the other players.

After that you roll 5 dice. The aim is to place a maximum of these dice on the arrows to show the direction of the ball between the footballers before the Goal.

The player who uses the most dice gain a point.

A friendly Match is done on 3 occasions, the Classico in 5.
The winner of the Classico also win the game.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building

name: Miner's Lagoon
description:
Miner's Lagoon is a resource management and worker placement board game for 2 to 4 players. You will take the role of a Mining Corporation CEO and try to outcompete your opponents. To this end, there will be a lot of decision making to be made.

You start with chosing your corporation out of the 2 possible corporations you were dealt. To build your strategy from the very beginning of the game, you will chose 2 secret objectives out of the 3.

Throughout the game, you will navigate islands to complete actions that suits best to your strategy.

These actions include:

- Recruit a Merchant
- Recruit a Miner
- Buy an Equipment
- Open up Galleries
- Operate a Mining Site
- Draw or Complete a Deal
- Make Shipment
- Enrich your resources / Buy enriched resources
- Trade
- Buy an artifact

With 2 different types of workers(Merchants and Miners), you and your opponents will try to reach 30 points to trigger the ending condition but that doesn't guarantee you the win.

Secret objective cards will determine the most successful Mining Corporation in Lagoon.

name: Dragonvault
description:
You are Citan the Gold, Dragon guardian of Merchants and Bankers.

There isn’t a coin of gold, silver, tin or jade in all of Dsyx that hasn’t been touched by your subtle hands. You had a busy day of treasure counting planned. Until the blasted heroes showed up looking to take it from you.

Dragonvault is a solitare roll-and-write game in which players take on the role of a dragon protecting its keep from treasure-seeking adventurers. Each turn, the player will roll dice to place traps at strategic locations along a winding path. At regular intervals, heroes (chosen by a die roll from a table) will show up and proceed along the path, triggering the player's defenses. Each hero has a special skill, however, giving them resistances and abilities to better thwart the beleaguered dragon.

Some heroes will fall; some will make it to the treasure store. After the time track has been exhausted, the player is scored based on how much treasure remains!


Released in the May 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Team Team
description:
As you might guess from the name, in Team Team you play in teams, with each team consisting of a speaker and a builder.

Each builder has a set of five tiles, with the tiles featuring five shapes, five colors, and five animals; each team's tiles have a different arrangement of these features. Each builder lays their tiles in a row in front of themselves, and they want to arrange these tiles in a pattern known only by the speaker, with the pattern being the same for all teams.

At the start of a round, one of the speakers reveals a sound card, such as "Woof!" or "Bong!", then they place a pattern card on a display that is visible only to the speakers. The pattern might be 3-5 animals in a row, 3-5 shapes in a row, or 3-5 colors in a row. Play then begins. Each builder starts by placing a finger on two different tiles, then their speaker will:


Make the sound once — Bong! — if the builder should finger different tiles.
Make the sound twice — Bong! Bong! — if the builder should switch the fingered tiles.
Make the sound thrice — Bong! Bong! Bong! — if all of the tiles are arranged properly. At this point, the builder slaps the multicolored tile in the center of the table. If this team's tile arrangement is correct — and with only 3-4 tiles depicted on a pattern card, the tiles must be in the proper order and adjacent to one another — then they claim the pattern card as a point. If they are incorrect, then each other team scores a point.


The first team to score 3 points wins.

name: ボブジテンきっず (Bob Jiten Kids)
description:
User summary
ボブジテンきっず (Bob Jiten Kids) is a standalone expansion of Bob Jiten.

Game play is the same as Bob Jiten, except that new character Natasha is introduced. While Natasha is active, question master may not say color words either.

name: Dwarven Miner Reforged
description:
Battle for honor in this multi-tiered crafting game. Delve into the mine to gain treasure, resources, and even a few shifty Burglars along the way. Use these to craft and purchase weapons, armor, magic, and gear for the brave adventures that come your way. Each one you help will grant you honor and their unique talents will be at your disposal. However, vicious Orcs lurk in the shadows and will strike out when least expected.

Dwarven Miner Reforged is a new and exciting sequel to the beloved Dwarven Miner. Featuring new rules as well as original and legacy artwork by legendary fantasy artist Larry Elmore, you will return to delve deep into the mine again and again.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Strascendance
description:
This game is inspired by the dancing plague that occurred in Strasbourg in 1518.

500 years later... the plague is coming back.

Strascendance is a placement board game where you are playing a killjoy who is trying to stop the progression of the dancing mania. With dices and pawns you will choose between protecting your places from the plague or bringing it to your enemies.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Events

name: Black Powder: Glory, Hallelujah!
description:
Glory Hallelujah! – the American Civil War 1861 – 1865 supplement for Black Powder.

In 1860 Abraham Lincoln was elected President of the fledgling United States of America. Years of seething hostility between the North and South boiled over as the Southern States saw Lincoln’s election as a direct threat to their rights, and the nation fell apart as a new Confederacy was formed in the South. The Confederacy, striving to assert its independence, opened fire on the Northern troops occupying Fort Sumter in Charleston Harbour on April 12th 1861. Determined to preserve the Union, Northern troops headed south and on to Richmond! Over the next four terrible long years American armies tramped across American fields and burnt American farms as Americans killed Americans in a war the likes of which the nation had never seen before. The epic battles fought during the American Civil War proved beyond all doubt that war can be ‘all hell’.

This supplement for Black Powder describes the history, armies, key leaders, doctrine and tactics of the American Civil War, and includes a comprehensive set of army lists and optional rules for recreating the battles of that war in miniature.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Bank Alarm
description:
You and your team have been contacted by the boss, challenging you to pull off the heist of the century: crack a safe filled with gold in 5 minutes or less and collect $50 million in cold hard cash!

Work together as a team and follow the instructions carefully to open the safe and walk away ridiculously rich. Do you and your team have what it takes to complete the mission?

—user summary

Ihr sollt den Coup des Jahrhunderts landen! Ihr seid ein Team. Arbeitet zusammen, tut genau, was der Boss euch sagt und macht keine Fehler.Wenn ihr alles beherzigt, dann könnt ihr es schaffen. Habt ihr ausreichend Teamgeist für dieses kooperative Spiel? Dann beweist es: Hört auf den Boss, knackt den Tresor und schnappt euch die Kohle!

—description from the publisher (German)
mechanics: Action Timer, Cooperative Game, Kill Steal

name: Velodrome
description:
Velodrome is a game about indoor cycle racing. Each turn, every player selects a speed for their bike. Will they wait out the others and save their energy, or start to race for the finish line? Passing the line gives a number of points according to a cube drawn — but the next pass may be much more valuable! Furthermore, the used speed tiles are passed to your opponents.

The first person to reach a certain number of points wins.

name: YANASI
description:
BACKGROUND
Players incarnate Cherokee tribefolk trying to setup their own buffalo herd (Buffalo is "Yanasi" in the Cherokee language).

OBJECTIVE
Ideally, capture a family of buffaloes else, capture as many buffaloes as possible.

COMPONENT
50 tiles (including 5 Path tiles), 1 Snake token, and 1 Cherokee pawn/meeple/cube (not provided).

END OF THE GAME
A player wins if he or she has 3 identical Buffalo tiles.

Else, game immediately ends if the draw pile is empty. In that case, the player with more Buffaloes illustrated on his or her tiles is the winner.

In case of a tie, the second player wins as the Snake bites the first player!

—description from the designer

name: PixBlocks
description:
PixBlocks serves as tool for the development of programming and imagination. By solving the tasks, the player builds a program that is executed by a moving rabbit. A job well done - getting the rabbit to eat the carrots - is a well-written program. The game includes tasks for both single and many players. Quests have different levels of difficulty.

Gra służy rozwojowi wyobraźni programistycznej. Rozwiązując zadania, gracz buduje program, który jest wykonywany przez poruszającego się królika. Dobrze wykonane zadanie – doprowadzenie królika do marchewek – to dobrze napisany program. Gra zawiera zadania zarówno dla jednego gracza, jak i dla kilku. Zadania mają różny poziom trudności.

name: Band Grab
description:
Band Grab is a fast-paced music-themed strategy card game where players race to collect a winning set of groovy musician cards for their band.
Players can steal band members, recruit powerful supporters and play game-changing event cards along their journey to playing their band's first gig. But to play a gig, a player's band must first contain musician cards with enough matching genre icons.
While the simple structure of this card game is easy-to-learn for a wide range of ages and abilities, there is plenty of scope for careful scheming, tense retaliation and varied replayability!

—description from the designer

name: X-Scape: Der geheime Pfad
description:
An exciting Escape Room game for at home

You have discovered the secret path of the Ascaní! It leads you to a mysterious villa that is full of secrets. Can you decipher the clues and solve the puzzles together?

This Escape Room game is all about solving puzzles in as little time as possible. Lateral thinking and joint puzzling are called for here!

name: The Day is Ours!: The Battle of Princeton, 1777
description:
The Day is Ours! The Battle of Princeton, 1777, simulates this crucial battle of the American Revolutionary War. Following their surprise victory at Trenton, the Americans marched throughout the night to strike at the rear of the British-held city of Princeton. Washington urged his troops on, declaring “The day is ours!”

—description from the publisher

name: Blots Card Game
description:
Players try to predict what Roscharch-style blots on each card mean to another player.

The first player turns over 2 cards - a blot card and a card with 3 possible answers. He also lays face down a number card choosing his answer. Other players lay a card face down, choosing the number of the answer they pick. Points are awarded depnding on the answers picked.

The first person to 10 points wins.

name: Магнитус
description:
Magnitus is a dexterity game for 2 to 4 people. At the beginning of the game, each player receives a set of magnets. In his turn, the player must put a magnet on the game board so that other magnets from the board are not attracted to it. If he fails to do this, then the player takes all this magnets in his hand.

The player who gets rid of all his magnets first wins.

В игре "Магнитус" Вам предстоит стать творцом галактики, но даже самым могущественным творцам приходится мириться с силой гравитации. Заполните свою Галактику новыми небесными телами и не дайте ей схлопнуться.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Roll & Write Railroads
description:
In Roll & Write Railroads, the players are new employees of a railroad company, having just left their families' bean farms. They were so good at running the bean farm, they were put in charge of all of the railroad projects. However, they have no knowledge of railroads! So they made a die out of a soybean their parents entrusted them with, and leave their fate up to it.

On a turn, a player rolls one more dice than the number of players. Then, in clockwise order, each player selects a die. The players then take an action based upon the die number. The actions involve laying track, building stations, and possibly gaining money. Later, players may unlock ways to enhance these actions.

Players may only build from left to right, and only on train lines they have opened.

After each player finishes their actions, they each take a second action with the unselected die. Then, the players score points based upon how far their stations have been built on each line.

After ten rounds, players sum their intermediate scores and also earn points for how many of their actions they enhanced. The player with the most points wins.

name: Mindbug: First Contact – Chuck Promo Card
description:
Originally available during the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter Air Pack.

Card description:
Play: Roll a 6-sided die. On 4 to 6, defeat an enemy creature and then repeat this effect.

name: FAR
description:
Build out your domain by adding a card to the Kingdom each turn. At the end of the game, each player scores the largest area of each of the four land types from their point of view - your seat at the table matters!
Expand carefully, as you can only score land if at least one unobstructed edge of that land is facing you. Your King and Queen can control land ANYWHERE in the Kingdom. However, land that is larger than 5 cards is too vast to score!
The player with the most points rules the kingdom!

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Renaissance, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Map Addition, Pieces as Map, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Who Killed Mia?
description:
When mega-influencer Mia Star gets murdered during a livestream to her fans, millions of viewers question who did it? It's up to you, the private investigators, to help solve the case. Use your smartphone to hack into Mia's online accounts, watch the livestream of the murder, and solve the puzzle to exonerate suspects and find the perpetrator. It's a killer game to play at dinner parties, with your college friends, or at your (adult) family gathering — guaranteed.

Don't leave this case unsolved. Use your smartphone, the physical evidence, and your wits to solve 3 packs of evidence — physical and digital — to find out Who Killed Mia. This murder mystery is intended for players 17+.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: I.A.: Installation Artist
description:
The world-famous Formosa installation art exhibition is about to launch. Introductions to all the works are scattered everywhere. Which introduction belongs to which work?
As an artist, you can get high scores if you can discern the code words of each work and find the correct name.
In addition, players also have to name a certain work. The name must be related to the concept displayed by the work, but also have a sense of haziness. When other people's guesses are mixed, they can also get points.
At the end of the game, the person with the highest total score wins!

name: The End of Abd-el-Krim: Morocco 1926
description:
Game with Alea Magazine issue 12.

The game is a simulation of the final campaign fought in Morocco in 1926, between the forces of Spain and France against the "Rif" revolt in Moroccan tribesman led by Abd-el-Krim.

name: Disaster Looms!: Founders Launch Pack
description:
This is a set of 18 Exploration tiles offered with the Disaster Looms! Kickstarter campaign. They contain two additional events and four more region tiles per game phase.

These additional tiles can be used to add a bit more game length, or to add additional replay value, length, or mystery to the treasures - and dangers - that space has to offer.
categories: Economic, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Da bockt der Bär
description:
Da bockt der Bär (a.k.a. The Mouse, Goat, and Bear Race) is a roll-and-move game that allows one player to decide whether another player's pawn will move like a mouse, go like a goat, or barrel along like a bear.

At the start of a round, you draw one card that you can either keep or give to another player. The card that you are left with then dictates whether your pawn is a mouse, a goat, or a bear. Each animal has its own die with its own advantages and disadvantages: The mouse is slow but can take shortcuts; the bear can go very fast, but sometimes is too lazy to do so; and the goat is neither fast nor slow, the reliable choice. If you are the first to cross the finish line, you win.

name: Bewere
description:
Bewere is a short and entertaining card game for 2-5 players. The Game is played in 3 rounds. A round ends when the cards on the playing field form a full moon. Then the players transform into werewolves and try to increase their pack by biting as much villagers as possible. But be careful, you don't want to bite your victims to death. Also be aware of silver bullets. Whoever has the most combinations of bite- and villager-cards gets the most points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Take That

name: Trap
description:
From the box:

Trap is a fast-playing, exciting version of an ancient oriental game.

On a board with hexagonal spaces, each player has three men and a fistful of wall segments. On a turn, the player can do one of the following:

1. Move one man two spaces (doesn't have to be in a straight line.)
2. Move two men one space each
3. Move one man one space, and place a wall between two spaces.
4. Place two walls.

The object is to trap the opponent's three men so they can't move.

name: THE PIT: The Board Game
description:
The agents of SOLFORCE have been given a mission - infiltrate THE PIT, a diabolical alien super-laboratory, and destroy the evil mastermind in command.

THE PIT: The Board Game is a sci-fi dungeon-crawler adventure set in the SWORD OF THE STARS universe of video games. 1-4 Players take their pick from 4 SolForce soldiers and 3 non-Teran operatives as they make their way through the hallways and rooms of THE PIT.

Players take turns searching for supplies, looting rooms, and battling monsters as they make their way deeper and deeper into the facility. To win a game of THE PIT: The Board Game, Players must defeat the Lord of the Pit on the final floor.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: dabong!
description:
2 - 5 players take turns laying down cards in a central pile. Instead of the basic suits found in a standard deck of cards, dabong! uses Earth, Wind, Water, and Fire.

The most common way a player lays down a card is by matching the suit or number of the card in the pile to a card in the player's hand. However, there are additional options to play the players can play cards of the same suit that add up to the number in the middle. For example, if a 10 of Fire is in the central pile, a player could play a 2, a 3, and a 5 of Water all at the same time.

A player wins when he/she has used all of his/her cards, or through a dabong! A dabong occurs when a players cards add up to the central card, regardless of suit.

name: Myth: Syclopt Boss
description: "Syclopt", The Cyclops Boss comes with a large miniature and a deck of new darkness cards for use with Myth.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: The Great Races
description:
A simple dice game using a dedicated scoring sheet. Players in turn roll four dice and gather them into pairs. Each line of the scoresheet represents a separate race to accumulate multiple rolls for each value between 2 and 12. Mark the scoresheet to record completion of one race segment for each of the two totals rolled.

First to complete all race segments for a particular value wins that individual race. Game ends when all races have a winner.

Published as a paper-and-pencil game in the box (6 games included, The 6 Pack of Paper & Pencil Games (1974), and elsewhere.

By similarities in both the basic gameplay and the scoring track it seems a predecesor to another Sackson game, Can't Stop, yet here there are different movement rules and winning condtion.

Comparing key elements (with Can't Stop in parenthesis):


only one roll per turn (push-your-luck element of multiple rolls)



point values assigned individually for each race, with full value given to race winner and reduced value to second place finisher (no scoring)



win game with highest tally after all races completed (win game by completing any three)
publishers: Eagle-Gryphon Games, Games International, GAMES Magazine, Gamut of Games

name: Triles
description:
Triles is a two player abstract strategy game of loops, lines and points. It can be played on any flat surface (no board).

The rules of Triles are simple: place tiles adjacent to those already in play such that the colours of the tracks match. Some actions are forbidden, the others give you a bonus. The objective is to empty your own hands.

name: Ephyran
description:
The story

Athena is known for being the goddess of war, but she was also the goddess of peace, the protector and the guardian of the city. She didn’t like battles, and on the contrary, she was delighted when she was able to stop a fight. This is why she asked to the gods of the four elements: Poseidon, god of seas and waters, Gaia, goddess of earth, Aether, god of air, and Hephaestus, god of fire ; to build a prestigious city-state: EPHYRAN! Each deity would be represented by its element and the aim would be to bring all the mythological creatures representative of the elements to live together! The deities got quickly down to work: a Blue Lagoon for the sea creatures, a Sacred Land for the earth creatures, a Forbidden Forest for the flying creatures and a Fire Mountain for the fire creatures…

It seems Athena couldn’t meet the challenge and today, the city-state has totally disappeared. Totally? It is heard that the present-day town of Corinth is a vestige of the city-state and that is was actually built on EPHYRAN ruins…

The proof is that the city symbol is nothing but a winged stallion: Pegasus!

Game overview

Each player takes the role of one of the gods and has to build the city-state of Ephyran as prestigious as possible. The city-state must be composed of the 4 gods’ territories (each territory being divided into 4 areas): Poseidon’s lagoon (blue), Hephaestus’s mountain (red), Aeolus’s forest (green) and Gaia’s lands (brown).
To get the highest prestige, you will have to vary the mythological creatures that will live in your city, and add magical tokens offered by the gods. You can also try to get some of the areas which already come with these tokens...

A game round

On each round, the players can choose between one of the following actions:
Add a Territory to their city (if possible) displaying them according to the territory type next to its god (only one copy of each territory is allowed in a city!).
Play a Support card.
Change a (non-covered) territory of their city by discarding it and replacing it immediately by another one.
Discard a card.
To end their round, the players take a new card on the top of the pile or of the discard pile.

End of the game

The game ends when the pile is empty (without taking into account the discard) or when a player puts the 16th card of his city-state.
Then the turn ends so that the players play the same number of cards, then it’s time to count the prestige points.

name: Garfield Kids' Card Game
description: Everyone knows Garfield loves to eat lasagna, play with Pooky, sharpen his claws on Jon's favorite chair, and tease Odie. Be the first to collect 4 cards of any one of his favorite things, and Garfield says you're the winner!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: History of War: Italian Expansion Set
description:
The Italian Set is an expansion for the base-game History of War. It uses the same game mechanics but introduces the Italian forces into HoW. As always there is a solid mixture of base improvements, territory improvements, units and action cards. The Italian expansion also introduces a new card type: the upgrade. These cards can be played on units and give them some unique abilities. The Italian Set may not be played stand-alone although it has starter-size too!

Expands

History of War
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: I Giochi del 2000: Atlantic Wars
description: A small set of rules for playing with miniatures in scale HO and 1/32.

name: Monuments: Pergamonaltar
description:
With this MONUMENTS - Wonders of Antiquity expansion No.2 the Game gets even more sophisticated. Create a set of three cards with different symbols (ship, scroll, helmet) and buy Pergamon from the bank using one action.
From now on you may use one action to score additional victory points during the game. Count all complete sets in all players displays and score according points.
Beware: The other players may spent one action and three cards to steal the tile from you to get the option of further victory points from what was meant to be useless stuff.
You need not consider Pergamon - but be sure your opponents will!

name: Schinderhannes: Julchen
description:
Schinderhannes: Julchen, the first expansion for the 2009 board game Schinderhannes, is meant for two-players only, with the players going head-to-head to achieve their personal goals first. More specifically, four crimes have to be committed on specified locations by the end of the game, with each player having two crimes which he has to locate.

While the game material is language independent – other than the city-names, which are not translatable – the first edition rulebook will be in German only. Schinderhannes: Julchen is limited to an edition of 250 copies.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Puzzle

name: Red Sand Black Moon: Fantasy Gladiatorial Combat
description:
The Gladiators of Ancient Rome sometimes, but not always, fought to the death for the amusement of the crowd. If a Gladiator fought well he could appeal for mercy in the hope that his performance had earned him a reprieve.

NOT SO IN THE WORLD OF TALOMIR.

Talomir, the fantasy world of Warrior Heroes and Rally Round the King, offers no such luxury. Gladiatorial combat thrives in Talomir but it’s strictly on the job training. There are no Gladiator schools or benevolent Patrons that will provide you the chance to learn your craft. Instead you learn on the battlefield or in some cases the back alleys of the decadent cities of Tropilium or Demeskeen, home of the largest arenas. But more than likely you’ll just die in some rat infested arena in a backwater town.

Ah, but if you succeed Fame and Fortune await.

Red Sand Black Moon uses mechanics similar to those found in Red Sand Blue Sky, the immensely popular game of Ancient Roman Gladiators. But Red Sand Black Moon takes it a step farther.

It allows you to fight gladiator matches with any fantasy figure you may already have!

Red Sand Black Moon has over twenty fantasy races with sixty plus characteristics or Signatures that allows you to create your own unique gladiator. Want to play a Troll? Yep. Demon? Got it. Dashing Knight? You bet!

Like all Two Hour Wargames games Red Sand Black Moon can be played solo or same side against the game mechanics as well as head to head against your friends

Red Sand Black Moon includes:

20+ pre-generated opponents in paper counter form.
A campaign system to track the progress of your gladiators.
An arena to fight your matches.
And as much detail as you want to use.


Red Sand Black Moon - THE fantasy gladiator game!

Gameplay comments:
Player (or players) generates their character in a way similar to RPGs but lighter. Then the character is pitted against randomly generated opponents (or gladiators generated by other players) on an arena divided into several zones. The closer to the heart of the arena, the better for the fighter.

All fights are fought to death of one opponent. In addition to standard attacks, some creatures are capable of special attacks like biting, spitting or tail attacks. Initiative is determined randomly and models react to their opponent's actions, so it's not a typical IGOUGO game.

For those who are familiar with Two Hour Wargames, this game is more detailed, as it aims at much lower number of miniatures than their other games.

Campaign rules allow to follow your gladiator on their journey to the heart of the empire, where most powerful enemies and greatest glory awaits.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: The Resistance: Additional Plot Cards
description: Mini-addon to The Resistance in the form of four new Plot cards, created by Piotr Haraszczak and added to magazine Świat Gier Planszowych #24.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Hedron
description:
Hedron is a tiny epic space battle that combines abstract strategy with thematic gameplay and dynamic mechanics. The game uses polyhedral gaming dice to represent factions of warring energy beings. The core mechanic of the game has players make a single move each turn which they can build into a chain of movement allowing you to move your fleet across the battlefield. Players will also gain access to dynamic powers through flux cards, allowing them to use their fallen warriors to fuel more powerful attacks. Players will gain victory by showing they’re the most powerful set of hedrons in the whole sector through dominating areas of space and destroying your opponent’s hedrons.

Throughout gameplay, players are faced with balancing their current options and opportunities with the need to gain resources and maintain a strong board presence. Is it better to use this hedron as a warrior on the board, or better to keep it for dynamic attacks? At the end of the game, players will add their total energy on the board to their points total to determine the final victor.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Myth: Quest Expansion 2
description: A small deck of cards containing new quests for Myth. These cards get shuffled into the existing deck.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Level 99 Games Microgames Collection
description:
10 single-postcard games that you can play anywhere.

Initially it was to consist of 5 microgames but as a stretch goal it was expanded to 10 microgames.

name: The Society of Eccentric Inventors
description: The Society of Eccentric Inventors is a board game for two to five players. Each player takes on the role of an inventor and member of the eponymous Society of Eccentric Inventors. In their boundless wisdom, the Society has decided to put together a friendly competition to determine the greatest inventor among their ranks. To win that fine honor, inventors must manage their resources and eccentricities and watch out for spies, as each inventor creates remarkable inventions to impress and outdo his or her fellow Society members.

name: The Devil's Bedpost
description:
The Devil's Bedpost - A quick 2 player game of card drafting.

As working class MUBs (monsters under the bed), your and your opponent dream of becoming middle monster management in the Devil’s hellish hierarchy. To that end you decide to compete in the annual MUB evaluations. You are each given a target bedroom and all the devilish tools at your disposal to keep your sleepy victim awake all night. The MUB who earns the most points after eight hourly rounds of mayhem and mischief will get a promotion, the other MUB... well, they’ll get what’s coming to them...

Setup:
Shuffle the deck of cards and deal 16 cards to each player. The remaining two cards will form a discard pile. That’s it.

Game Phases:
There are 3 phases to each round:
1. Play 2. Discard 3. Pass.

1. Play:
During this phase each player will play one card from their hand face down, then reveal at the same time and place it in their ‘bedroom’. On the first turn, players will place the card down in front of them. On consecutive turns each additional card will be placed adjacent to one already played. Cards will form a rectangle of 8 cards by the game’s end. It does not matter which end of the card line the adjacent card is played to.

Each bedroom has 4 sides and 4 corners. Top and bottom sides of the bedroom are opposite each other. Left and right sides of the bedroom are also opposite each other. Cards may never be moved in a bedroom unless the special action on a card allows it.

After playing a card each player must use the special action of that card, if applicable.

2. Discard:
Players now each discard from their hand face down to the discard pile.

3. Pass:
Players now pass their remaining hand of cards to the other player.

Game End and Scoring:
After each player has placed their eighth card in their bedroom, and discarded the final card from their hand to the discard pile, the cards are scored.

The top of each card shows its point value (as well as a small black number which shows how many of those types of card are in the deck).

Many of the cards have special actions which give scoring bonuses depending upon position and/or number of cards. The player with the highest score is the winner. If players are tied, the player who sleeps the longest the next night is declared the winner.

name: Poison Bottles
description:
Poison Bottles is a card game with many classical elements entwined. Each player has a 3x3 grid of facedown cards in front of them, for which they will try to secretly change as the game progresses in hopes to achieve the lowest score possible.

There are five distinct phases in the game, starting with trick taking, where a high card of the first played suit will win. If a poison bottle is played in the trick, the rules are reversed and the low card wins.

In the next two phases, peeking and swapping, every player is allowed to look at any one card on any players board, followed by the losers of the trick swapping one card from their board with a card from their hand. A marker is then placed on one card of each players board to protect it from being attacked.

The attacking phase follows, where the winner of the trick then takes a card from an opponents board, and swaps it with one from his hand, leaving the card face up for the rest of the game. This is repeated for each opponent.

The final phase is the drawing phase, where players draw back up to a five card hand. These phases are repeated until a player cannot draw a card, upon which the game ends immediately. Players then reveal their boards and count up their points, however, if a player manages to get three of the same number card in a row or column, that row is eliminated and now worth 0 points. Similarly, if a player manages to get a row or column of three poison bottles, that row or column becomes worth -30 points. Poison bottles played in the trick taking phase are worth -3 points to that player at the end of the game.

There are elements of hearts, nines, and memory in the game, with a focus on bluffing and heavy player interaction.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Ninja All-Stars: Mochizuki
description:
Mochizuki is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin popular choices for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

Mochizuki is a potent ranged threat, able to lay down an uncommon amount of fire for a single model. Mochizuki provides excellent benefit to teams lacking long range firepower or as an answer to opponents with uncommonly fast, and difficult to pin down, ninja.

Mochizuki eschews her school’s preference for subtle poisons or the concealed tanto in favor of the shock and power of paired pistols. Preternaturally swift and silent, Mochizuki is famed for appearing an instant before she turns her guns upon her target in a blaze of flame and thunder, and then vanishing again into the smoke.
publishers: Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Ninja Division, Soda Pop Miniatures, Ulisses Spiele

name: The Hard War
description:
The hard war is a small 2-player cardbased wargame with a strong political message. In the game, players take the roles of nationalist factions, locked in a brutal civil conflict. In the game the players try to take control of the 7 largest cities in the country by playing attack cards on them. The player who first gain 4 victory points wins the game.
HOWEVER, each attack card results in a hidden amount of civilian casualties. With special media report cards, players can reveal the actual number of dead and if the total exceeds 200.000, an armed UN-intervention occurs, resulting in an immediate end to the war. In the following war crimes tribunals, the player with the fewest dead are instead the winner.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Impossible Mode Taxi Drivers
description: Two impossible mode red mini figures and card that was given to Kickstarter backers.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Pixel Tactics: 2012-2017 Promo Pack
description:
From Game Boy Geek Kickstarter 2017 Campaign

48 cards for Pixel Tactics includes some previously released cards as well as new ones.

The cards feature characters from popular board games, game designers, publishers, and other notables from the industry
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Amazing Jungle Run
description:
You never thought your dream vacation would be like this!
You were expecting lavish huts and guided tours. Instead you were dropped off to fend for yourself in a jungle full of wild animals. You've always stood up to face challenges, and it's no time to stop now. Can you summon your skills to master the animals, find the most food, and emerge "King of the Jungle"?
Get ready, let's explore....

In Amazing Jungle Run, you'll compete to be the first player to reach 9 points. Points are collected by earning "fruit" cards or the valuable Shaman card, which is worth 3 points all by itself.

A players turn consists of three phases:

Action phase in which you can choose Resource cards, Peril cards, or peek at the bottom of main decks to see what may be hiding there.
Main phase in which you can choose to collect common cards(to gain 3 of a kind for special abilities) or "point" cards that get you closer to the win. Some resource cards allow you to do both in one turn. A player can manipulate decks with cards like "hideaway", "transport", or "explore" during this phase.
Defense phase in which you can keep a deck "off limits" or limit your opponents options with "quicksand".


The game invites imaginative play to form strategies, and tactical opportunities abound. The "hidden" knowledge aspect of being able to play from the bottom of decks keeps you on your toes.

Tension builds as the decks dwindle, and the higher points cards (planted in the bottom half of decks during setup)start to appear.

Have fun and be wary of pitfalls....it's a jungle out there.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Deduction, Dice, Exploration, Memory
mechanics: Automatic Resource Growth, Chaining, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hidden Victory Points, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Shards of Infinity: Saga Collection
description:
In Shards of Infinity, players must strategically tailor their decks, acquire new cards, and utilize allies and champions to reduce their opponents' health to zero. Only through meticulous planning and aggressive gameplay can one player emerge as the ultimate victor.

Shards of Infinity: Saga Collection is an entry point into the ever-expanding universe of Shards of Infinity as it contains the base game, all expansions, and all promo cards from the original edition, along with new and upgraded components. In addition to including the PvP, solo, and co-op modes, the Saga Collection introduces a new legacy mode that allows players to master gameplay from every set while delving into the game's lore. Additionally, the inclusion of a new Shard Master enables epic showdowns with up to six players.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: Yellowstone
description:
Play as the Duttons and work together to protect your family's Yellowstone ranch . . . no matter the cost. On every turn, use your wits and flex your grit to skillfully defeat Conflicts. Visit the bunkhouse to call in help from your loyal ranch hands. And when the action escalates . . . take 'em to the Train Station!
