Aki Jarvinen has posted cards and rules for GameGame 1.0… which he pitches as an attempt to do for games what Understanding Comics does for comics: that is, to provide insight into the nature of games in a game, in the same what that Understanding is both “about comics” and a comic.

Thus, his cards are things like “Goal” and “Environment” and “Victory/End Condition.” There’s both a coherent set of rules for determining victory and a roleplaying element: players must improvise what the game they are creating is like, e.g., describing what their “Victory/End Condition” is–but they can only have one if they have the relevant card.

Version 2.0 recently became available at the website below.

Website: http://gamegame.blogs.com/

name: Genial daneben: Das Spiel – Zusatzfragen
description:
Extra question cards for the game with the same name.

Expands:

Genial daneben: Das Spiel
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Mauerfall 89
description:
From the game's website (www.mauerfall89.de):
"Mauerfall 89" is a game with a political background which tries to focus the oblivion of the GDR (former eastern Germany). It deals with the fall of the Berliner wall in 1989. Goal of the game is the fall of the wall (respectively game stones) with demonstrations and attempts to escape - but the regime doesn't sleep...

"Mauerfall 89" was released in 2005 as a limited first edition.

name: Tower Siege Expansion: Elemental Adversaries
description:
"Elemental Adversaries" is a 15 card expansion pack for the non-collectible customizable "Tower Siege" fantasy card game (#4649).

It contains the following cards:
Arromus
Amulet of Spell Casting
Apprentice
Boiling Oil
Divine Light
Electrum Coin
Hidden Powerstone
Librahm of Sorcery
Lore Stone
Mine
Priest
Raze
Roklor
Shelter
Vein of Gold

Expands:

Tower Siege
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Tower Siege Expansion: Fiendish Foes
description:
"Fiendish Foes" is a 15 card expansion pack for the non-collectible customizable "Tower Siege" fantasy card game.

It contains the following cards:
Adventurer's Guild
Arcanium Stone
Barbarian
Battle Axe
Bloodlust
Exorcist
Fire & Brimstone
Hill Giant
Hidden Mine
Mine
Merchant
Platinum Coin
Power Surge
Ring of Resistance
Sarcophagus

Expands:

Tower Siege
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Tower Siege Expansion: Thaylen's Rogues
description:
"Thaylen's Rogues" is a 15 card expansion pack for the non-collectible customizable "Tower Siege" fantasy card game.

It contains the following cards:
Anti Magic
Altar of Power
Amulet of Resistance
Battle Fog
Scribe
Kenium Coin
Resist Magic
Ring of Skill
Onx Stone
Powerstone
Battle Chest
Yardov
Goblin Wizard
Orc Sorcerer
Ogre Warlock

Expands:

Tower Siege
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: All the Best Drinking Games in the World
description:
Printed by a book editor this is a compendium of about 50 games.. all of them are Drinking Games.
A little comic included for each game tells us if we are going to play a soft drink one or if we are going to
get drunk.

Each game has different number of players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Dice, Humor, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Team-Based Game

name: Alphabet Runner
description:
Alphabet Runner combines four games in one - a word, memory, board and card game - and a mix of skill and luck helps children with literacy and numeracy. The game helps children build and memorize three, four and five words and reinforces spelling, turn-taking and concentration.

Alphabet Runner promotes these skills:
Social interaction,
Communication skills,
Speaking and listening,
Small movements,
Hand-eye co-ordination,
Literacy skills,
Mathematical thinking,
Problem solving.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Memory, Word Game

name: Pindoo
description:
An abstract strategy board game for 2 to 6 players.
Taking turns and using dice, players must move their Pindoos (pieces) to the opposite side of the board before the opponent(s).

name: Il Prenditempo
description: "Take your Time" is a game issued by CGIL (one of the Italian Union of Workers). Players plan their 24 hours day with activities hour by hour (sleep, work, shopping, stadium, dancing and many others) and go around the city to complete their plan. Players can help each other to have a better life.

name: Arsouf 1191
description: A simple wargame on the battle of Arsouf (1191) between Richard the Lionheart and Saladin. This game is quite similar to Bouvines 1214 of the same publisher. It includes some nice chrome such as the Naffatums. The game materials are entirely in French.

name: Luchthavenspel Schiphol
description:
Players travel back and forth to Schiphol.

The person arriving back first wins.

Part of the game operates on the airport itself. After moving through check-in and security checks the player 'flies' to a destination and then flies back.
Has features in the game in order to try and stall or slow down the other players.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Fitness Challenge
description:
From the back of the box

It's the game that can help you lose weight!
Pick a Partner...and engage in a friendly competition.

The Fitness Challenge rallies you and your partner (spouse, relative, friend, co-worker) to exercise for eight weeks. It doesn't matter if you are just starting out or if you have been exercising for some time, The Fitness Challenge allows you to play no matter what shape you're in.

Game rules are designed to motivate you to exercise at least three days a week, every week, for eight weeks. From walking to mountain climbing, the range of workout choices accommodates any lifestyle.

With The Fitness Challenge Scorecard, you and your workout buddy get a fun and simple way to track your progress as you progress on your track. Pick from a selection of zany coupons to make up a Wager Book. The Wager Book is your incentive to stay on track... and your opportunity to stick it to your partner if they don't hold up their end of the bargain!

name: Attic Antics
description:
Attic Antics is a party game!

The game where you just might see a side of
your friends that you've never seen before.

This is much more than a drinking game!

Innocently enough you'll move around the board
collecting money for performing various acts of idiocy.
The first player to $5000 wins. Sound simple?
...not so fast. As the money moves around, some
players will be able to buy their way out of
potentially embarrassing situations - and some won't!
As the drinks flow and the money goes, so do the inhibitions! Have a camera ready,
this game is sure to fill a scrapbook with some hilarious pictures.

To see it, visit: www.nomanor.com
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Gilligan's Island Game
description:
Based on the CBS TV show. Ages 6 - 12.

Equipment includes game board, spinner, four stand-up characters (Gilligan, Skipper, Mr. Howell, and a money), a number of cardboard chits, and a 25 piece jigsaw puzzle depicting a raft.

name: Pavilion Cricket
description:
Pavilion Cricket is a year round game designed to simulate, as realistically as possible, the results, performances and individual averages of the real game. In order to achieve this, Pavilion Cricket consists of three separate games:

1. Domestic Cricket
This game covers domestic tour and one-day matches in England, Australia and the West Indies. A typical county match takes approx. 15 min. to play.

2. One-Day Cricket
This game covers One-day Internationals and Domestic finals. More detailed than number 1., a typical game takes approx. 60 min. to play.

3. Test match Cricket
This game provides a ball-by-ball simulation of a full five-day test match. As the most detailed of the three games, each day's play takes approx. 90 min. to play.

By using a combination of the three games, a full season or tour may be played on an ongoing basis.

The Teams Book provided details full squads of players for a broad range of teams; falling into three categories: Domestic, Current International (early 1990's, but later Team Books are available), and Modern Greats. The inclusion of the Modern Greats teams allows many previously unresolved debates to be tested. For example, how would the awesome South African side of 1970 perform against some of the great West Indian sides of the 1980's?

name: Civio
description:
From Publishers Website:

CIVIO is a strategy card game that explores the relationship of issues, freedoms, laws, and Supreme Court cases that have both strengthened and reduced civil liberties. Each player starts as an intern at a law firm specializing in civil rights. Using a handful of cards representing laws, Supreme Court decisions, constitutional amendments, key issues, rights and freedoms, players race to combine these cards into precedents.

name: History of War: Russian Expansion Set
description:
The Russian Set is an expansion for the base-game History of War. It introduces the Russian forces to History of War. This expansion has base improvements, territory improvements, units, action cards and upgrades as well as other sets of HoW - but is not playable stand-alone. The mixture of the cards concentrates on the new Russian units and is only supplemented by the other card types.

Expands

History of War
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Mini Pro Golf
description:
Players Tee-off from the 9 different Tee boxes and proceed down the fairways to the green.

Using the flag to mark the preferred hole on the green each player uses his driver/iron combo club to maximize vertical projection and distance finishing with his/her putter for sinking the final putt.

You can hook or slice the ball by changing the alignment of the club head for truly realistic shots just like you do on real golf courses.

Try to avoid coarse hazards such as water, trees and sand traps as you proceed down the 9 different fairways.

Keep track of up to four player scores at a time using the mini Pro Golf Score Card.

name: Crossings
description:
Crossings is an abstract strategy game for two players published in Sid Sackson's A Gamut of Games and Stephen Addison's 100 Other Games to Play on a Chessboard

It can be played with a standard set of Checkers.

The object of the game is to reach the opposite side of the board, while preventing the opponent from doing the same.

Reimplemented-by:
Epaminondas on a 14x12 board
publishers: Dover Publications, dtv (Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag), Hugendubel Verlag, Hutchinson, Random House, Inc., RBA Libros S.A.

name: Monkey, Ninja, Pirate, Robot Deluxe
description:
A venerable cabal bent on world-domination has sent one of their greatest champions to steal the reactor core... but so have their enemies. Bathed in atomic radiation, these champions fight to the death, in order to claim the sweet, sweet uranium for their people... and victory!

This is a game of marker-management where each combatant can manipulate their various character ratings (Attack, Defense, Mojo, etc.) each turn while trying to eliminate their opponent's tokens. Tokens can be replenished or stolen from the central pot. The player to eliminate all of his enemies first wins but variable character special abilities, usable on their turns, as well as random mutations can complicate the effort.

Re-implements:

Monkey, Ninja, Pirate, Robot

name: Don't Touch That Dial
description: Return with us now to those thrilling days of yesteryear, as players compete from coast-to-coast to build the most successful radio network. Players control NBC-Red, NBC-Blue, CBS or Mutual. They bid to purchase popular programs and hire stars to host them. They sell the shows to sponsors who will pay well to brand their products with the right show. They advertise in local markets to add listeners and increase ratings. The player with the most popular network at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Checkered Flag
description:
Checkered Flag is similar in nature to Formula 1 and Speed Circuit. Players choose their cars speed on a dashboard and move one space for every 20 miles per hour. The same dashboard is used to track fuel usage, tire wear and brake wear. Players also have a small hand of five cards that provide certain benefits when played. Unlike the other two games, Checkered Flag simulates stock car racing.

Given that speeds are more constant in stock car racing, there are only three speed choices; 60, 120 and 180 miles per hour. At the beginning of the race and after a pit stop, cars start off at 60. In the two turns, the maximum speed is 120. The turns drive the primary choices available, as some lanes provide a shorter path than others. The choice lanes have a cost in fuel usage or tire wear. The first car to complete three laps wins the race.

name: Cluster
description:
Cluster's playing board consists of forty six holes, of which twenty four are shallow and twenty two are deep. There are sixteen playing pieces, eight white and eight black. Within the set of eight there are four short pieces and four long ones. If a long piece is placed in a deep hole and short piece in a shallow hole, the the tops of the two pieces will be level.

The object of the game is to form a "cluster" before your opponent does. A cluster is when all of your pieces (one player has white and the other black) are in a group all next to each other and all of the tops of the pieces are at the same level.

name: Scrabble People
description: Each player is dealt four cards and must have only four cards in his or her hand at the end of each turn. The remaining cards form a "pick-up" pile with the top card turned over to form the beginning of a "put-down" pile. A player selects a card from either of the two piles and discards a card onto the "put-down" pile. Sir Scrabble and Muddler cards cannot be taken. A Sir Scrabble card can be discarded to take another turn. Conversely, a Muddler card can be discarded so that the next player will have to lose a turn. The "put-down" pile should be turned over, if all of the cards from the "pick-up" pile have been used. The winner is one who collects four cards of any of the following: queen, jeweler, baby, librarian, waiter, or zookeeper.

name: The King's Highway
description:
Components:

One Box with game rules printed on the top lid
One rectangular board
16 wooden disks (four for each player)
three spinners

Idea of the game:

Each player must get their four travelers (wooden disks) from the starting square along a path of spiraling squares to the "Inn" (the finishing square.) Players alternate turns spinning a spinner and moving one of their travelers the indicated number of spaces. Players cannot move a traveler to a space that is already occupied. Along the path is a "highwayman" space that requires the traveler to stop until the "highwayman" is paid (payment is made by spinning the correct color.) First player to get all four of their travelers to the Inn wins.

name: Sharks and Jets
description:
Two street gangs both alike in dignity,
In West Manhattan, where we lay our scene,
Do battle for their turf with pirouettes,
Leaping, spinning, fighting the Sharks and Jets.

This is a tactical combat game based on the musical West Side Story. Players control rival street gangs, The Sharks and The Jets, that are represented by individual counters. Gang members attack by snapping their fingers, singing and performing dance moves. They attempt to break the other gang's cool. Each character has a cool and uncool side. Leaders can rally uncool gang members. All combat is resolved on the Choreography Results Table.

name: Race Across
description:
Race Across is a puzzle game. A battery operated car (which can operate at two speeds) starts at one set of flag posts and you place tiles that cause the car to turn and twist through a maze you build to get to the finish line.

Designed to be playable by 5+ with fairly big chunky colorful tile pieces.

name: Branded The Game
description: Object of game: Only one man survived the battle of Bitter Creek. Since there were no witnesses it was assumed the lone survivor had run as a coward. Having being discharged from his countries service with his sword broken and his insignia removed, he was a man BRANDED as a coward. As this man goes through life, he must demonstrate over and over his strength and courage in an attempt to clear and remove his unwarranted stigma of BRANDED. As you travel the trail you try to be the first player to show your courage by covering the name branded on the scoring line with discs won in battle at the various areas.
categories: Adventure, American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Ha-Ha Hair-do!
description:
This is one of the games in the Tiny Tins series by Patch Products.

Each player is trying to collect a certain color of hair clips. On each turn, the player spins. If he spins take, he takes a hari clip of his color. If he spins put back, he must put one back in the center. If he spins Sparkly Headband, he takes possession of the Sparkly Headband, even from another player. The first player to have all four of his hair clips and the Sparkly Headband is the winner.

name: Round the Horn
description:
"Round the Horn" re-creates the annual race of grain-laden, square-rigged sailing cargo ships from Australia to London.

In the first phase of the game, each player draws Loading cards and discarding them until he has a "Lloyd's Certificate" designating the color of his craft and the amount of grain he must carry. Once a player has a certificate, he draws and keeps (or discards) Loading cards until he has the exact amount of cargo required.

Once fully loaded, a player enters the second phase of the game -- sailing. A player under sail chooses a sail state (full, 3/4, 1/2, storm), then draws a card and checks the resulting combination on their sailing wheel. There is a Total Loss card which, if followed by a second draw indicating bad weather or other calamity, can damage the player's ship or force him out of the game entirely.

The first player to arrive safely in London is the winner.

No copyright date is given, but a London game collector asserts the vintage for this game to be of the early 1930s. The subject matter is consistent with this estimate, in light of the Great Grain Race of 1932, and the box style (i.e., small label fixed to larger cover) fits that of the 1930s.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Path Blitzer
description:
In this game, the players try to build a contiguous path across a hexagonal grid. Each turn, a player rolls a pair of d10s; every cell in the grid is numbered, and a token may be played in a cell only when the number is rolled on one of the dice, their sum, or their difference. If one occupies two of the adjoining cells, it is possible to attack (by a risk-like 1-1 die comparison) a token belonging to another player: a successful attack replaces the token; an unsuccessful attack permits the defender to play an extra token using the two die rolls used during the attack. Dice that show a zero, or combine to zero or ten permit a placement anywhere; doubles may be additionally employed for additional turns.

The manufacturer says:
"Family fun for ages 8 through adult. Anyone can successfully play this game. And anyone can win, regardless of age, experience, or skill."

name: Zombie Dawn
description:
Zombie Dawn is Mystic Eye Games' game of survival horror. The object of the game is simply to be the first player to cross the zombie infested playing field or if you’re into sporting events, see how many zombies you can take down before they take you down. Zombie Dawn can be played solo or with a few friends.

17-pages. Written by Kenny Lewis (author of Giant Monster Rampage).

To play Zombie Dawn you will need the following items:
This rulebook
A horde of zombie (or other monster) miniatures (at least 50), and one survivor miniature per player.
A copy of the survivor record sheet or a blank piece of paper
Pencil
Tape measure or similar measuring device marked in inches
At least three 10 sided dice.

Purchasable download.

name: Knatsch: Katalog Edition 1
description: This is a 2-card expansion for Knights/Knights, with a new goal (Six 6s), and an extra card (6) to help meet that goal.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: From the Casebook of Nick Velvet
description:
"Why is this man smiling? He's got charm, sophistication, poise, and people are begging him to steal for them. But why steal such worthless bagatelles as an empty sugar packet or a juggling pin? For the challenge, for the adventure and, of course, for the money."

This book contains 4 new cases for use with Ellery Queen's Mystery Magazine Game. According to the cover, they are suitable for solitaire, co-operative, or competitive play.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based

name: The Machine
description:
From the website: http://www.jc-designs.net/themachine/index.html

The Machine was designed to be a board game that evolves over time, for 2-4 players. The story line is open ended so that new plots can be added and old ones can change. New cards, tokens, and board layouts can be downloaded, and printed to be used with the game, keeping the players interested, waiting to see what comes next. The Machine isn't just a machine. It is for the players to find out what it is and what it does.

The first phase of the board game is to control it before it destroys everything. If you can accomplish that, then there is a chance to see what secrets it has....if you live. If you have any questions or would like to make a suggestion for a card or have an idea for The Machine, please contact me using the contact button. This game is supposed to be open, anything can happen, so if your ideas are well liked, they will be added to the game

name: Babel 5
description:
Babel 5 comes from a small Japanese publishing firm. The set consists of 30 large dice and 15 small dice, and five molded towers which are placed on tiles. At each turn, the players throws two large and one small dice. The dice must be placed on the corresponding numbered towers. A 6 can be placed on any tower.
If a tower topples over, the player keeps the dice and calculates a score based on a scoring chart.
When all the dice have been thrown and the scores calculated, the player with the lowest score is the winner.

name: North Sea Campaign: 1914-1918
description:
from Panzerschreck Magazine #15 Minden Games with permission from Gary Graber.

North Sea Campaign is a strategic level World War I naval mini-sim for two players, where Britain's Grand Fleet squares off versus Germany's High Seas Fleet for control of the North Sea. Includes 8.5" x 11" full-color cardstock map, rules (including solitaire options), dozens of individual rectangle ship counters (dreadnought, battlecruisers, and pre-dreadnoughts) printed in full-color on cardstock, which must be cut out prior to play. The entire campaign plays out in UNDER an hour... and includes optional tactical battle rules for those of you who like a little more detail.

name: Breakout from the Crimea: Wrangel's Offensive
description:
Breakout From the Crimea covers General Wrangel's Russian White Army offensive from their trapped environs of the Crimea. Wrangel and his 25,000 men were evacuated from Novorisisk in March 1920, later reforming and re-supplied by the British. The Red 13th army was responsible for Wrangel's containment, as well as the Communist's attempt to break through to Sevastopol. In April, both sides tried in vain to achieve their goals.

Wrangel's forces were not numerically as strong as the 13th Army, but their morale, as well as skillful use of tanks and aircraft, returned the balance of power to their favor. By May 1920, Wrangel had up to 20 operational tanks and an equal number of DH9A bombers. Their tankers and pilots trained since March, and learned well the lessons taught by their British advisors in combined arms tactics.

During the battle, both sides fought tenaciously, but it was the use of tanks and aircraft that tipped the scales. The DH9A bombers faced little Red air opposition and ﬂew constant missions over the front. The tanks were massed into a hammering force for a breakthrough. All of these lessons were ignored by Wrangel's former superior, General Denikin, a year earlier. To supplement the attack, Wrangel also had several divisions land along the Black Sea coast, which was weakly held by the Communists. By June 12th, the Communist 13th Army lost 8,000 men and was ﬂeeing to the protection of the Dniepr River. Wrangel, lost nearly the same amount and exploiting the White victory was not easy. The Reds counter-attacked a few days later and brieﬂy retook Melitopol. Eventually, the

Whites recaptured the city and the lines became static, with neither side having the strength to overcome the other.

Components
(High Flying dice edition):

Four 11" x 17" map sections
Two sheets of 280 playing pieces
One Players' Aid Sheet
One, 12 page rule book


(Firefight edition):

one 11 x 17 map
280 DTP counters
categories: Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
publishers: Firefight Games, High Flying Dice Games

name: Zingamino
description:
Zingamino is dominoes with a twist. It is played on a board with four interconnecting circles.

The game uses domino-like tiles with colored dots in four colors - orange, green, purple and yellow - and 16 tiles in each group that must be played in the corresponding colored circles. The connecting colored circles can be bridged with doubles tiles or "wild" Zinga tiles.

If you have no tile that can be played, you have to draw new tiles until you do. The winning player is the first to score 64 points.

name: Operation Leopard: Leros, 1943
description:
Operation Leopard depicts the amphibious and air assault on the island of Leros which occurred November 12-16, 1943.The Germans airdropped a battalion of paratroops while conducting an amphibious assault against the island held by the British 234th brigade.
The game is tactical in nature with operational elements in the planning and conducting amphibious landings. Both sides are equal in forces until the paratroops arrive.

name: Battlefleet 1900
description: This is a free, web-published set of miniatures rules for ships circa the turn of the century. It utilizes commands/simultaneous movement and a rather interesting damage allocation system. Published by the War Times Journal, an organization that produces historical conflicts articles as well as a set of shops for miniatures.

name: Suffren aux Indes
description:
Suffren in India is a wargame (for 2 players) published in French magazine Vae Victis #34.

It is dedicated to the incredible naval campaign in India (1782-1783), where two equally able admirals fought each other: Hugues for the English side, Suffren for the French side.

name: Head-On Baseball
description:
From the box:
"Head on baseball, an audio cassette boardgame is a whole new ballgame! You are the manager. You make the key decisions and a radio announcer calls the play by plays. It's real baseball strategy, with the excitement of hearing the highlights broadcast on the air."

This is a 2 player game that roughly simulates a game of Baseball. There are 30 batter cards (15 each team) and 24 pitcher cards (12 per team).
The cards have a red tinted window that line up 'decoder style' to reveal the outcome of the at bat. Periodically the outcome will be "xx tape xx" which means to activate the audio cassette tape included and listen to the "play by play action". The announcer will then tell you the outcome of the play.

The rules suggest not rewinding the cassette tape until reaching the end of the tape, thus keeping some level of randomness. There are about 200 calls on the tape prerecorded.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Trapped!  Ellery Queen's Great Mystery Game
description:
Who was the murderer? What was the motive? What was the time?

Trapped! Ellery Queen's Great Mystery Game is a deduction game released by Betty-B in 1956 and stars the fictional detective Ellery Queen, created by authors Frederick Dannay and Manfred B. Lee. The game features the "new" three dimensional playing board with the exclusive built-in Gravity Spinner.

name: Linebacker Football
description:
Each coach has a team consisting of 23 players of differing ability ratings. At the start, each coach secretly assigns each of his players to an offensive or defensive position which he will play throughout the game. Position assignments are revealed simultaneously and cannot be changed.

On a play from the line of scrimmage, the coach on offense secretly records his play selection, choosing from 47 possible plays. The coach on defense then commits each of his linebackers to 1 of about 20 particular strategies, e.g., "Key on Fullback", "Cover Flat Zone (Pass)", or "Blitz". The play result is decided by a die roll referred to a chart, modified heavily by the relationship between the called play and the linebacker assignments and by the ability ratings of the key players involved.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Ten Thousand: The Battle of Cunaxa, 401 BC
description:
This wargame by Richard Berg simulates the interesting Battle of Cunaxa in 401 BC.

This battle took place after both the Greek vs Persian Wars of 500-479 BC, and immediately after the Peloponnesian War of 431-404 BC. During the course of the battle the Persian Prince Cyrus died which ended his revolt against his brother King Artaxerxes. The famous retreat of the ten thousand Greek auxiliaries (which fought for Cyrus) was the result. The Greeks were led by the Athenian General Xenophon. This Greek army had to fight its way back to Greece through the hostile Persian Empire (from Mesopotamia and across Asia Minor). The Greek city of Sparta renewed the war against Persia in 399-394 BC.

name: Pantin Nocturne
description:
A miniatures game set in the role-playing universe of Mechanical Dream. Pantin Nocturne uses an ordinary chessboard, or terrain broken into a similar grid, to regulate the movement of its miniatures. Playing pieces are referred to as "puppets" and are divided into "pawns" and champions," with varying abilities. Each player utilizes a "cell" of eight puppets. The game is resolved without the use of of dice.

The rule book and the two Cells required to play are each sold separately. A playing board ~ chess, checkers, or other similar grid ~ must be supplied to play the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Sesame Street Fair
description:
Description from rules:

Come on over to Sesame Street and be there for a STREET FAIR. Grover is serving cookies from his stand, and the merry-go-round is beckoning. You might even get your picture taken by Maria.

The winner is the first player to arrive at 123 Sesame Street with a cookie. For a longer game, get 3 cookies. Go back to start and go around twice more.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cube Squared
description:
From the back of the box:
"Taking Strategy to the Next Power"

Cube Squared is an exciting two player strategy game. The object of the game is to be the first player to get a complete set of cubes and cylinders, in each of the six colors, off the board and onto their twelve "Home Spots".

This is a classic 2-Player, Abstract Strategy Game where each player is trying to be the first to get a complete set of rainbow colored cubes and cylinders past the square marked with a "star" and off onto their side of the board.

Each game is new and exciting because every game starts with an empty board and players take turns placing one piece at a time anywhere they want on the board except for the two "Home Squares" that have a "star" on them near each end of the board. It doesn't matter if they place a cube or a cylinder or even which color it is because no one player "owns" any piece until it is safely off of the board and onto one of their "home spots" on their side of the board.

Movement rules are pretty short and simple with the key fact being that if there are two pieces of a particular color and shape on the board, those pieces can move either once or twice and once they are
down to one piece, they can only move once. The other main rule is that you MUST get your cube of a color off the board before you get the matching cylinder off the board.

The ability to jump other pieces and move either type of piece, the fact that no one "owns" pieces until they remove them from the board makes for a depth of strategy seen in very few games.

When you add the fact that there is no set starting position for the playing pieces, you will soon see that this game is almost "Bottomless" which gives it the ability to be studied and played for years, if not decades before anyone will ever figure out if there is an optimal setup

name: Hochzeit Mattenklotz
description:
Jürgen and Colette are getting married today, but just before the ceremony Colette disappears. Where is she?

All players (4 male, 4 female (+ 1 m/f)) should act out their roles to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer.

name: Jutland
description:
Jutland: 2 Player Card Game sim of the great Sea Battle of WWI. German vs British Fleets. Each side gets a Unique deck. Played in 6 "Historical" turns. Players try to get the highest scoring hand each turn. Good Filler game. Complete Ruleset and Cardset at:
http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Jutland.html
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Rotten Wood: Horror Rules Mini-Game #1
description:
There's something rotten in the woods tonight - and it ain't your franks and beans! The dead are on the move, and it's up to you to put a stop to it. So grab your shotgun, fire up the chainsaw and get ready for some good old-fashioned zombie-hunting... Horror Rules style!

Horror Rules Mini-Games provide all the fun and mayhem of Horror Rules without the rule crunching. Included in this Mini-Game is everything you need to play, including Paper Forge Minis, maps, weapons and item counters and more - just print and go. Use the more than 60 Horror Markers to simulate the challenges, dangers, perils and scares of the zombie-infested woods, and change the mix to make a different game every time. You pick the size, scope, number of pieces and even the goal of each game.

The Horror Rules Mini-Game system is flexible and fully customizable, great for veteran gamers, kids, families, parties or as a way to introduce new players to the wonders of gaming. Play it solo or with others in cooperative or head-to-head play. Games take as little as 5 minutes and can easily be played during a coffee break or lunch time. With endless variations and Styles of Play, you can create whatever gaming environment you like, from a simple tabletop boardgame to a full-blown RPG.

Rotten Wood is packed with full-color gaming aids that bring the zombie nightmare alive. Inside you'll find:


Paper Forge Character Minis: 6 complete Characters, each with Stats and Skills



Paper Forge Bad Guy Minis: a full page of fearsome zombies, complete with Stats and Powers



Map of Rotten Wood: 8 pages of maps; use them alone or together to build a master map



Horror Markers: More than 60 counters packed with challenges, hazards, weapons, items, perils and frights



Rule Spins: A dozen Spin cards to add endless variation and spice to your Mini-Game



Bad Guy Power-Ups: Jack up your Bad Guys with these disgusting but guaranteed-to-please boosters



Rules: All the instructions you need to make the mayhem happen


Paper Forge Character and Bad Guy Minis are fully compatible with Horror Rules the RPG, with Stats and Skills printed right on the back. Use them to play the Mini-Game, the full RPG or any other modern roleplaying game. The 8-pg map can be used in HR as well or whatever game you choose.

Included in this download are two complete sets of rules, enough to fit every taste:

The Basic Rules are a quick, simple board game with fast setup, plenty of action and thrills and tremendous variation. Use the Horror Markers to make every game exciting and different. Play by yourself or with a pal.

The Skirmish Rules are full-out tabletop war. Pit your heroic and resourceful characters against the not-so-heroic and ravenous zombies in a knock-down drag-out no-holds-barred free-for-all in Rotten Wood. Skirmish Markers include standard Horror Rules weapons with full Horror Rules stats. Requires two to play.
categories: Collectible Components, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Sapperlot
description:
Ingenuity and vocabulary are required in this game. The players note as many words as possible with a specific letters drawn. But think quickly - then the time runs out....

The game is in German but works just as well in English.

name: Grimoire des Illusions
description:
To represent the people of the Men or the people of the imps and to mark more points than its adversary. To obtain these points one looks at the end of each part what one recovered in his folds (folds makes during the part).

If the Black book of the Illusions is recovered, 12 points are marked. If one recovers more books than his adversary, one marks 9 points to have constituted the largest library. Are also marked points if the couple of his people is recovered, to have the largest population, if places are invested!

To make folds (even raised that in Scopa or Escoba), it is enough to pose a chart of its play on one or two charts of the same value on the table of play. For example one 8 of my play can take a chart 8 on the table of play some is the color. Or, one 8 of my play can take a chart of 6 and one of 2 on the table (6+2=8).

When all the charts in hand were played, each camp counts the points contained in the folds carried out, and then one sets out again for another game...

name: Airport
description:
This game, one of several in existence with the title of "Airport", was published as a promotional game for Zurich Airport. Zurich Airport has been branded as "Unique Airport" and this game is duly published by "Verlag Unique".

The game is played on a board which represents sections of the airport departures area from check-in through to the fuselage of the plane itself. Each player has eight "people" and has to shepherd them through from the check-in desk, via a transit desk and a boarding desk. Each player has three action points each turn and four different actions are available. Actions include, besides moving a piece onwards, trading cards in for victory points. Victory points can be earned in various ways including visiting shops and the restaurant.

The game ends when the first player embarks all eight pieces on the plane. The winner is the player with most victory points at this time.

The game is described in the Spielbox review as reminiscent of the Malefiz game.

name: Pattern Blocks Games
description:
This is a set of rules and tools that allow games to be played with HearthSong's "Pattern Blocks" (PB) (not included). A set of PB consists of 250 flat wooden pieces in geometric shapes: hex, square, parallelogram, triangle, diamond, trapezoid. The shapes are all the same scale and based on a fundamental angle of 30 degrees - like a super Tangram set.

The supporting bits include a protractor, a very nice spinner for selecting one of the PB shapes, three d6 (one 'regular', one with the six PB piece colors, and one with angles in 30 degree increments), Tangram and 'mandala' cue cards, and four sturdy game boards. This equipment (and a PB set) lets you play the five games described in the rules. The games are a mix of non-competitive pattern-making games, and races to be first to make specific shapes or patterns. All are well thought out to teach basic geometric principles and/or excite the imagination (as if geometry wasn't exciting enough).

The pieces are well-made and are totally conducive to creating new games, the spinner and dice especially. The skills being taught by the five supplied games are grade school level, but as games I think one or two of these could challenge many adults. I'm tempted to order a PB set just to try some of them - and of course make beautiful designs in my spare time. Building blocks of any kind are good clean fun.

name: Mojo
description:
MOJO ... 3 in-a-row with a twist of strategy.

Taking turns and one at a time, players put their 3 pieces and pawn on the 3x3 grid board - then, continue by moving any piece or their own pawn to the adjacent empty space.

Players may not move the opponent's pawn - which is used as a blocker.

Pieces and pawns may not jump over each other and the last piece moved may not be returned to its previous position.

The winner is the first with their 3 color pieces in a row - horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

MOJO TOO ... similar in principle, played with 3 pieces each and a single neutral pawn that is common to and may be moved by both players.

The game starts with the pawn in the center of the board and during play, there is a choice of 2 empty spaces.

MOJO 2 ... played, as Mojo and Mojo Too, for points.

The playing pieces are original, with individual opposite ends numbered similar to regular dice.

It takes all 3 pieces of a color to make up a single die ... but dice they're not!

The pieces are placed on the board either end up and always inverted when moved - thereby constantly changing the score.

The game may be played for a certain number of rounds or to an agreed points total.

The pips on the tops of the pieces in a winning row are added up - the winner is the first to reach the set score.

In this way, the best of 5 rounds may be 2 - on points.
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Quintessence
description:
Quintessence is an 2-5 player abstract game probably best known as one of the early entries in the "Games 100." It was apparently self-published by a New York company in the late 70s and is long since out of print.

The board is pentagonally shaped, with pentagonally shaped spaces. There are five "power spaces" in the center of the board which the players are trying to occupy. The remainder are either card spaces (of three different colors), go-again spaces (you get a second move if you land there) or free spaces.

Each player has a set of markers, and a single pawn which they can move around the board. This is done by rolling a die and moving it that number of contiguous spaces. When you land on a colored space, you collect a card of that color. A set of three different colored cards are required to place markers on the power spaces. Card sets are also used to attack other player's markers and capture them.

The winner is the one to occupy the five "power spaces" or to eliminate the other players in the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Paddington Bear's Lucky Day Game
description: Players play the role of Paddington Bear. Paddington is having a garden party and must collect two jars of marmalade from the 3-D die-cut market. The first player to arrive at the garden party with two or more marmalade cards wins this rather basic roll-and-move game.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Plumpsbär
description:
This is a game for ages 3 and up. The box contains a tree trunk, a tree pyramid, 4 panda bears, 16 chips and 1 die.

The game is played in the box itself. The game board is printed on the box insert. The insert has notches to root the trunk and the pyramid.

The trunk and the pyramid have notches on them to place the panda bears on. On the board are fruit baskets printed in different colors. These fruit baskets are also printed on the chips. The die shows numbers from 1 to 3 and 2 bear symbols.

Each player gets a panda bear and puts it on one of the start positions on the board. The fruit baskets are put in the deepening of the box insert.

On your turn you roll the die. Your panda bear moves accordingly to the number you have rolled. If you land on or cross over a field with a fruit basket on it, you can keep a fruit basket. Every player can only have 1 fruit basket of each color.

If you have reached the end of the tree, you can use the marked route to reach an other side of the tree.

You can't jump over the other bears. They are an obstacle.

Have you rolled a bear symbol with the die, the bear plumps down from the tree and is put on the deepening with the fruit baskets. On your next turn your bear can return to the tree.

The game ends when a player has collected a fruit basket in each of the 4 colors and lands on the bottom (this can be due to the rolling of a bear symbol with the die or due to a normal movement).

name: UNO: Vintage Peanuts
description:
Another UNO Variation. The Newest Peanuts Edition.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: THE RED BARON CARD: When this card is played, the player may look at any other player's hand.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Stifinder
description:
In this Trivia Game two teams challenge each other. Each time it is your turn the other team draws a new category and read aloud 10 answers within this category. Only five of the answers are correct and you have to guess which!
Prior to guessing, you state the number of answers you think that your know (1 to 5) and if you are right in the selected ones, you are allowed to move the same number of spaces. If one or more of the answers are not correct you are not allowed to move at all.
Before you reach the end you must have collected three wooden rings.

name: Golpe
description:
From the web site (http://www.stoneagescanners.com/golpe) using Google's Portugese to English translation:

Golpe (The Super Trunfo of the Brazilian Politicians) is a card game produced by the Stone Age Scanners based on 32 Brazilian politicians. . With it you can start battles with your friends and learn more on these important figures. It is provided for free to download, print and play.

Its creation deeply was inspired by the brilliant Super Trunfo de Santos Catholics. As well as this, its format is inspired in the Super “classic” Trunfo - that, in turn (little people know) it searches inspiration in the Top Trumps.

The game is available under the Creative Commons license.

name: Juggernauts
description:
Juggernauts is a customizable, non-collectible dueling game for two players, each with his or her own customized deck. Your deck represents your Juggernaut. Your opponent also has a Juggernaut. Your goal is to incapacitate your opponent’s Juggernaut so your ground forces can infiltrate and overwhelm it before he or she can do the same to you.

Before the game starts, you need to download and print out Juggernauts cards and build your deck. Cards fall into general categories of power generators, attacks, defenses, and miscellaneous effects.

At the start of a game:

Pick a standard polyhedral die to be your Juggernaut's Commander.
Draw cards equal to the number of sides on your Commander, plus three.
Lay out all but three of the cards in your hand face-down so that each card:
occupies one square in an imaginary grid, and
is adjacent to at least one card.



This matrix of cards is your Juggernaut. Face-down cards are inactive nodes and face-up cards are active nodes.

Play during a game is simultaneous; you and your opponent go through the same phases in a turn at the same time. You start your turn by gaining 1 power (plus any additional from active cards in your Juggernaut). You use power to:

Activate cards that require Power,
Increase the effectiveness of an attack or defense,
Maintain cards you want to keep


After you gain power, you roll your Commander to see which card in your Juggernaut's matrix activates. If you do not have an active card by the end of your command phase (this can happen if your Commander tries to activate a damaged sector, a neutralized card, or a card token), put an alert token on your deck. This means that your enemy’s ground forces are approaching. Remove all alert tokens when you activate a damaged sector. If you have three or more alert tokens on your deck at the end of a round, enemy troops have infiltrated your juggernaut and taken control. You lose and your opponent wins.

Next, you and your opponent reveal your active cards and resolve them. Once cards resolve, you discard them, draw cards to replace them, then play cards from your hand to fill in the ones that you discarded.

The mechanics are such that large Juggernauts with many-sided Commanders (d 12, d 20) have lots of "hit points", but are easy to hit with attacks, difficult to get reliable results from, and vulnerable to accumulating alert tokens. Small Juggernauts with few-sided Commanders (d4, d6) are difficult to hit and produce very predictable results, but have very few "hit points".

Juggernauts is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 2.5 License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.5/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 543 Howard Street, 5th Floor, San Francisco, California, 94105, USA.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Versus Trading Card Game (SNK vs Capcom)
description:
VERSUS TCG is based on the SNK vs Capcom - Card Fighters' Clash video game (for Neo Geo Pocket Color). A two player fighting game with 50 card decks and 5 card hand size. Each player gets 3000 HP, and you lose if you have 0 life.

The full release version uses the same artwork from the video game for most of its cards. This consists of SNK and Capcom character cards, as well as Action cards. There are also some additional SP rarity cards which have new artwork, although some reuse art from other games. There were no further expansions after this set (there are no cards based on Card Fighters' Clash 2).

There is also a "Beta" version which was sold prior and uses exclusively character artwork from different games. These are generally easier to find and has led to confusion over the years as to this game's relation to Card Fighters' Clash.

Although the rules are similar to Card Fighters' Clash and some cards are exactly the same, there are a number of differences, such as character cards which subtract SP to play, cards with different abilities, and a new "star" card ability (in addition to the circle, square, and triangle types from the video game).
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Py
description:
From the box:

"Py is a new exciting math game.
For all levels from kindergarten to college
Exercise your creativity and sharpen your mind
Great for family entertainment
Play by yourself or with others
Build a dazzling 3-D pyramid while you play
Intensity piles up as the game progresses
Create your own versions of the game"

Instructions include rules for five games: Connect color, Plus-Minus, All Operations, Combinations, & Squares.

Made in Bettendorf, Iowa.

name: Turbulento
description: A great game of hide-and-seek is taking place on the farm. By aiming your ball skillfully and hitting accurately, you can help the animals to hide in the hay. Finding the animals is like looking for a needle in a haystack. You have to observe carefully if you want to succeed in this game of animal hide-and-seek.

name: Top Team
description:
From the back of the box: "Play your cards right and keep possession of the ball. build up the attack with your team cards and just hope that you aren't tackled. The referee will award you a free kick if you're fouled, or even a penalty if you're quick enough. Shoot! You need goals to win, in this fast action football gane! Collect your favourite players and clubs."

This is a simple card game where players lay cards from a face-down pack hoping they will form a sequence that would allow them to shoot. If not, the opposing player could attempt to intercept. This could lead to a successful tackle or a foul, which in turn could lead to a penalty.

It can be played with one or two packs of Top Team cards. Each pack represents a different team from the upper reaches of the 1979 English First Division.

The game itself is pure chance. Prominent players of the era were represented as 'artist's impressions'.

name: Olympics 1980
description: This game based on the Olympics has quite a large box (70x43cm.) and a big plastic board that includes an athletic track. Players have to participate in 8 events: 400mt. spring, javelin, shot put, pole vault, spear throwing, marathon high jump, and long jump. The rulebook is after a classic intro told in a comic book way. Vintage game for collectors, made in Belgium.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Triple Match
description:
Contents
* 2 Game Boards
* 48 Colored Plastic Marbles - 6 each of 8 colors
* 1 Indicator Shaker

Aim of the game:
To set up as many patterns as possible on your individual board, that match the little shaker pattern.

name: Denmark Straits
description:
This game was published in the May 1971 issue (Volume 3, Number 5) of Spartan International.

It is a tactical naval game of the 1941 battle between the Bismarck and Prinz Eugen on one side and the Hood, Prince of Wales, Suffolk, and Norfolk on the other. It is really a set of miniatures rules, with counters provided to be used instead of ship miniatures. Six counters are included (one for each ship), sized for 1:1200 scale.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: 54x12
description: The original title of this cycling game is about a gear that can be selected on a bike. This French game appeared at the end of the '80s. The game contains 4 double sided big boards representing a Tour de France étappe on each one. It's played with 2 dice, 40 tactics cards, 32 mountain cards, 26 sprint cards and 30 rouleur cards. Every player gets a team of 3 plastic cyclists. In the beginning every player gets a number of tactical cards. Movement is decided by the dice and influenced by the cards. In the mountains the number rolled by the dice is divided by two. Cyclists can also encounter a flat tire (caused by rolling two 1's with the dice), if this happens to the team leader, he can be helped by a teammate if necessary. Winner is the player who scores best in the overall classification. There is also a mountain prize for the player who has the best climber in his team.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Borodino 1812
description:
A new concept of the military history publications. A book of history, a model, and if you wish, a wargame.

The works are visual books. Their task is to reach those familiar with military history and make that the non-familiar become interested, by means of this glaring and easy system of reproducing a battle. By mounting a model, in a simple manner, you will be able to simulate the historical movements of the units or ships, using a co-ordinate system. For that, you will count on the assistance of the Historical Handbook and the Battle Guide. Included are also rules for play alternate "what if?"

The box includes:
-Historical notes of the battle
-84x60cm board
-Laminated figures
-Deploy charts
-2 dice
...

For more information, check: www.deltaediciones.com

name: Palm Beach Island Resort
description:
Description of the game from Spielbox:

Palm Beach Island Resort is described as a tactical game. By placing needed infrastructure onto the spaces of the Island, a tourist resort is created that will be visited by guests from around the world. The goal of the game is to build Bungalows and encourage the tourists to part with their money; that is, make a tidy profit. Each player acts as a travel agent trying to fill his bungalows up.

name: Bengali
description: The elephant keepers are very busy because the cheeky elephants are always running away and hiding in the jungle. So, they have decided now to build a separate enclosure for each elephant to put an end to the tiresome searching.

name: MetalKrushers
description:
MetalKrushers is an action-packed game of mobile metal mayhem. Players construct their Krushers by determining factors such as chassis size, weapons, shields, armor and more. Once built, players maneuver their Krushers into one of the futuristic arenas and the fast-paced melee begins. Krush or be krushed is the name of the game.

Take your place at the top of the heap, or become part of it.

MetalKrushers is a tactical board game of gladiatorial robot combat for two to six players ages 10 and up. The PDF includes a 14-page rulebook plus a page of Krusher sheets, a page of Krusher counters, two pages of charts, three pages of arena maps and a deluxe color cover. Players will need two six-sided dice and something to write with. Games can last from 30 minutes to an hour, depending on players.

name: Goldener Apfel
description:
The way to the golden apple has some obstacles along it but it is worth it because you are able to make a wish when you eat it. Quick to the horses and up to the golden mountain! If you are lucky, you will be first to the top of the hill, and your wish will be granted.

Ages 3 and up.

name: Timber
description:
From the rulebook...

In Timber the object of the game is to see which player can become the wealthiest logging tycoon by skillfully logging, bidding, challenging and selling logs while logging timber units on playing board.

Published by House of Games of Grants Pass, Oregon which is a major logging town.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: An Evening of Murder: A Feast to Die For
description:
From the publisher:

The Lesters were hosting another one of their fabulous dinner parties. The invitation list was smaller than usual. The Lesters, and a few of their special family and friends were just about to sit down to enjoy the elaborate dinner Victoria Lester had prepared. The table was breathtaking. As usual Victoria had outdone herself. The diners toasted with a vintage bottle of red wine and sat down to eat. As the food was being passed around the table, Victoria started to choke and cough. Everyone rushed to her side in time to see her fall face first into her food. She was dead, she had been poisoned. Welcome to an evening of murder! This is a 'Party Adventure' designed to create a night of intrigue and excitement for you and your friends. Within the comfort of your living room, you set the stage for solving a murder. You and your guests become the suspects. Each have hidden backgrounds and secret clues. Cast your inhibitions aside, apply your imagination, and determine who the murderer is, how it was done, and why. Game comes with a complete party planner with instructions, costume suggestions, tips, and an optional dinner menu, invitations and name tags for your guests, character profiles with secret clues and backgrounds for each guest, a CD which re-enacts the sounds of the murder and outlines the plot, and the authors solution to the mystery. For 8 guests.

name: The War Between the States
description: Card Game for 2 Players. American Civil War Theme. Players share a common deck with cards usable by both or just 1 specific player. Win by Reducing your Opponents Morale to zero. The North can win by taking Strategic Objectives. The South can win by timely play of certain Political Recognition cards. Cards portray specific Leaders (Lee, Grant), Battles (Bull Run, Gettysburg), Strategies, Tactics, Morale, Politics, Inventions, Armies, Naval, and Economic Factors of the War. Each round, players draw and play cards. Some cards will modify or neutralize other cards or allow more or fewer cards to be drawn. The winner of a Round will lower the Morale of his opponent. Complete rule set available for free at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/TWBTS.html
categories: American Civil War, Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: The Battle of Ueno
description:
This is a wargame set during Japan's violent restoration period. This was a pivotal battle which saw Imperial troops(led by Saigo Takamori) defeat the last of the feudal Bakufu forces in Ueno city on May 15, 1868.

Saigo Takamori is featured in the film the Last Samurai.

1 turn=1 hour.
30 counters.

name: Kouu and Ryuuhou
description:
This is a Japanese wargame on the emergence of the Chinese Han dynasty in 206 B.C.
Kouu is the Japanese translation of Chinese Xiang Ji, "Duke of Lu" and Ryuuhou is Chinese Liu Bang who became "Emperor Gaozu".
(Wikipedia: Gaozu)

Area movement card driven game

1 turn = 1 year

110 counters, 32 cards

name: Heroic Deeds
description: In a city full of superheroes and crime, hope is running low and so are funds. You must become the most famous superhero in the city in order to reap the benefits and protect your city from crime. Stop your fellow superheroes from become the top heroes while on your journey to being the #1 hero in your city. Stop crimes, face unexpected and surprising events, but watch you fellow super heroes closely for they are going to try and get the top spot before you.

name: Patrol
description:
Patrol is a simple set of miniatures rules for squad/platoon level combat. It appears intended for World War II combat but is fairly generic and so could presumably be used for other eras. It is explicitly designed to be playable on a small table, as opposed to the 6'x6' table which was then supposedly standard for miniatures games.

Patrol appeared in Volume I, Number 7 of Strategy & Tactics.

name: Pott
description:
A gambling game for 2-6 players ages 12 and up.

"Pott" is a lively and spirited dice-game. Each player places one of their four numbered tokens (0, 1, 2 or 3) upside-down and everyone tries to guess the sum of the selected token-values by placing a chip of their color on the correct number. Whoever guesses the sum wins the prediction-chips. If no player guesses correctly, the chips go into the pot. The winner of the next round receives both the current prediction-chips and also the pot. The player who possesses the most chips at the end is the winner. Contents: game board, 24 number tokens in six different colors, 60 chips and an easily understandable rulebook.

name: Arène
description:
Each player moves his 6 pieces from their starting positions on a diamond shaped grid down to the "arena" where they then try to capture each other. A piece is lost when it can't move anymore, being blocked by opponent's pieces. The winner is the first player to capture two of the opponent's pawns.

The box includes:

6 yellow pawns
6 red pawns
1 plastic board
1 instruction booklet

name: Listes d'armées pour De Bonaparte à Napoléon: Livret nº1 – Vive la Nation, 1792-1802
description:
(from Histoire & Collections webpage:)

en français:
Compléments indispensables à la règle De Bonaparte à Napoléon, les trois livrets de Listes d'armées (au format standard 18 x 24 cm) présentent, sous forme de budget, la composition détaillée d'armées-type à destination des joueurs de DBN. Ce livret présente les armées des belligérants de la période révolutionnaire.


(BGG user translation and description:)

In English:
Essential supplements to the De Bonaparte à Napoléon (DBN) rule, the three Army lists booklets present, in form of budget, detailed typical armies for DBN players. This booklet presents the armies of the belligerents during the [French] revolutionary period.

Included are the royalists armies and the coalition armies which fought against France in the stated period. The last pages are dedicated to errata of army books 2 and 3. The system used here is similar to those of the army books for the DBx system of play.

IN FRENCH ONLY.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Listes d'armées pour De Bonaparte à Napoléon: Livret nº2 – Les Annes de Gloire, 1805-1811
description:
(from Histoire & Collections webpage:)

en français:

Compléments indispensables à la règle de jeux De Bonaparte à Napoléon (DBN), les trois livrets de Listes d'armées présentent, sous forme de budget, la composition détaillée d'armées-type à destination des joueurs de DBN. Ce second livret est consacré au début de l'Empire, de 1805 à 1811.


(BGG user translation:)

In English:

Essential supplements to the De Bonaparte à Napoléon (DBN) rule, the three Army lists booklets present, in form of budget, detailed typical armies for DBN players. This second booklet is devoted to the beginning of the [French] Empire, from 1805 to 1811.

IN FRENCH ONLY.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: MonkeyWinks
description:
From the Three Monkey Games website:www.monkeypoker1.com

Once again, the geniuses at Three Monkey Games have turned a classic game on its ear and came up with something BRAND NEW! Introducing MonkeyWinks! The popular indoor game that is easy to learn for kids, and formidable enough to appeal to adults wanting a special challenge.

Like its predecessor, MonkeyWinks is a game played with sets of small, thin discs (called winks) lying on a special felt mat. Players use a larger disc (called a squidger) to pop a smaller disc into flight by pressing down on one side of the smaller disc. The basic goal of an informal game (easily playable by young children) is to cause the smaller discs to land inside a pot or cup. The formal game has a more robust set of rules, goals, and strategies suitable to serious competition for adults and older children.

MonkeyWinks is interactive fun for all players, pros and beginners alike. However, MonkeyWinks is a lot more than just a flipping disc game. For example, the included "Go Bananas"™ cards incorporate random events and player changes inspired by everyday kids games.
www.monkeypoker1.com

name: Monkey Poker
description:
From Three Monkey Games website:www.monkeypoker1.com

Looking for a fun, new indoor game idea for children, and kids of all ages? Learn Poker along with Berry "The Bluffer" Bananahammock, "Fearless" Freddy Funkymunky, Albert "All In" Alexander and Mr. Bill "Bananas" Dole as they play this new and fun variation on the most popular card game in recent years: Texas Hold 'Em!

WHY MONKEY AROUND WITH A GOOD THING?!

MONKEY POKER™ takes the easy to learn card game Texas Hold 'em, and adds the entertaining randomness of such classic children's games as Monopoly™ and The Game of Life™. It's a great game idea for your next kid's party or sleepover!

The winner of each poker hand has to take a "Go Bananas!" card from a deck, and then do what the card says for bonus chi(m)ps! The tasks range from the silly ("Take $1000 in Chimps from everyone, except for the person with the hairiest feet!") to the sublime ("Switch seats with the person to your left. Now have the other monkeys do the same.").
The Chimps awarded by the "Go Bananas cards" can go either way, either to the winner or another player, so everyone has an equal chance of winning!

Plus with additional ways to win, MONKEY POKER™ is a hilariously fun card game with "a peel" for all ages! We guarantee you'll like it a bunch! www.monkeypoker1.com

name: Gulf War
description:
Gulf War is a Malaysian board game from 1990, using as its theme the then ongoing war in the Persian gulf. Its game mechanism is borrowed from An Qi (literally dark chess, because pieces are covered at the start and so unknown to the players: it is a game played using Xiangqi pieces). Each side has a number of pieces ranking from President down to Hostages or Civilians, and also Bombs, Fighter Planes and Oil-fields. Like An Qi (and for that matter games like LuZhanJunQi and Stratego), the pieces have a ranked order and higher ranked pieces eliminate lower ranked ones. Pieces start face-down and are randomly distributed in alternate colors on the 6X6 square grid that is the game board. Players take turn to expose pieces and once exposed, pieces may be moved one space orthogonally. Enemy pieces are eliminated by a higher or equal ranked piece moving on to them. There are special rules for specific pieces - the Assassin may eliminate the President, Bombs neutralize (i.e. both pieces get eliminated) all other pieces, capturing an Oil-field/Hostages/Civilians piece allows substitution of your own piece for a previously eliminated piece, etc. The Fighter Plane has the capture of the Pao (Cannon) in An Qi - just like in Xiangqi, it jumps over another piece to land on a distal piece and capture it.
The game is won by the player who is able to capture both the opposing President and Vice-president.

The game has interesting details - one player takes the Iraqi side and the other is the Allied side. The President, Vice-president and Ally pieces are different and have pictures appropriate to the side (Saddam, Bush, Gaddfi and Thatcher all feature). Another difference is that the Iraqis have a Civilians piece but the Allied forces has a Hostages piece instead (in the game, they are equivalent). The board comes with two sides - one side has yellow and blue circles to show where the pieces go. The other has the same 6X6 grid superimposed on a background map showing the Persian gulf.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: The First World War
description: Issue game of Command Magazine Japan #72, 20 Dec 2006, along with SS: Third Reich.

name: Genghis Khan
description:
Solo card game.
13th Century Asia: Take the role of Genghis Kahn:
Expand the Mongol Empire as far as you can in all directions.

The game ends at the end of 21 turns.
This represents the death of Genghis in 1227.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Educational, Print & Play

name: Bellum Gallicum
description: Game published in Casus Belli n°68 and 69 covering Caesar's campaign in Gauls.

name: Armies of Oz
description: Armies of Oz is a free game by Warp Spawn Games and is the second in Lloyd's Oz Trilogy series. A full on battle for Oz! Large scale warfare in the Land of Oz. The map depicts an irregular, interlocked set of territories. Each Territory compromises a small section of Oz. Players will have to create their own Game Map. The picture above shows a map of Oz taken from the original books.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Spam-O-Rama
description:
Your goal is to conduct successful spam e-mail campaigns for the clients (companies, groups or products) you have been hired to represent.

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for three different piecepack sets (12 suits).

name: Happy Feet: Return to Emperor Land
description: Mumbles son Mumble Jr. Is kidnapped by Joseph Kony into becoming a child soldier. use dice,cards, and your own instincts to locate the troop Mumble Jr has been forced into and take the fight to Joseph Kony himself. Ages 18 and up. Legacy edition coming soon
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Trauma Case Inbound
description:
Trauma Case Inbound is a game portraying an unusually hectic day at a hospital's emergency department. Its level of realism lies between that of actual medical procedures and emergency medicine as depicted in movies/television shows. Players will need to assign their limited numbers of doctors, nurses, and equipment based on available information on incoming patients, and personnel fatigue is a significant factor.

The game may be played either solitaire or multi-player (which is a "multi-solitaire" situation presenting each player with the same incoming patients). Multi-player interaction is possible by rerouting inbound patients to another player's hospital. There's no fixed limit on the number of players, but one to four is a reasonable range.

Components include:
7-page rulebook
Hospital Map
31 counters
106 markers
Game Display
Two Doctor/Nurse Displays
Patient Display
Sequence of Play
One six-sided die is required for play.

The Print-n-Play PDF can be found at:
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=492

name: Coin Hopping: Washington DC
description:
From the press release:

Scatter some coins on the board and you are ready to play Coin Hopping-Washington DC, a game of strategy. Coin Hopping Washington DC is a board game with global appeal. International travelers with thoughts about visiting Washington DC will find this game as indispensable as their guide books. The game board, a beautiful map of the National Mall and surrounding areas, invites exploration of the city and its landmarks. Game includes fifty destination cards with pictures of things to see. It’s a patriotic experience all Americans will find engaging. Players vie to become President, appoint Supreme Court Justices, and they even vote in Congress to change the rules of the game! The game is fast paced and topical as all eyes turn toward the next US election year in 2008.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Hobkirk Hill: Battles of the American War of Independence – Volume 1
description:
A tactical DTP wargame based on a system that appeared in the earlier Vimeiro game. Te game looks remarkably simple. The British have only 15 units, while the Americans have 23 units.

Components:
Color Cover Sheet
13" x 19" Map
128 die-cut Counters
Rulebook
Charts and Tables

All components come in a ziploc bag.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Wargame

name: The Long Island Project
description:
There is only one right way to make a Long Island Iced Tea! Your way. You don't have all the ingredients to fill your recipes, so you'll have to trade with your fellow bartenders to get everything you need and mix the best Long Island.

Each player has three pieces of Flair. On your turn, you reveal a piece of your hidden recipe, and offer up a Flair card for bid. The other players bid ingredients that they'll give you in exchange for the Flair. You then choose one of the bids that gives you ingredients towards filling your recipe.

Available from RobotMartini.com.

name: Luft Krieg
description:
From the publisher's Website:

Luft Krieg is a tabletop air combat wargame set in an alternate world where the wonders of pulp science-fiction magazines are realities of science. Players take the part of commanders guiding their daring aces through aerial battles inspired by the Second World War. This book includes basic rules and counters to take control of the air forces of any one of five powerful nations to help decide the fate of the Free World.

Luft Krieg uses the same system as the Gear Krieg Wargame.

name: Lion Sleeps Tonight Electronic Game
description: This game has 2 levels of play for children Ages 3 and up. For the littlest children, you move according to color on the die. Older children move by number. It's a race to make it through the jungle, but meanwhile a lion is sleeping to his favorite song. If he wakes up during a child's move, they must hide in a bush. The first to get through the jungle wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music

name: Go Finish
description:
This Western Australian production could possibly be described as parallel games of Scrabble without a board. Players each have a collection of lettered tiles and they create their own set of words that interconnect in the style of a crossword. Like Scrabble, each letter has a score with letters that are harder to use having a higher score.

Manufactured in Western Australia by Herbert Stone Pty Ltd, Trademark Registed Pending Taree Pty Ltd. Judging by the seven-digit phone numbers it is pre-1997.

name: Austerlitz, 2 December 1805
description:
This simulation deals with the famous Battle of Austerlitz held in Moravia (Chech Republic today) during the 2nd of December 1805.
The simulation is designed with a full area map (provided) of the actual place, divided in hexagons. The dimensions represented are approximately 8miles from north to south and 8miles from east to west, thus every hex represents an area of 1/16 of a square mile, the actual dimension of every hex is around 400 meters from side to side.
The player controlling the French army gets 33 unit markers all in divisional, brigade or battalion level.
The player controlling the Allied army gets 30 unit markers all in divisional, brigade or battalion level.

name: The American Civil War by Gaslight, Part I:1861-63
description:
A book of six American Civil War scenarios for use with the popular set of Victorian Science Fiction rules: GASLIGHT.

Contains Board setup, Victory conditions, and background information basd on an alternative history.

Expands:

Gaslight
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Spin to Win Game
description: Place your spinning tops in front of your station and crash your opponent. First player to 10 marks is the winner.
publishers: Chad Valley Co Ltd., John Toy, Maple Toys, Pavilion

name: Naval Duel
description:
Tactical fight between ships (1700-1800)
On an hexagonal squared map every player fights using his 7 ships.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
Ships have different specifications (speed, agility, fire, cannons, captain, etc.) so be aware who you are attacking.
The winner is the one who defeats all the other ships.
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hippomania
description:
This is a cardgame for 4 players.
Every players drives a chariot in a race set in Ancient Rome.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/warpspawn/FreeGames/Hippoma...) or in the files section.
Be the first to complete all 7 laps.
Chariots are equipped with particular materials an different race value (speed, agility, etc.).
Also Drivers have values that can enhance your Chariots' Ability.
Play straight or Play dirty: it's your choice.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Print & Play, Racing, Transportation
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Cashword
description:
(From Box Back)

"An exciting game of word perception combined with cash accumulation for 3-6 players.

"Players buy letters to reveal a hidden crossword puzzle. The player who has acquired the most money when the crossword is complete is the winner.

"The player must decide whether or not to go ahead and reveal the hidden letter. To guess the amount correctly would mean an immediate cash payment.
