description: A simple game on a board (15 x 23 cm). On the board a picture for 6 pole positions. One for each player. Every player has a car (Citroen 2cv. It is placed one one of the position. Each player gets 8 cards. These cards are used to give the car a direction (left, straight on or to the right) and speed (from 1 to 5). On turn the player in front plays one card. The player behind needs to follow with his card. Each card is compared with the card of the player in front of him. If you cannot follow the direction or speed the cars change position. After playing all cards gets points according to their end position. (1 point to the first and so on) After three rounds the player with the least points wins the game.

name: Makhbusa: Persian Backgammon
description:
Target is to put all of your pieces in enemy's places, trying to win most points while.

Game ends when one of the players do that, but the player who have more points will be the winner.
publishers: Orda Industries Ltd., Το Κόκκινο Πατίνι

name: Taba
description:
Description

(EN)The game of The Taba goes back to the origins of the Indo-European civilizations.

There are many variants of the game, but most of them are played with The Taba (one of the bones of the knee articulation of a sheep).

The players sit in circle and receive a secret card. Only five cards have a "title" with the names of the King, the executioner, the people, the charity and the gallows.

The King orders the executioner to apply a punishment, the people try to dethrone the King (with the help of the gallows) and Charity tries to avoid punishment. Every action from the King will be resolved by launching "the Taba".

Descripcion

(ES)El juego de “La Taba” se remonta a los orígenes de las civilizaciones indoeuropeas.
Del juego hay muchas variantes, pero inmensda mayoria de ellas se juega con uno (o varios) huesos de astrágalo (uno de los huesos de la articulacion del tobillo de la oveja).
Los jugadores se colocaran en circulo y se repartira secretamente una carta a cada jugador, de las que sólo cinco tendran un “TITULO” con los nombres REY, VERDUGO, PUEBLO, CARIDAD y HORCA
El Rey ordenara un castigo el verdugo lo aplicara, el pueblo intentara destronar el Rey, con la ayuda de la Horca y la Caridad evitara el castigo del rey…todas las acciones se resolveran lanzando “la Taba”

name: Fumbly Pegs
description:
The object of Fumbly Pegs is to get one of the colored pegs in the middle of the group each round so that at the end of all rounds you will have the most points. This is accomplished by obtaining a set of 4 or 6 matching colored cards (depending on the size of the group either one or two decks will be used) as they travel around the circle in a clockwise movement. Each deck contains 10 sets of 4 matching colored cards, one wild card, and one black card.

The center of the table contains one less peg than the number of players. Once anyone in the circle has a set they can grab a peg – after that it’s a free-for-all to get one of the colored pegs before they’re gone whether you have a set or not. Each peg is worth a different point value and one player will be left empty-handed each round, so you’ve gotta be fast to get one! Each player earns points depending on the color of the peg they grabbed. The player without a peg earns no points. Players who have unused wild cards or black cards in their hand at the end of the round lose points. At the end of all rounds the score pad will be full and whichever player has the most points is victorious!

More information about Fumbly Pegs can be found at http://www.fumblypegs.com

name: 24 heures moto
description:
Contents: a board printed on the two sides with the circuits of Mans and Castelet, 6 prototype motorbikes and 6 serials motorbikes, 24 coloured holders for motorbikes, 2 dices, 1 risks table, 1 penalty table.
This is a race game where each player can choose his speed at each move. The quicker he goes, the more risks he takes and a roll of the dices decides the penalty, namely an injunction to stay under a limited speed. The player can disobey this injunction, but if he is penalized again, then his motorbike is eliminated.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Hoplita
description:
Game included with Alea Magazine nº4.

System of game of the antiquity, includes scenerio battle Cannas.

name: Ia Drang: Zona De Asalto X-Rae
description:
The game simulates the combats of the valley Ia Drang of October and November of 1965.

Game included with Alea Magazine nº5.

name: Sabotage: A Card Game
description: Sabotage is a card game coming right out of World War II. In keeping with the war effort, the theme of the game is for two, three or four players (or two teams) to establish at least three factories (Tank, Aeroplane and Shipping) by gathering the required resources while trying to avoid the damaging effects of bombs and SABOTAGE!
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: The Millionaire Maker Game
description:
A roll and move game that is advertised to make one a millionaire in 3-5 years. Retail cost is $149.00.

From the publisher's website:

From three-time, bestselling author and Millionaire Maker, Loral Langemeier, comes The Millionaire Maker Game. This game teaches people real world application wealth building skills as they live the life of an entrepreneur- where big deals are done daily.

If you have ever wanted to help people change their financial destiny – or even your own - here is your chance. Make The Millionaire Maker Game your next Cash Machine by becoming a Millionaire Facilitator. Our Millionaire Facilitator program is an excellent lead generator for any existing business as you host game nights as a front-end marketing tool for your own Cash Machine, and you could even build the Millionaire Facilitator program into a solid business venture of its own.

The Millionaire Maker Game was designed to be a successor to Cashflow 101 by the former master distributor and Kiyosaki (Cashflow 101 designer) trained trainer.


Redevelopment of Cashflow 101

name: Avalanche Mountain
description:
This is an Adventure from The Book of Virtues. From the box:

You can see the snowy summit from a distance. Your goal: reach your friends Plato and Aurora at the top. But this is no simple hike up any old hill. This is a virtue quest to reach the peak of Avalanche Mountain!

Along the way you'll try to acquire virtue chips while avoiding the fault chips. Roll a color and advance, but watch out! At any time someone could roll and AVALANCHE!

In an avalanche, you lift the release gate, sending the cascading marble on its downward journey. It ricochets and rolls down the mountain side, along the vertical playing board.

Avoid being knocked over by an avalanche by having virtue chips. Lose ground if you're knocked over while holding a fault chip.

Will you collect the virtues it takes to make it to the top of Avalanche Mountain?!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Terrazzo & Terrazzino
description: Players take turns placing tiles (2 at a time) to create closed areas of a single color and/or to create closed corridors which also score.

name: Space Cruisers
description:
"Very simple space ship combat."

"Every military ship has the following basic features: 10 Hull points, 1 Phaser, 3 Drives, 1 Shield. In the Basic rules every ship has 5 additional systems. Roll 5 times on the System table to see which systems a ship has." Advanced rules allow for custom ship construction, using a point system.

"Each side should have an equal number of figures. Or each side should have an equal number of construction points if using the advanced rules."

name: Der Zaubermeister
description:
Players try to complete a new magic potion by gathering the correct coloured ingredients, which are then stored on shelves on the gameboard. The ingredient collection is based on the luck a die roll, but those that are not needed can also be traded.

Before the magic potion is brewed the colour oracle moves and players have to predict the resulting colour. If correct, the player gets to move forwards and thus move closer to star chamber, where they can claim the coveted magic hat. If the prediction is wrong, everyone gives the concoction an imaginative name... how about "Firefly-juice"?

The game comes with a set of water-soluble Faber-Castell colouring pencils and intends to promote creativity and the communication skills of children.

name: Hurtgen Surprise
description:
An Advanced Squad Leader compatible scenario pack which includes 8 scenarios, 2 maps, and a counter-sheet consisting of 208 counters depicting action in the Hurtgen Forrest and Brecourt Manor. The scenarios are centered around battles by the 101st Airborne division and the 83rd infantry division.

The Brecourt Manor map plays the scenario "So full of Fire" which was depicted in the Band of Brothers book and series. Lt. Winters gathering a scratch group to attack a gun battery of 4 105mm howitzers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Muskets
description:
"Simple Card Game for 2 players. Simulates a fight between 2 Napoleonic armies. Easy to make: Only 10 card types."

"The Deck: Players share a Common deck. 10 card types x 4 = 40 card deck." The card types are General, Cannon, Cavalry, Light Infantry, Line Infantry, Grenadier Infantry, Guard Infantry, Ready, Aim, and Fire.

"Morale: Each player starts with 20 Morale. Use coins or dice or tokens to keep track of Morale."

"Victory: Reduce your opponent to zero Morale."
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Napoleonic, Print & Play

name: Space Base
description:
“Players control rival commercial colonies on a small piece of stable crust on a volcanic moon.” Watch out for the random meteor strikes!

The game is played on a 10x10 grid with spaces large enough to hold one game card. Each player starts out with one Outpost located in a corner of the map. The deck of 120 cards contains a variety of installations, resources, and volcanic sites. The players earn income from installations. Some installations are required to be adjacent to a certain site or sites in order to produce income.

“The game ends when the last card is drawn from the deck. The player with the most credits at the end of the game is the winner.”
categories: City Building, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction

name: Columbus!
description:
Players buy and sell five different commodities until they think that they have enough to sail from Spain to claim settlements around the Caribbean. Fortifications cost money but unfortified settlements can be captured by other players.

[from the box top] Explore and conquer the New World: force the other players out of the game through trading and selling commodities, trading commodities for outposts, collecting tributes, and challenging other players for outposts.

name: Time Bandits
description:
"Card game based on the Terry Gilliam Movie. Each player controls a group of diminutive individuals in possession of a stolen Map of all Time & Space. Players race to steal the most treasure from History."

"Each player is represented by an abstract group of Time Bandits of Uncertain number. In addition to these abstract individuals, players will recruit Character cards. Character cards represent more concrete individuals with special abilities."

The players travel between the Time of Legends and various historical periods represented by Location Cards. Each time a player travels to a new Location, the player may steal a Treasure. Danger cards (Foe, Delay, or God) may be played on other players to hamper their efforts.

"The game ends when a turn starts with no cards left in the deck. The player with the most Treasure cards at the end of the game wins. If tied the player with the most characters wins. If still tied, the shortest player wins."
categories: American West, Ancient, Card Game, Medieval, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Napoleonic, Science Fiction, World War II

name: Trans-Kombi
description:
Trans-Kombi is the abbreviation of Transportkombination, or combination of transports. Players play in two teams, with each team playing of their own identical board that shows the major town and transport connections of the former German Democratic Republic. A game master is recommended.
The game is played in 3 rounds. Each round 6 town cards are drawn. The first card of the first round is the common start point, the other 5 are the stations each teams must connect in the order of their choice. Each team's last station is its next starting point, and the original start is the common end point of the last round.
Each team starts with a credit which is needed to buy the transport- black for rails, red for streets, blue for waterways and green for air transport. Prices are rolled for before each round. Also, each round has an accident field that is secretly determined beforehand and often requires re-building a section of the route. Rails, roads and waterways must follow the lines printed on the board, while air transport always takes the shortest possible route.
Teams compete to complete the route first (to get a bonus) and as effectively (=cheaply) as possible. The team with most cash at the end of round 3 wins.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Death at Samarra
description:
In Death at Samarra, you must protect your Servant while stalking your opponent's pieces. But which piece is his Servant, and which is Death? Your Merchant can reveal another piece's identity, but in doing so, unmasks himself.

This two-player game of bluffing and hidden strategy plays quickly, but uniquely each time. How well can you outguess the person across the table?

Download the two-page black-and-white PDF DeathSamarra_ed1.pdf at the Files Section, print and assemble it in 15 minutes, and play several 3-8 minute games with a friend tonight.
mechanics: Action Points, Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Game of RIO
description:
RIO is a fast paced, light family card game which acts superbly as a filler.

What makes the game special is that it comes in the Parker Brothers standard box size of its time, same as e.g. Star Reporter.
Thus it is completely oversized, but if it's your cup of tea you are rewarded during gameplay by excellent graphics on the board and the box inlays where holiday scenes are depicted.

Game consists of 48 cards - 4 sets of 12 numbers in 4 colours - which have to be laid out in a given pattern onto the board where a kind of discard-clock is shown.

In order to win you have to get rid of your cards before all other players.

You can score in different ways, and you have to decide when it's the best time to lay out your own or to destroy opponents winning combination and when to exchange cards of your hand with pre-dealt cards on the clock.

Although the rules state that 3 to 6 can play it also works well with 2 players, and there are variants for partnership play.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Property
description:
Property was published in A Gamut of Games.

This game is played with an 8x8 squares grid and a deck of common cards. Also, each player have some money at his disposal.

The cards are divided, being the numbers used to determine coordinates (black are the lines and red the columns)on the grid and the figures to represent buying power of the players.

In his turn, a player plays two cards corresponding to a coordinate in the grid. If that square is empty, he take possession of it, if that square belongs to another player, he must pay a rent to that player, and after that, has a chance to buy that square with his figures cards. If the square is him own, he mortgage that square. If a square is mortgaged twice, that player loses its possession.

Game ends when a player can not pay a rent. The winner is the player with most money, properties are not considered.
publishers: Buchclub, Dover Publications, dtv (Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag), Hugendubel Verlag, Hutchinson, Random House, Inc., RBA Libros S.A.

name: Mediterranean Melee: The Battle of Lepanto (1571 AD)
description:
“In 1571 Pope Pius V succeeded in uniting Spain, Venice, and the other Mediterranean Christian powers into the Holy League. The Holy League fleet was commanded by Don Juan. They encountered the Turkish fleet near Lepanto and won a decisive victory . . . Lepanto was the largest naval battle of the renaissance, and the last great battle of the oared galleys. The galleys would were soon made obsolete by sailing ships that could out maneuver the oared warships and fire a powerful broadside of cannon fire.”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using miniature ships. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules.

Each miniature represents approximately three galleys. The galleys are armed with forward firing guns and can also attack by ramming. Grappling and boarding actions are also covered in the rules.

name: Battle of Agincourt (1415 AD)
description:
“In 1415 Henry V’s invasion of France wasn’t going well. His exhausted army desperately needed to get to the safety of Calais if they were to survive. The French were determined to prevent their escape."

"A large French army intercepted the English and forced a battle. Henry deployed his army so that heavy woods would protect both of his flanks, forcing the French to attack across a narrow front, negating much of their manpower advantage. To make matters worse for the French heavy rains had reduced the battlefield to a muddy quagmire. As the ill-disciplined French advanced through the mud the deadly English archers shot them to pieces.”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted two per stand. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules. Units portrayed in the game include commanders, mounted knights, crossbowmen, longbow men, and infantry.

name: Anomalies of Love
description:
Anomalies of Love is a game about love and relationships. The game starts when players meet their special someone. As they get to know each other better they can focus on the 8 things that their relationship can rely on, the things that hold the couple together – matching sense of humour, mutual outdoor hobbies, mutual intellectual hobbies, similar values, mutual dreams for the future, memories the couple have together, matching music taste and of course sex. The more they find in common in each other the more points they get.

The game proceeds by players placing tiles on the board. Both the tiles and game board have symbols for these 8 things that relationships can consist of and players try to match the symbols on tiles to those in game board.

However every tile also holds an evil promise. A chance for mistrust, a black heart that represents all the bad things in relationships. As player's tiles approach one another these black hearts become both something that jepardise your own relationship, but those of others too. If two black hearts are placed next to one another, then the one that was there first gets turned 45 degrees. If it can't do that or gets disconnected from the structure the tile is removed and relationship just lost some of its charm. In other words the way you place those black hearts at the beginning of the game can matter a lot. You need to build your relationship to withstand the bad times – make it into something so strong that even when shaked, it won't break.

There is also Agenda -cards that can alter the strategy each players has. In the end the player who has the most perfect love life will win the game.

name: Footsteps of the Prophet
description:
Footsteps of the Prophet is a game about the early succession to Khalifa, each player vying for control of Islam in the years after Muhammad's death. it is a game of conflict, diplomacy, treachery and a little bit of luck, for two to six players who have anywhere between fifteen minutes to an hour to kill, depending on how many players there are and how cutthroat they are about their strategy. Someone must take on the role of Khalifa, leading the faith. Can you unite the squabbling clans, pummel the Persians, beat back the Byzantines and unite the Arabian Peninsula?

More importantly, can you do it in spite of the other players?

Since only six of the first twelve Khalifa died of natural causes, there are frequent openings for the position. Based on historical events and people, winning takes strategy, diplomacy, and an occasional bit of treachery. The game is notable in that it has both English and Arabic-native versions, making it one of very few US games designed expressely for an Arabic-speaking audience.

The game includes 120 cards, quick-start rules, full rule book with historical details on the people, places and events of the time (632 CE), reference map and player aid sheet.
categories: Card Game, Civil War, Medieval, Political, Print & Play, Religious, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Voting

name: Joc-Fotbal
description: Light dice rolling football game for two. Players alternate rolling the dice to move their team across the squared board fighting for ball control. Quick passing is vital among the ten field players in order to get the ball past the rival team defenders' line and shooting for the goal.

name: Grognards & Grenadiers
description:
Napoleonic fast play card driven wargames rules
”Command by Colour” series.

From the website http://www.tsoa.be/html/titelblad_uk_napoleonic.html

"DESIGNER'S NOTES:
This is another set of my card driven wargame rules "COMMAND BY COLOUR", and although still loosely inspired by the Battle Cry & Memoir '44 games by Richard Borg, this game no longer has a battlefield divided in 3 sections, because I took a different approach. The left-centre-right wing Battle Cry/Memoir '44 principle has here been replaced by colour-coding the units red, green and blue (activated by command cards of the same colour) thus enabling the players to concentrate their units anywhere on the battlefield if they wish so."

Units can only be moved, battle or execute a special action according to the orders written on these cards.

To calculate the result of combat, special battle dice called "dice in dice" or "double dice" are used (search the net for suppliers, there are several).
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Spunky Monkeys Game
description:
From the back of the box:

Set up the tiles, spin the spinner, move your monkey marker, collect monkey tiles - catch the most monkeys to win.

Get a BANANA - Go Again!

15 - 30 minutes to play

Two ways to play for twice as much fun. Basic game or challenge game - either way, it's fun with Spunky Monkeys!

A simple game children can play on their own.
- No reading required to play
- Teaches color recognition
- Helps children learn to count and see directional moves of play
- Reinforces the lesson of taking turns

Ages 4 and up
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: DinoMight
description:
From Publisher

Figure rules for gaming with Dinosaurs, other Prehistoric Creatures and Humans foolish enough to get involved with them.

The aim of the game is to keep your Dinosaurs alive and eat the other players Dinosaurs, causing them as much trouble as you can.

Each species has it's own characteristics, 6 or more (more if it flies or swims), plus a size bracket (which affects combat, but another characteristic, Concealment, affects spotting) and a points cost. Each turn, in initiative order (roll 1d10) creatures move (a distance determined by species), attack one another (opposed d10 rolls adding attack & defence per species), suffer the consequences (damage reduces characteristics), attempt to spot other creatures (sensory acuity by species) and test for panic if attacked or hurt (panic rating, again, by species, less aggressive species panic more easily. Rules on ambushes, charges and some very simple terrain effects are included, as are rules for time-travelling human intervention - either 'cave men' or modern hunters.

51 species of ancient creatures are detailed (all of which are available in 10mm scale metal miniatures from the publisher), along with variously armed humans and their vehicles (with ranged combat rules). A number of possible scenario suggestions is included. The rules are simple by figures gaming standards, but fairly complete as a combat game. Graphics are very basic, and the rulebook is 24 pages of A4 stapled with a clear plastic cover.

UPDATE: as of the end of 2020, the latest version, while seeming to have the same rules, presentation, and physical format, has a MASSIVELY expanded list of creatures, close to 600 of them! These now cover everything from the Cambrian (admittedly with only one entry!) to the Tertiary. Accordingly, page count has increased to 44.

name: Design Patterns Playing Cards
description:
The game consists out of a deck of 100 cards showing 24 different design patterns used in software development.

Each card, with the exception of the Joker, shows a letter in the middle, which represents the type of the pattern:
C = Creational
S = Structural
B = Behavioral

There are 3 game suggestions for this deck of cards on the publisher website:

Patterns Poker: http://www.industriallogic.com/games/pp.html

Name That Pattern: http://www.industriallogic.com/games/ntp.html

Pattern Cocktail: http://www.industriallogic.com/games/pcocktail.html

More information about the game:

http://www.industriallogic.com/games/dppc.html

name: Speculation
description:
Speculation is played using two standard decks of cards divided into a stack for each suit, with six cards removed from each stack. Each suit represents a commodity.

Each round one card from each stack is turned over to give the price for that commodity. All players may buy or sell the four commodities. If a face card is revealed for a commodity all holdings in it are wiped out. The wealthiest player after a set number of rounds wins the game.

name: Kopf an Kopf
description:
From the box:

The starting signal for the big horse race is audible and the horses start to run. After a while you notice an exciting neck and neck race on the racetrack. The lead changes all the time. Place your cards in a clever way so that your horse wins in the end. An exciting horse race for 2-4 players where the horses are moved by number cards.

Gameplay description:

There are two different ways to play the game:

1. Each player plays a card on his turn and moves his horse.

2. Each player plays a hidden card and all the cards are revealed at the same time. The lowest cards and the highest cards are discarded, and the other players move their horses. Two special cards (gallop and walk) can change this procedure.

After ten rounds (each player has ten cards), the player with the most lap token wins.

name: Heian
description:
平安 (Heian) is a short two-player game set in Heian era Japan (9th to 12th centuries). Some of the characteristics of that era that are somehow worked into the design of the game are the hunger for wood that had to be brought in from farther and farther to the new capital; the struggles with the Emishi in the north-east; and the troubles of financing both.

In the game, player build cities, parts of the capital Heian, and fight with the Emishi who occupy the north-east. Cities need wood to be built and that wood needs to be brought in from previously built cities. Cities also produce wood, and in some cases also metals. Forests can be cut to produce building timber only once, however. In fact, some areas that were known for their good timber before the Heian era, only produced firewood and charcoal at the end of the period. Hence, during the game, Japan slowly gets deforested and urbanized and resources are getting increasingly scarce. The player that managed to build and transport most efficiently and that built the most cities and the most (and best) buildings in the capital wins the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, City Building, Economic, Environmental, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Eiertanz
description: Wooden eggs are laid out in pairs on the game board. Players are divided into teams of two. One is blindfolded and has to move a wooden hare through the eggs without touching them, while the other player is giving the necessary instructions.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement

name: Bailén 1808
description:
Wargame reproducing the Battle of Bailén (July,19 1808) of the War of Independence, Spain.

The wargame appears in the newspaper "El Pais" Supplement (June,21 1981).

Components:
• One 12 x 11" map
• 80 Counters
• One Rulebook
• One Scenario

Time Scale: 1h.

name: WYT
description:
The Game of "WYT"
Will You Triumph?

The game has a space theme unrelated to the game play.

The board is made of alternating black and white triangles.

Each players controls one set of 10 pieces subdivided into four types that each move a different number of triangles.

The goal of the game is to move your Grydmaster(King) to the board's center square. All of a player's pieces are set up on one side of the board.

Each turn, a player selects one piece to move. He may capture by landing on an opponent's piece. If he captures an opponent's Grydmaster he gets to control all of that player's pieces.

A interesting touch: a die is included only to determine the start player.

name: Kham Khom
description:
In Thailand, There is an attempt to create boardgames that use the Thai alphabet in a Scrabble like game and its name is Kham Khom (คำคม - meaning: epigram)

Instead of using 26 English - Latin letters, the game uses the Thai alphabet. The Thai alphabet has 44 consonants , 20 vowels, 4 Diacritics and some symbols that are necessary in usage. The game uses only 42 consonants (At present, 2 of the 44 are dropped from being used) and drawn vowel tiles can be set aside and then can be played anytime in the turn without drawing.

The rules of Kham Khom is some slightly different from Scrabble because the Thai alphabet has a more complex system than the English - Latin alphabet.

name: Barbarossa on the North
description:
This game covers the Northern half of the Barbarossa Campaign. The period starts June 1941 and ends February 1942.

100 counters unmounted (must be mounted on hard-paper. Be careful because double-sided)
1 game map (printed on the back of the magazine thus mounted)

This is a first part of two parts game and published in (old) Game Journal issue #41.

name: Two Hundred Years: 5mm Wargame Rules 1700-1900
description:
5mm Wargame Rules. 1700-1900
These rules are designed for 5mm figures and cover the period approximately 1700 to 1900, which is generally called the Horse and Musket period. The type of game created is definitely of a wargame style as opposed to a board game style. The scales for the game are 1mm = 1m, 1 figure = 20 men and 1 gun = 2 guns. Time scale is less important since the pace of the game will never reflect that of real time. Units are battalion with 15 to 50 figures.
categories: Age of Reason, American Civil War, American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Tosti!
description:
Tosti! is a simple game (created by a child for children) about building sandwiches, specifically tostis, a Dutch version of a grilled cheese.

Players share a deck of translucent cards showing bread, cheese, ham, onions, and tomatoes. On their turn, players will draw a card to start a new sandwich, place it on an existing sandwich, or put it on the bottom of the deck.

Complete the required number of sandwiches to win the game!

name: Dogfight!
description: This game appears to be an Air Combat version of Battleship. Each player has two pegboards. One pegboard is hidden behind a screen in which the player secretly places his pieces. The other peg board is played in the open and used to track which points have been identified. Game Pieces differ in sizes from occupying between two to four peg holes. Game lasts slightly longer than a typical game of Battleship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Deduction, Fighting, World War II

name: Munich Decathlon Game
description: MUNICH DECATHLON Olympic Game. Roll and move game similar to Avalon Hills Decathlon Game except there are no real Decathletes. Each event is scored individually by roll of the dice with the possibility of injuries occurring and then scoring is done similarly to real Decathlon Scoring. This game came out just before the 1972 Olympics and of course was tempered by what happened in Munich in the real games.

name: Murder Mystery Evening: Dead on Time
description:
Host your own murder mystery evening. An "investigator" narrates the action on CD, which directs the play and sets the mood for a unique dinner party experience. Includes: invitations, host instruction booklet, character booklets, name tags, and themed recipes.

Similar to other murdery mystery games, though in this dinner party style game the action is more scripted. One player takes the part of the investigator, who narrates the story along with a CD that directs play and sets the mood.

This particular title is themed in the Cold War era Soviet Union.

Includes: CD, invitations, host instruction booklet, character booklets, name tags, and themed recipes.
categories: Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Battlestar Galactica: Colonial Battlefleet
description:
This game is intended to replicate the feel of space combat as it appears on the new Battlestar Galactica show that airs weekly on the SciFi channel.

To play the game you will need:
- Miniatures or counters to represent the spaceships
- Miniatures or counters to represent missiles and torpedoes (a lot of them!)
- Several each of six sided, eight sided, ten sided, and twelve sided dice (d6,d8,d10,d12)
Note: In some places you will be required to roll one or more d9’s. To roll a d9, roll a d10 normally, but treat the 10 as a zero.
- Printouts of the ship combat record for each ship participating in the battle
- A battle mat marked in hexes large enough to accommodate your ship models/counters.

The game is designed to be simple to learn and fast paced, yet still provide an engaging tactical experience that will provide countless hours of fun.

The object of the game is to destroy your enemy’s fleet. The cylons accomplish that by hanging back with their carriers and sending wave after wave of missiles and fighters at the colonial fleet, possibly accompanied by Cylon battleships, trying to overwhelm the Colonial defenses.

Conversely, the colonials want to get in as close as possible to the cylon base carriers so that they can pound them into so much scrap with their powerful rail guns.
You may also wish to create scenarios with other objectives as well, perhaps based on sequences from the show, such as the battle at Ragnar Station, or simply scenarios you dream up yourself.
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Damix
description:
DAMIX is an innovative game based on observation, tactics and moving in a 3 dimensions environment based on a territory of 6 sides of different colors.

Goal of the game : The Goal for each player is to choose 1 color and to transfer the pawns to the opposite side of the cube as fast as possible.

The winner is the player or the players who in the same round has located all the pawns on the opposite side of the same color in a cross pattern.

FAST GAME : the winner is the first player who locate the 8 pawns in his territory (16 possible patterns).

Game Advise : Do not let one pawn standing alone as each move will cost one round…

One player game : The target of the game is to bring the pawns to the opposite side with a minimum of moves.
Sudoku Colors play option available .

name: Pride Cycle
description:
This game is based on the Pride Cycle as described in the Book of Mormon. The righteous are blessed and prosper, they begin to love money more than God and become wicked. The final phase is when they are humbled, and they become righteous once more.
The aim of the game is to have the largest presence in the Book of Mormon lands.
No dice - simple 'Rock, Scissors, Paper' style conflict, (in this case it is Army, Settlement, Preaching) with different actions for 'winning' with each action.

An additional mechanic means that as players progress around the pride cycle which encircles the map territories, the resolution of 'draws' is altered by the relative positions on the pride cycle.
categories: American Indian Wars, Print & Play, Religious
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: Triomph
description:
The objective of this abstract game is to capture the 4 center spots on the board and hold them for one round.

You use cards to move your pieces over the board and to attack other pieces (moving and attack cards are different). So you are limitied in your options by the cards you draw.

By forming "trios" (three of your stones with different colours) you can make your pieces stronger, but you will slow them down at the same time.

name: Crowns of the North
description:
The year is 1530. The reformation is hitting its stride in Europe. The Kalmar Union has been dissolved. Gustav Vasa rules in Sweden while Christian III is about to ascend the throne of Denmark under the looming clouds of a civil war.

In Crowns of the North, you play as a noble family through 320 years of Scandinavian history in a game of power struggle and development. The players use resources (produced by provinces) and silver to purchase new provinces, develop Scandinavia by enacting new laws and precipitating historical events, and build famous historical buildings. Over the course of the game, the players may also become the patron of famous historical characters such as Ludvig Holberg, Carl von Linne, and Tycho Brahe. But the threat of war is ever present: Russia, Poland/Prussia and the German Principalities all have their sights on Scandinavia and both Sweden-Finland and Denmark-Norway have ambitions of making the Baltic their personal domain.

Will Sweden rise to power on the back of the Thirty Years war? Will Karl XII create a greater Swedish empire or die of a musket ball through the temple at some obscure Norwegian fortress? Can the Russian bear be stopped, or will Finland once again fall to the Tsar of Russia? Which nation will rule the North? The player who best maneuvers the vagaries of history and influences events to their advantage will be the winner of the Crowns of the North.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Crimson Skies: Spicy Air Tales – Volume 1
description:
Supplements to FASA's 1998 Crimson Skies (a game of aerial combat), the two volumes were more than just flavor text. Spicy Air Tales Vol.1 and Spicy Air Tales Vol.2 provided additional scenarios to play with the base game, adding some of the features disclosed in the contained stories.


This entry is for the Volume 1.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Pirates

name: Second World War at Sea: Strait of Magellan
description:
The stormy waters at the Southern Cone of the Americas saw very little fighting during the Second World War. But that didn't keep staff officers from the South American navies and the Royal Navy from wondering what would happen if the Axis fleets did penetrate into the region. U.S. Army Chief of Staff Gen. George C. Marshall considered a Japanese attempt to damage or destroy the Panama Canal to be the likely opening move of a war in the Pacific, making the sea lanes around Tierra del Fuego vital to the Allied war effort.

Strait of Magellan is a supplement for the Second World War at Sea series. There are ten scenarios, or separate game situations, based on battles that might have taken place in these waters, but ultimately did not. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of our Cone of Fire, Midway, Bismarck and Leyte Gulf games and our East of Suez supplement.

Strait of Magellan is sold BOTH via .pdf download and as a printed booklet - you only need one.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Explore! Photo Safari
description:
The fastest one wins! With the help of clues, you must be the frist player to photograph the animals on the card. Take a chance! Play it Fast! Place your pawn on the animal and photograph it. With explore photo safari you and your children will be captivated by geography.

This game includes an oversized boardgame map of the world 4 pawns for 2 to 4 players, and 112 animal cards with 336 clues to play three different ways. For ages 4 and up: Visual Clues; For Ages 7 and up: Descriptive clues; for Ages 9 and up: Geographic Clues.

name: Roaches!
description:
A Skin-crawling card game for 3-6 players.

You have an infestation problem and the only way to deal with it is to give it to someone else!

In Roaches! all players begin with a hand of cards representing their roach infestation. By forming pairs they may discard these cards either to other players or to a central pile on the table. By playing your cards on an opponent you can keep them from returning the favour, but by playing to the pile you can draw a special event card which may have the power to change the game ... because at any time you might just get stuck with every roach on the table!

This game is free for download at http://kenmgames.wordpress.com
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Around the House Treasure Hunt Game
description:
This game is a family game that puts a pirate themed spin on the cooperative treasure hunt. Players get one of several secret riddles printed up on scrolls. Once they solve the riddle and find the correct location, they then need to solve the next riddle they find there, and so on, until they find the hidden bag of treasure coins.

Game components:
-Game Box that looks just like a treasure chest
-Fabric Treasure Map
-Velour drawstring bag with nicely printed jolly roger
-Plastic Gold coins
-30 scrolls with riddles
-instructions.

name: Island Invasion: Amphibious Assault Game
description:
Island Invasion is a simple game about the American invasion of Guam in World War II (the rules do not give the name of the island, but it is clearly Guam from the map, not to mention the publisher had an office there). The American player starts with 6 landing craft approaching the island, and must land them in the face of artillery and pillbox fire from the Japanese. Once the Americans have landed, the soldiers can capture each other.

Contents:

14 plastic American soldiers
14 plastic Japanese soldiers
6 landing craft counters
2 dice
1 board
1 set of English rules
1 set of Japanese rules

name: Horse Race Derby
description: A horse racing game on a lithographed tin. Players roll marbles into indentations in the center of the lid, and move their magnetic horses the appropriate distance around the outer track.

name: A Call to Arms: The Drakh
description: 24 page softcover expansion for A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat adding the Drakh to the game. The book includes 3 scenarios involving the Drakh as well as their ships and the Drakh special rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Der Uhrmacher
description:
The Clockmaker is dead.
With him, the secret to his machine whose mechanical purpose seems heading towards a cataclysmic end.

The Royal Society of London has dispatched some of it's most promising members to solve this machine and disassemble it before it's too late.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: El juego de los juegos
description:
El juego de los juegos (The game of games) is a trivia game related to video games which was published by Spanish magazine Micromanía to celebrate their number 100.

The mechanics are simple. Every player starts in the same place on the board and should advance to the end while answering questions correctly. There's no dice; you only advance if your answer is correct, and if you fail you take a step back.

Game contents:
-Game board
-12 coloured tokens (3 red, 3 orange, 3 blue, 3 magenta)
-100 question cards (4 questions each)
-16 special cards "Micromanía: Sólo para adictos" (4 questions each)

name: Categorically Speaking
description:
This is a trivia board game with cards that provide basic category choices in a mechanic similar to the classic Scattergories party game. Players enter a wheel-shaped board and match letters with categories as they move toward the Winner's Circle in the center.

Includes the board, tokens, timer, cards, dice, rules, and score pad.

name: Pyramide
description:
The game consists of a wooden step pyramid and 72 wooden bricks in three sizes and four colors. There are four sets of game rules included, three of them dealing with building the pyramid (= laying the bricks onto the wooden gameboard until it is completely covered), one with dismantling it.

- In the first variant, the color of each layer is fixed. Players try to get rid of their large pieces first, as the first player to run out of pieces wins, and the larger the piece, the harder it is to place once the layers get smaller.

- In the second variant, any color can be placed anywhere, except that no brick can touch another brick of the same color

- In the third variant, everything is allowed (a quick and rather random variant)

- In the dismantling variant, every player can take one piece per turn, trying to get the biggest pieces as they count most points.
publishers: (Self-Published), ABRA, Edition Perlhuhn (Göttinger Spiele), Otto Maier Verlag

name: Mousey
description: Simple game involving a spinner, a mouse playing piece and twelve die-cut, heavy card-stock slices of "cheese." Cheese slices have printed holes and actual holes. Shuffle the cheese pieces, then stack them with the die-cut edges aligned. Mouse starts on any printed hole and first player spins and moves clockwise the number that the spinner lands on. If mouse lands in an actual hole player carefully lifts the cheese slice over the mouse, keeps it and takes another turn. When the mouse has made his way through the entire pile of cheese slices, the game is over and the player with the most slices of cheese is the winner!

name: Uncle Albert's Auto Stop & Gunnery Shop 2038 Catalog
description:
Uncle Albert's Auto Stop & Gunnery Shop 2038 Catalog Update is the third in a subset of expansion for Car Wars. The Catalogs contain new weapons and options for use with the Car Wars Series of games.

The Uncle Al's subset of expansions includes:

Uncle Al's 2035 Catalog (1985)
Uncle Al's 2036 Catalog Update (1986)
Uncle Al's 2038 Catalog Update (1988)
Uncle Al's 2038 Calendar (1988)
Uncle Al's 2039 Catalog Update (1989)
Uncle Al's Catalog From Hell (1992)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Revelation
description:
To be the player with the smallest score, trying not to take pawns and crowns. Play a card from your hand on one of the branches of the Tree of Life, following the Decktet suits. If once placed, all the cards from that branch add up to more than 12 points, then you'll have to take a number of those cards, from end towards the beginning, until they add up to at least 12 points. You've got to try to take the least number of cards, but if you've got to take many, at least try to have the most cards possible from that suit, that way you can be immune to its power. There are 8 poisoned cards (4 pawns and 4 crowns) that spoil the branches and lower your score. Try not to take them.

This is a resource management game for the Decktet.

Game Rules:

* Revelation at the Decktet wiki
* Revelation blog post from the designer.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Trick-taking

name: Chocochulo
description:
The aim of the game is to collect four chocolates with the same flavor.
All Chocolates are placed in the middle of the table. On his turn, a player picks a Chocolate, looks under it and announces a fragrance. The one he saw, or another one.
The second player could do the same or try to steal a chocolate.
The first player to collect four chocolate with the same flavor wins.
Be careful, mashroom you must get ride of mushroom chocolates to win.

name: Hopalong Canasta
description:
This is like regular canasta with the twist of Hopalong Cassidy themed playing cards with words instead of regular playing cards.

There are also simplified rules for children to play as the cards simply have pictures and words instead of the usual 4 suits and number/symbol system.

name: Beat the Bookie
description: A horse racing game in which players take on the joint roles of gamblers, bookmakers and horse owners. Talk about conflict of interest! Racing is accomplished by moving horses around a mapboard racetrack. As each player has incentives to win or lose, or help another player to win or lose, tactics can get quite involved. All very thought provoking.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hometown Monopoly: La Crosse
description:
Gameplay is the same as the original Monopoly except:
1.You have either one or two branches instead of houses and motels.
2.Any three businesses in a row improves rent by 3x even if improved with a branch.

Origin:
David A. Colbert is a board game designer and puzzle and game manufacturer. An advertising executive, he came up with the idea of marketing a real estate trading game called Hometown Monopoly in which the properties on the board that are purchased and rented would be actual businesses in the hometown of the person purchasing the game. He produced his first game in 1980 for the city of Oshkosh, Wisconsin. He and a good friend, Arnold Miller of La Crescent, Minnesota held the copyrights and trademarks for the Hometown Monopoly series of boardgames through their holding company, Milco, Inc. Colbert incorporated Citigames of America, Inc. in 1982, and with that company and Hometown Productions, both Milco licensees, went on to produce localized monopoly games for over 500 cities and towns in the United States and Canada. In 1985, Colbert developed Hometown Trivia and began to market that series of board games through Colbert Productions and Butler Games, Ltd. In 1986, Colbert marketed Puzzlement, a localized jigsaw puzzle that was sold only in Oshkosh and is a rare find today.
In 1988, Colbert sold the Trademark rights to the name Hometown Monopoly to Parker Brothers, Inc., producer of the famous MONOPOLY board game, licensing back from them the right to continue to produce his games in the cities and towns where he had developed versions of that game. In 1996, Colbert produced his last Hometown Monopoly game, fittingly an updated version of his original Oshkosh Monopoly.
Also in 1996, Colbert shifted his publishing focus from board games to magazines, building a second successful business with The Apartment Directory and The Builders Guide, both magazines serving the Fox Valley region of Wisconsin.
Colbert's Hometown Monopoly games for Baltimore and Washington DC led to his involvement with the nation-wide unification event, Hands Across America, which earned him an invitation to President Ronald Reagan's Second Inaugural Ball.
Today, David A. Colbert is retired and lives in West Palm Beach,
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mobile Soldier in Action
description:
Mobile Soldier in Action is a table top combat game. The game units represent large piloted mecha and is played on a hex grid. Scale of the game is 25m per hex, and is scalable to any size hex players want based on the models or chits used.

This rule set provides levels of detail that are missing from most typical miniatures games, as the focus is on individual units rather than squads of units. Some rule details include movement allowances for ground and space combat, piloting skills and costs, build costs, multiple weapons and affects, firing arcs, fields of vision, damage tracking, etc.

The game can easily be played on a typical hex grid with chits or minis, or scaled up to play with models of any size. Existing sets like Heroscape terrain work well for miniature scale models.
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Puss in the Corner
description:
Each player takes three pieces of the same colour and sits with an arm of the board in front of him or her, and in turn, spins the indicator and moves, starting from the end of one of the arms, as many spaces towards the end of the Opposite arm as he or she spin indicates.

The object of each player is to get 3 pieces from their starting space to the similar space of his or hers opponent on the opposite side of the board. There are three distinct rows of squares in each arm.

The player who first gets three pieces across the board, wins the game.

name: Cholor-tiles
description:
Players lays the tiles on the table to form (blue, red ,green or yellow) color areas and try to finish these to score.

In his turn:
a) player lays a tile (so that all colors on the new tile continue to colors respectively, on all abutting tiles.)
b) player must place his token from his supply in any free color area on that tile
c) scoring takes place for any finished areas.
Players score as many points as there are tiles included in this area minus 2 in this color and takes the oken back to his supply. (If player finishes area with only 2 tiles he scores 2-2=0 points.)
d) player draws new tile

Game ends if there are no tiles left and player whose weakest color is the strongest in the end of the game is winner.

Contents:
70 tiles
24 tokens in 4 colors
scoring markers

name: Iranian Jihad
description:
Everybody seems worried lately about whether Iran is trying to develop nuclear weapons. Play Iranian Jihad and find out what could happen if they do.

Four scenarios based on today’s headlines, everything from an Israeli preemptive strike to an Iranian nuclear attack on the continental US. What terrors does the future hold? Find out in Iranian Jihad!

The game includes an 11x17” map of the Middle East, three color counter sheets of military playing pieces, a cardstock atomic weapon track and complete rules. This divisional-level wargame design is by the same author as Second American Revolution and includes air and ground units, rules for atomic weapons (duh,) armor exploitation, aerial refueling, stealth aircraft, American intervention, the UN, Hamas, Hezbollah and complete orders of battle for the armies of the Middle Eastern countries most likely to become involved in an Iranian Jihad.

Game out various scenarios and responses by world nations. Does Iran have a chance to destroy Israel? Can Israel and the moderate Arabs stop them without resorting to nuclear weapons? What will other world nations likely do? Find out in Iranian Jihad! Experience the future on your kitchen table.

name: Trimok
description:
Trimok is a new board game for two, developed from the old Japanese game jan-ken-pon (scissors paper rock).
The idea of the game

Two players (White and Black) play against each others and they try to capture all opponent's pieces with their own pieces. There are three kinds of pieces: scissors, paper and rock. The capture-rules for White are as follows: white scissors take black paper, white paper take black rock and white rock take black scissors. Correspondingly the capture-rules for Black: black scissors take white paper, black paper take white rock and black rock take white scissors.

In the beginning of the game each player has four pieces of each kind, i.e. 12 pieces in all. The board is divided into 6 by 6 squares and the pieces are set according to figure 1. The game is over, when other player wins the game or the players agree on a draw. The player wins the game, when he/she captures the other player's last piece or when the other player cannot move any piece.

The moves
Each player, in turns, moves one piece. The White player starts the game. Every piece can be moved in the same way: one square at a time in any direction on the board, i.e. forwards, backwards, to the sides and also diagonally forwards and backwards. If a piece does not capture another piece within a move, it can be moved only to an empty square.

In the game is one special move, called return-move: When a piece has made it to the opponent's side to the last row, it can be moved back on some of the next turns, to its own side's first row, to the same column's or adjacent column's empty square. (There is at most three possible squares for a return-move.) When making a return-move, the piece can be exchanged for a piece that is not currently on the board. Making the return-move the piece can not capture other pieces. Examples of possible moves and return-moves are presented in figure 2.

name: March Madness Movie Pack: ASL Goes to the Movies
description:
Produced by the Kansas City Irregulars and distributed at the 2008 March Madness ASL Tournament. Not available commercially, 75 copies of this pack were handed out at the tournament, and is the 3rd scenario pack designed by the Kansas City Irregulars. While most ASL packs are designed around historical battles, this expansion pack is an exception. It features 9 scenarios based on WW II movies. The scenarios setup shows generic counters without artwork.

Contents:
Cover Sheet
Scenario list and movie reference
Special Rules
9 Scenarios - MMMP1-MMMP9
2 overlays
7 counters

Scenarios:
MMMP1 Dirty Dozen
MMMP2 The Bridge over the River Kwai
MMMP3 Kelly's Heroes
MMMP4 Days of Glory
MMMP5 Winter War (Talvisota)
MMMP6 The Glory Brigade
MMMP7 The Battle of the Bulge
MMMP8 The Fighting Seabees
MMMP9 Sahara
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Hide & Seek
description:
Hide & Seek is the family board game released by LemonTree Games in May 2009. This is a capture game where multiple rounds are played. Scoring occurs when a player captures another player, or when a "hiding" player eventually makes it "home". The winner of the game is determined by the first player to reach a point value determined by the number of players in the game.

Two versions of game play are available, version 1 stays true to the outdoor version of Hide & Seek, and version 2 allows players to stay more engaged by changing their status from being sought to seeking when captured (as opposed to simply being "out").

A version of the game also exists for the iPhone. The iPhone version is a simpler, singe round, single player version of the game that allows players to be "IT" or to hide.

The game is primarily available at: www.lemontreegames.com and in a growing number of specialty toy retailers.

name: Indian Country: an Ambush Alley Mini-Campaign
description:
Indian Country is an Ambush Alley! A Game of Modern Urban Combat scenario pack containing three thematically related Ambush Alley scenarios.
Indian Country returns to Dawala and the stalwart men of Lt. Meuse's 2nd Platoon, a fictional city and unit introduced in The Three Block War: an Ambush Alley Mini-Campaign.

This chapter of 2nd Platoon's operations in Dawala sees the platoon re-deployed to Irkala, a dusty frontier town near the border of a nation hostile to coalition operations. Irkala has long been a conduit for foreign fighters and smuggled weapons – 2nd Platoon hopes to change all that.

Expands:

Ambush Alley! A Game of Modern Urban Combat
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Total Meltdown
description: Your mission... should you choose to accept it... is to complete 4 pressure-packed time challenges before the computer core suffers a Total Meltdown! This awesome game requires quick reactions and serious cool to complete challenges and save the core! First, decipher the correct port for each of the 'live wires', then complete the circuit with 12 perplexing pieces, before you have to crack the code to access the core! With flashing lights and sounds to add to the tension, this interactive sci-fi style game is a brilliant game for all the family!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Deduction, Electronic, Memory, Real-time

name: Standoff
description: You robbed the bank and made the cleanest of getaways, but should maybe have agreed in advance how to split the money. As the police sirens approach, it's a time for snap decisions, persuasive arguments and unflinching water-pistol standoffs.

name: Nichts als Ärger: Ab ins Boot
description: Nichts als Ärger - Ab ins Boot is a stand-alone two-player version of "Mensch ärgere dich nicht", also known as "Ludo" or "Pachisi", including Nichts als Ärger! and a few special rules. To my knowledge this was only available at Essen 2007. It might have been 2006.

name: Arena Magica
description:
Yannar dived for cover as his foe's fireball exploded overhead. The rain of flaming death fell all about the arena, but Yannar's protective spell resisted the flames and saved his life. Rolling to his feet, the young wizard cast his own spell, a bolt of lighting flying from his hands. This would be no easy fight he thought to himself as his foe deflected the energy of the spell with his magical shield. No Yannar thought, this would be no easy victory.

This is Arena Magica, the newest Mini-Game by Bad Baby Productions. Create a wizard gladiator, train him or her in the skills of killing and then equip them with the weapons, armor and spells of your choice. Send them into the arena to battle other warriors and wizard to see who is the best, the toughest, the bravest in the lands. A game all to itself, it is fully compatible with Arena, and combined they form a truly expansive system of battle and mayhem.

Mini-Game #24

Integrates with:

Arena

name: Rickety Ships
description:
Rickety Ships (aka: Space Nertz) uses 2-4 standard decks of playing cards and poker chips or pocket change to partially simulate the experience of the space-truck building phase of "Galaxy Trucker". This game is in no way meant to be a build your own "Galaxy Trucker" game nor should it be played instead of playing "Galaxy Trucker." Instead, Rickety Ships is meant more to serve as a new experience for groups who regularly play speed games like "Nertz" or "Pick Two!"

Rickety Ships is played over 3 rounds. In each round, each player seeks to build his own ship from the supply of cards in the middle of the table, attempting to earn as many of the 5 victory points available at the end of each round. At the end of the 3rd round, the player who has earned the most of the 15 available victory points is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Arena Assault
description:
"In the beginning, warriors fought for the pleasure of their people. Now, thousands of years later, robots continue the tradition.

Arena Assault is the fast paced, multi-player card game of gladiatorial arena combat."

Each player chooses a deck, which represents a gladiator. Players start with 15 life points and a hand of four cards drawn from their deck.

During a turn, players may play Attack Cards against their opponent(s), play Defense Cards to protect their gladiator, play Special Cards, and discard and draw new cards into their hands.

If a player loses all of their life points, they are considered destroyed. The winner is the last player standing.

name: Luxopolis
description:
Luxopolis is a Luxemburgish copy (or nearly) of Monopoly.

Rules are nearly the same - the board shows in the middle a satellite view of the city of Luxembourg. Around there are spaces with shops, enterprises, railway stations, ... to buy (instead of roads)

As nearly everything is based on Luxemburgish companies, these are also sponsors of this game. The backs of the cards show names of well-known companies - the board game itself is full with names of shops, radio stations, banks etc.

name: Logomaus
description:
Logomaus is a word game from Jean du Poel. The game includes a deck of cards, each showing one letter of the alphabet. As with many games of this type, there are multiple cards of the more common letters but only single cards of the ones least used.

Players are dealt a set of cards, and on a turn can either take two cards from the draw deck and the optionally may discard one, or they can take only the top card from the discard pile. They then can form words, with a minimum of three letters.

The game has two scoring options. One uses pebbles, and at the end of each round pebbles are awarded for longest word, most words, and for use of the letters with only a single card. The other option is to use the included board.Players start at the 10 spot, and earn points for words as above but lose a point for each card not used.

name: Seido
description: Seido is a domino-style game from Jean du Poel and Historien Spielgalerie. The game includes a number of wooden tiles with cut edges such that, laid together, six tiles form a ring. Each tile shows two symbols (or a blank on one side), these being triangles, circles, and squares in three forms. Players roll a die to determine how many tiles will be placed on a turn, and score when they create three-way intersections of matching symbols. Also, if a player completes a circle, all other players must draw another tile. The game ends when one player places all of their tiles.

name: Card Cricket
description:
From the rules:

Card Cricket was the result of 2 1/1 years' painstaking research into the statistical records of cricket matches going back several years. But it had its lighter side, too. It involved many pleasant days spent watching actual matches - recording every single detail of the games so that Card Cricket would be as authentic as possible.

Equipment:
i) Two packs of cards as follows:
a) Bowling pack (110 cards)
b) Batting pack (108 cards)
ii) A scoring pad which resembles an ordinary cricket score book
iii) A special die - 5 faces showing out and 1 face showing 'not out'.
iv) A chart showing by means of asterisks which batting shots can be played against the various types of balls that can be bowled
v) A loose scoring sheet which serves as an example of how to score with instructions printed on the back.

This is a mechanically simple cricket simulation game. You are expected to 'know' cricket (but why else would you be playing it?), and thus how to arrange and score matches, etc. Each player plays one team (obviously if more than two people are playing the game, they can take the part of different players in the cricket match).

The mechanism is one of hand management. The bowler picks 6 random cards for the balls in the over, which he can play in any order. The batsman has a number of batting cards which varies according to which number he is batting at. The bowler plays a card (a ball) and the batsman plays a card against that ball. If the batting card is a valid stoke for that ball (a cover drive for a half volley outside off stump, a sweep to a googly, etc), then the outcome is as printed on the batting card sometimes runs, but often just fielded. If the batting card is not a valid stroke for the ball bowled, then the batsman is likely to be out (there are appeals and not outs using the die). If he is not out, the batsman replenishes his hand, and the next ball is bowled.
publishers: Edu Games Ltd (UK), Games and Puzzles (magazine)

name: Jenga: Harley-Davidson Collector's Edition
description:
As the tower builds, so does the difficulty…and so does the fun!

This classic tower building game features 54 orange and grey hardwood blocks decked out with the iconic Harley-Davidson logo and TWO ways to play. Build your HD-themed Jenga tower the traditional way or play a new and even more challenging game with custom Harley rules and a Harley-themed dice. Either way you play you are guaranteed edge-of-your-seat excitement!

name: Two by Two
description:
From the publisher:

A Noah's ark memory game
Pair up the animals and post them in the big 3-D Noah's ark, then find the rain cloud to make the ark sail away.

name: Yo Ho Ho!
description:
From the publisher:

A pirate memory game
Use your memory to make up the different pirate pairs. If a pirate flag is turned over, do a dastardly deed and take another player's cards!

name: Sengoku Alliance
description: In the Sengoku period, six clans fight for superiority of medieval Japan! Clans receive points according to how many provinces they hold, and whichever clan has the most points at the end wins!

name: UK Trivia
description: So you think you know everything about the UK? Think again! UK Trivia challenges you with 2400 questions from six categories: History, Culture, Science, Geography, Sport and Miscellaneous. All questions concern the UK only. Be the first player to collect a puzzle piece from each category and you are the winner!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Call It A Day
description:
In Call It A Day!, a player is chosen to be storyteller, and begins by drawing one of over 200 Alias cards. The Alias card reveals the character for that round. The character might be a teacher or time traveler, mermaid or movie star, vet or vampire—or one of hundreds of other familiar and fantastical possibilities.

Now it's time to see what might happen in the character’s story. Draw eight of the more than 700 Call It A Day! Activity cards. The storyteller’s job is to tell a story that includes at least six of the eight Activities drawn. The storyteller now weaves a story, arranging the cards in whatever order helps tell the best story.

After the story has been told, the other players rate it from zero to five. The storyteller function then passes to the next player, with each storyteller drawing new Aliases and Activites and telling stories for a predetermined number of rounds. The player with the highest score wins.

name: Afghanistan 1980
description:
Afghanistan 1980 is a strategic simulation of the fight between the Mujahideen and the Armed Forces of the Soviet Union in the unforgiving mountainous terrain of Afghanistan.
The simulation begins in early 1980 after the initial occupation force of the 40th Army has been deployed.

name: Highlights Hidden Pictures Game
description:
"Search for hidden objects cleverly disguised within the 'Hidden Pictures' scenes. It takes concentration and a sharp eye."

This visual challenge includes 32 picture boards, 32 clue cards, 30 search cards, a timer, 100 plastic score chips, rules, and a storage insert.

Designed for kids 5 and older with two levels of play for different skill levels.

name: Classico Junior
description:
A trivia quiz game about classical music. It's in Dutch.
The game is targeted at children of age 8 and older.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Soaps (Where Soap Opera Writers Get Their Ideas)
description:
Gina cries to Alan, "If we only had a baby! That would make the murder of your brother bearable! It’s just so horrible that Ashley had to go to prison for it."

"What do you mean horrible? That woman had a past more sordid than your brother-in-law Eric. At least that snake is in a coma. There’s some justice in the world."

Sound like a really cheesy soap opera? You’re right! And one that you wrote! Tune in
next Time Their Ideas) is a card game for 2-5 players for an hour or so, where players are the managers of new soap operas during a trial period: the player whose show draws the highest audience (as determined by what events occur on their soap opera and which characters each involves) will go on to the main season! Just like real soap operas, the twists and turns of the plots in the game can be unbelievable, outlandish, tragic or funny.

There are two main decks in the game: Events and Characters. Every Event lists what types of characters can be involved and have a point value. Every Character has a sex, a sexual orientation, a point value, and a typecast (a special rule that applies to that character). The strategy lies in developing your soap opera to allow more exciting events as the game progresses.

Soaps is not a spoof on any particular show: it mocks all TV drama. No specific knowledge is required.

The game is quite simple: an 8-year-old could PLAY it, but a parent might not be pleased if the child's show were to feature adultery, homosexuality, murder, etc.

name: Nemesis: Skirmish Miniatures
description:
“Zenit. The most powerful of all the weapons ever forged, born from darkness before time and only witness of the creation of the universes. Only moved by savage and brutal instincts, travels from one reality to another calling at arms, turning whole worlds into battlefields and abandoning them sterile after centuries of never ending wars.”

Nemesis is a game in constant evolution because its licence Creative Commons turns it into a game, in which any player can help developing, changing or improving its rules and helping the whole Zenit Community making Nemesis a better game and what is more important, flexible for all types of players. We give you the foundation you write the legend.

name: APBA Professional Golf: Pine Valley
description:
The 6th Expansion for the APBA Professional Golf Game. Sold only by mail. "Pine Valley" came only with 9 boards, Each board depicting 2 holes of the course.

Pine Valley has no rough. The Greens and Fairways are surrounded by sand.

It is located in Clementon, New Jersey.

name: Karate Chop Game
description:
The entire game consists of a foam brick separated into two halves that fit together like two large puzzle pieces.
SETUP: One person is designated as the "Holder" and the other player is the "Chopper". The "Holder" holds the ends of the brick firmly, using two hands, so that its center is exposed. Face the "Chopper" and place the brick about chest high, holding it away from your body. This is the "Ready" position. As the "Chopper", face the "Holder" and place your chopping hand lightly over the exposed brick to aim. Then lift your hand to touch your ear. IMPORTANT - If you are RIGHT handed, use your LEFT hand - and if you are LEFT handed, use your RIGHT hand for the chopping hand.
TO PLAY: 1) The "Holder" must announce "Ready" to begin the contest. After announcing "Ready", the "Holder" may fake, pull the brick aside, or do anything to try to fool his opponent, the "Chopper", into committing himself. He must always return the brick to the "Ready" position to give the "Chopper" a chance to strike again. After each point is made the "Holder" must announce "Ready" before a new strike can be made. 2) The "Chopper" MUST KEEP HIS HAND AGAINST HIS EAR UNTIL he is READY TO CHOP. He can fake - but must always keep his hand touching the ear during the fake. Once he has started a chop, taking his hand from his ear, he must CONTINUE the chop and try to hit the brick.
TO SCORE: The "CHOPPER" scores one point if he strikes the brick. The "HOLDER" scores one point if the "Chopper" misses the brick.
After every 5 tries the players change places. The first one to score 11 points wins the game.

name: Hypochondria
description: The cure for whatever ails you! Hypochondria is a rummy-style game in which players compete to have their hands of illness cards cured by the rotating staff of physician cards. Each turn, players draw a new hand of illnesses and try to match sets of them to specialists and physicians, each of whom will treat a different sort of set. After all specialists have seen a patient, or a player manages to cure their entire hand, a round ends and players earn points for illnesses left uncured in their hands. At the end of several rounds, the player with the lowest number of points is the least sick, and therefore the winner!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: Puncto
description: This game is played on a 9x9 grid. A color die determines the color of the piece that has to be placed on the grid. However, pieces of the same color cannot be adjacent or in any direct line with out an "interfering" piece of a different color. Depending on the position, each piece counts 5 to 25 points. 5 points are deducted for placing a piece on one of the corner fields (a player doing this for the second time is eliminated). When 35 (out of 40) pieces are played, or all but one player is out, the player with most points is the winner.

name: Golden Mile
description:
Strike it Rich on the Gold Fields of Australia and then chance your arm in any number of wagers on the Golden Mile.

This game is all about finding Golden Nuggets to strike it rich and then taking on your fellow miners in any number of gambling games in the hope that their wealth will soon be your wealth!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Extra Experiment Expansion
description:
E3 (Extra Experiment Expansion) is a very small expansion for Experiment.

E3 introduces 3 new cards for the confidential lab cards deck, beakers with a combination of two secondary colours.

These wildcards can be used to replace one of each of the beakers with a secondary colour of the original game to add some more variation (and more power to the confidential lab cards).
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Condominium
description:
In Condominium each player is the owner of an exclusive Condominium and have the task to choose the VIP tenants (Politicians, Football Players, Actors, Singers, etc.) to place in his own Condo in order to maximize the total rent value.

The value of the rent paid by each VIP tenant depends also upon the liking towards the neighbours.

Therefore, it is crucial to match in the right way the VIP cards in order to: put nearby the VIPs that get along well each other; do not put nearby the VIPs that do not stand each other.

Finally, some Special VIPs can create great advantages or a great mess depending where they are played.

name: Ichi: Game of Dragons
description:
Ichi - Game of Dragons is a modified version of Last Card/Mau Mau/Crazy Eights, a public domain card game played with a standard 52 card pack of playing cards. Ichi (pronounced ee-chee) is Japanese for "one".

The goal of the game is to empty your hand of cards before your opponents do by playing one per turn. If you have no cards that match the rank or element (suit) of the top card of the discard pile, you can't play a card and have to draw one instead. Special cards like Skip, Draw, Exchange, Reverse, and Dragons will change gameplay regularly making for an exciting new spin on the classic.

Cards are printed with both English and Kanji, making for a learning experience while you play, a pronounciation guide is included in the rulebook as well.

name: FPS Arena
description:
FPS Arena brings the world of first-person-shooter video games to a fast-paced card game. Players use weapons, ammunition, and other equipment to battle each other in a high caliber fight to the finish. They can compete one-on-one, as teams, or in all-out free-for-all deathmatch games.
