FPS Arena includes a 72-card Master Deck and three 36-card Weapon Decks. Each Weapon Deck includes weapons and ammo of a particular type, while the Master Deck includes the game's armor, gear, and action cards.

Players accumulate cards in their hand and in their Resource Pile. Cards played from a player's hand have a resource cost (usually from 1-10) that indicates the number of cards the player's Resource Pile must contain in order to play that card. Players may draw cards from their Resource Piles at any time, but may not put cards from their hands onto their Resource Piles.

A player's turn has two phases: a Main Phase and a Combat Phase. Each phase has different allowable effects. The Main Phase is generally used by the player to play equipment cards and ready for combat, while the Combat Phase is when the player engages other player.

May the greatest fragger win!
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game
publishers: Johnson-Chilton Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Honfoglaló: 1956
description: Special edition of the game Honfoglaló, where players can conquer areas by answering trivia questions. (In some cases it is enough to guess better than your opponent.) In this edition the areas are districts of Budapest, and the questions are about the Hungarian revolution in 1956.

name: Boston
description:
The eldest hand proceeds to make his announcement, or pass; the succeeding players have then the opportunity of over bidding or passing. If the eldest hand thinks he can get five tricks with Clubs for trump, he announces, "five in Clubs". If the second player undertakes to make five tricks with Diamonds for trump, he supersedes the first, and may in his turn be superseded by the third engaging to get six or seven Levees, or play Little Misere. The fourth hand, or dealer, may also supersede the third hand by announcing Picolissimo, or eight Levees, or any of the other chances lower down on the table. When a player has once declined announcing, he cannot afterwards do so in that hand, but if he makes an announcement, and it be exceeded by some other subsequent announcement, he may, in his regular turn, increase his first announcement if he chooses. If all pass without announcing the hand must be played, and he who takes the least number of tricks wins. In this hand there is no trump. Any player whose announcement are the highest can, if he pleases, call for a partner.

The privilege of calling for a partner extends only to announcements number 1, 2, 4, 6, 8 and 10 and the other being bids to play solo.

The eldest hand leads first, and the hand is played and tricks taken in the same manner as at Whist. Honors in this game count the same as at Whist.

If the player wins his announcement, he receives everything in the pool, and from each player the amount named in the table of payments.

name: Beyond the Volga
description:
Beyond the Volga is a two player card driven wargame which covers the action in and around Stalingrad between 19th November 1942 and 2nd February 1943

The game comes with three scenarios:


An introductory historical scenario covering the relief operation mounted by Axis forces - Operation Winterstorm



A "what if" scenario covering Operation Thunderclap - the proposed break out from Stalingrad



The full campaign game.


Victory is determined by points gained from occupying Stalingrad hexes with cards increasing and reducing the value to both sides.

Cards are used for events, to influence combat or to activate entire armies. Cloud cover and the freezing winters of the area both have an influence on what actions you can take.

Can you keep the starving troops inside Stalingrad supplied until help arrives? Can you keep the encirclement solid and prevent any rescue attempt?
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: Poush Poush à la ferme
description:
Equipment: Poush Poush à la ferme is a card game that contains 36 cards representing either animals, fruits and vegetables or tools from the farm (symbols). Each card has a colour, blue, green or pink and a number of symbols, varying from one to four.

Goal of the game: The players are farmers. Each player plays his/her cards to draw unbroken lines of the same Figures, Colours or Symbols in order to score points. The first to reach 10 points wins the game.

Set-up: The cards are shuffled and each player receives 3 cards. A 3x3 grid is constituted by turning the first 9 cards of the pack.

Course of the game: On his turn, each player must:
1. Play a card from his hand.
The player lays a card on one side of the game square (Top, Bottom, Left, Right) and pushes the chosen card into the square by sliding the corresponding line, thus pushing out the card placed at the opposite end of the line. This last card is discarded.
The square is now in a new configuration. The player declares all the valid lines he has newly created (Number, Color or Symbol). He scores 1 point for each line created and declared.

2. Draw a card. The player draws a card from the deck.

End of the game: The game ends when a player reaches 10 points and wins the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Farming

name: Waagemut
description:
Expansion for Bamboleo.

Game components:
long wooden "balance"spaced shelf
wooden round stick to balance the shelf
instructions

The game comes in a tube.

This expansion adds another layer to Bamboleo. Players now play in pairs. Each pair has to put their lifted blocks on one of the 8 spaces on "their" side of the balance.

The object of the game for the teams is to win the balance. It's smart to place the heaviest pieces on the outside of the balance.

Additional rules
If a player breaks of his attempt of taking a block form the Bamboleo board, the other party is allowed to take a block from the balance.

If a player passes to take a block from the Bamboleo board, and the other teams manages to still pull a block from the Bamboleo board, the other team may also take a block from the balance.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Tante Emma
description:
In order to succeed in Tante Emma the players have to recognize the items on the shopping list, but the luck of dice will also determine the winner. Each child receives a shopping list that he/she tries to complete. They draw wares from the bag and throw the dice to determine price. The first child to complete his shopping list wins.

Content:
- 14 wares
- 40 coins
- 20 shop chips
- 4 shopping lists
- 1 bag
- 1 dice
- Instructions

name: VEX: Exciting Game of Strategy
description:
VEX - Exciting Game of Strategy

Each player (2 or 4 may play) attempts to line up 5 pieces of the same color, either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.

RULES OF PLAY:

1. Each player selects a group of like-colored pieces and gathers his pieces to his position.

2. The group picks a Starter who begins the hand by placing one of his pieces near the center of a table or a flat playing area. After the first hand, the winner of each hand may be the Starter for the next hand. Action then continues around the playing area to the Starter's left, with each player placing one of his pieces on the playing area.

3. EACH PIECE THAT IS PLACED ON THE TABLE OR PLAYING AREA MUST HAVE AT LEAST ONE COMPLETE SIDE TOUCHING ONE COMPLETE SIDE OF AT LEAST ONE OTHER PIECE THAT HAS ALREADY BEEN PLAYED!

4. A player may place a piece next to any other piece, thus blocking the other players' attempts to win.

5. Players may warn each other that someone is about to win, but the game is especially exciting if the players agree not to warn each other.

6. The first person to win 5 hands wins the game. If the group wishes, a time limit may be set, and the player who wins the most hands in that time wins the game.

7. If all the pieces are played, but no one has won, the winner is the one who has the most groups of 4 pieces, or the hand may be replayed.

name: Kitchen Kombat
description:
The card game that puts the PAIN into cooking!

Welcome to the highly competitive world of Kitchen Kombat. You are about to enter the Kitchen Battledome where you will pit your strength and courage against rival chefs. The action is tense and the meals delicious. Or they should be. But be aware. Your opponents will do their best to sabotage your efforts. Do you have what it takes to be the winning chef? Fasten your apron, adjust your hat, sharpen your knives and warm your oven--it is time to battle!

Consisting of 110-cards Kitchen Kombat is designed for ages 8 and up.

Easy printing on Avery 5390 Name Badges or plain white cardstock.

name: G.I. Joe Cobra Battle Game
description:
It's G.I. Joe vs. Cobra in a 2 player foam dart launching battle game!

Each player controls a rubber band powered launcher (green for the G.I. Joe player, blue for Cobra) that has 4 targets located on its base. Players sit approximately 6 feet apart and take turns firing shots to try and knock out the opponent's targets.

First player to knock out all four of the opponent's targets wins.

name: Flunk
description: Flunk is a sort of Dummy Contract Whist for three. It doesn't claim to be a form of Bridge. Three-handed Bridge is a contradiction in terms, as it lacks co-operative bidding between the partners, which is one of the two defining features of that game. But it does offer its other defining feature, namely, that of declarer playing from dummy with a view to selecting a trump suit (or announcing no trump) and declaring a contract.

name: Chess³
description:
Chess³ (ChessCubed) is a three-player take on Chess, set on a hexagonal board. The concept of three-player chess is nothing new (e.g. 3 Man Chess, Chess for Three, Three Player Chess, Trigon Chess & Checkers, Tri-Chess, Megachess, 3er Schach), and the concept of chess on a hexagonal board is nothing new (e.g. Hexes: Hexagonal Chess, Hexagonal Chess, En Garde!, etc.). Heck, the concept of three-player chess on a hexagonal board isn't even new (e.g. Hexagonal Chess for three), but there are several features of Chess³ that make it stand out:


It emulates the traditional, two-rank setup with a straight line of powerful pieces protected by a straight line of pawns.
The hexagonal playfield has an incredible 168 hexes in order to accommodate each player's army.
Each player has the eight traditional power pieces, plus a champion. (The champion is the popular bishop/knight compound, but obviously with a hexagonal definition.)
Each player has ten pawns to protect the nine power pieces from wall to wall.
It features an angular, but familiar redesign of the pieces, each of which bears a hexagonal base.


The game is designed to be portable, with a roll-up board, a drawstring bag for each player's pieces, and a courier tube of a case for the whole thing.

name: Gooseberry Fool
description:
The winner of this eccentric trickster is awarded one or more Golden Geese. Agree beforehand what one Golden Goose is worth.

Always played at three Gooseberry Fool is a trick taking game where the winner is always the odd man out. When playing cards of the same suit (which is required if possible) the middle card wins, when two suits are played, the odd one wins and if multiple suits are played, the one with the odd color takes the trick.

Yet points are scored based on tricks won, where you get 1 point for each trick you win, yet 2 for each trick won by the player on your right. Also, the goal is to be the one in the middle when one player reaches 100 points. Thus at the end if the scores are 100, 82, 67; the player with 82 would be declared the winner (in case of a tie, the untied player wins).

name: Where Heroes Dare! Two Fisted Action in the Pulp and Movie Serial World
description:
Have you ever wanted to stop a Nazi Doomsday weapon hidden away in a lost Peruvian Valley amongst ancient ruins? Have you ever wanted to show those fools at the University the magnitude of your diabolical genius?

In Where Heroes Dare! players field their own custom made Heroes and Villains along with their Companions and Lackeys in thrilling adventures set in the 1920s-1930’s Pulp Fiction and Movie Serial world. Players control as little as 3 models or as many as 30 depending on their style of play led by Characters with Shticks that give them flavor and ability such as Hard Boiled or Get a Load of Her! In these pages you will find rules covering Voodoo Zombies, Gadgets, Gear, Mad Science, Giant Robots, Vehicles, Airplanes, Artillery, Fierce Beasts, and a Campaign generator that gets you right in the action. The Perils and Fortunes tables add to the story by giving your Characters rewards or penalties from game to game as each Chapter unfolds.

Where Heroes Dare! uses the Iron Ivan Games mechanics but adds in a new Dare! ability that allows Characters to solve mysteries, perform feats, and duke it out in Dire Duels. Where Heroes Dare! uses a point based system to create your teams and games are finish in about 2 hours. Are you ready for adventure? Then go Where Heroes Dare!

-- from the publisher
categories: Book, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Put
description:
This 17th century two-player game uses a standard deck of cards. Each player gets 3, and any card can be played in any turn, the highest one wins the trick. (Ties count for nobody.) A player winning two tricks wins the round and gets a point. The first one to achieve 5 points is the winner. At certain points players can "put", then opponents can give up or "see" - if opponents choose the latter, then the winner of that round instantly wins the whole game.

The 19th century version of the game allows players to resign a hand, giving a point to their opponent. It could also be played four-handed, between two pairs of partners.

Some sources allow three players. In his Penguin Book of Card Games, David Parlett speculates that if all three players win one trick then nothing is scored, and that if one player puts, both of the opponents agree whether to concede or play out.

name: Tomorrow A Corps
description:
FREE game in Old Soldiers webzine Vol. 6 No. 3

Tomorrow A Corps is a conflict simulation of Emory Uptons Assault at the Mule Shoe Spotsylvania Courthouse, Virginia, on May 10, 1864.

Game Features
* Two-Person or Suitable for Solitaire Play
* Twenty-one Page Rules Manual
* 26 x 20 Hex Game Map In Full Color
* About 76 Counters Front and Back Plus Information Markers
* Available in PDF Format
* Two Quick Play Reference Sheets
* Instructions for Mounting Counters
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Gleek
description:
This game uses a standard deck of cards without the Deuceys and Treys. The game played in four parts.

1. The draw. Players bid for the right to draw card replacements in hope of improving their hand. Only the highest bidder may do this.
2. Players bet as to who holds the best ruff - that is, the greatest value of cards in any one suit.
3. Players declare their gleeks (three-of-a-kind) and mournivals (four-of-a-kind), and are paid by each opponent for each one held.
4. Players play 12 tricks, and then score for the tricks they won and their face cards.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Flapjack
description:
Flip-Flapping Stack-Slapping Card Game

Welcome to Jack's Buttermilk Diner! Player-chefs take turns flipping pancake cards onto a diner plate. Be the first to slap a pancake topped with butter, syrup, berries, a Fruit-Face or an Egg and you win that plateful!

Object of the Game: To slap the most pancake-stacked diner plates. The player with the most points (after all 12 diner plates have been won by the players) wins. Point value varies based on the pancake topping. There are six different types of pancakes varying from 1 to 8 points.

Contents: 64 pancake cards, 12 diner plates. Instructions on the packaging.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game
publishers: IDEAlogists LLC, Madd Capp Games, MJ Moran Company

name: Ab die Post!
description: The game board is a city map on which the players try to deliver mail cards. The cards are designed as letters, packages, postcards etc., and the players hold various ones of these. By rolling dice, the players move across the board, trying to get rid of their mail; helped or obstructed by event cards. The first player to get rid of all cards is the winner.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Enter Rommel (Europa Battle Scenario #2)
description:
Appearing in Europa Magazine #15, Enter Rommel (Europa Battle Scenario #2) is a specially numbered 4 page pullout in the center of the magazine.

Awards: 1990 Charles S. Roberts Award: Best Historical or Scenario Magazine Article, By Mr. Frank Watson



(from the introduction:)Enter Rommel is a scenario suitable for use with Western Desert of "War in the Desert." Players may use either the original Western Desert rules or the later "War in the Desert" rules ... several additional rules and rule variations are included. Use of the special scenario rules is mandatory, while you may use the additional option rules as you see fit. However, be warned that the scenario was developed and play-balanced using all the additional rules.

Optionally, Enter Rommel can be used as an alternate starting point for a complete Western Desert or "War in the Desert" campaign game. For this reason, the Allied Order of Battle includes units in Gibraltar and Iraq. Disregard the setup of these units unless starting a campaign game.

The Situation. March 24, 1941: Rommel has just arrived in Africa and taken over command of the Axis forces there. Although ordered to stand on the defensive, he discovers that the British give ground easily to his probing attacks. Soon his "raid" becomes a full-blown offensive.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Polignac
description:
This game is strongly related to Knaves. It is played with a standard deck of cards after removing all the cards with value less than 7. Taking the Jacks worth one or two penalty points, the game continues until a player reaches an agreed total of penalties.
There are some possibilities to change the whole structure of the game, for example any player may bid "capot" before the opening lead is made. This is an undertaking to win every trick. If succeeded, each opponent loses 5 points, if not the bidder loses 5.

name: Schlumperwald
description: The game consists of a frame into which 30 tiles are inserted (face down). The tiles contain labyrinth paths. At first, the players move from one end of the map to the other; in the second phase, they have to move home passing a star tile. . The first player to reach the starting line again is the winner.

name: Absorption
description:
Absorption is a two player abstract game. In essence, each player has 18 two-sided pieces that move in stacks of three or less on an 8x8 square grid. The idea is to absorb the opponents pieces into your own by surrounding them with at least 1 more piece value (so a 2 piece stack would be absorbed if surrounded by 2, 2 piece stacks, or a 3
piece stack and a 1 piece stack). When you absorb the pieces, you turn them over to your color and add them to the capturing stacks. The first person to reduce their opponent to 3 pieces or less wins. In developing the game it has become a balanced and subtle game; very simple to learn, but potentially complex in strategy.

name: Quadrille
description: This game is played with a Spanish deck of cards (standard deck without the 8s, 9s and 10s). After cards are dealt, players bid. There are three possibilities, either pass, or playing with a partner or playing alone. Then the winner, depending on his bid, plays alone or calls a card, and the holder of that card becomes his/her partner (but it is not announced and becomes evident only during the play). Then tricks are played, and the highest bidder has to win 6 out of 10 tricks in order to win the contract.

name: Brin de Jasette Twist
description:
In this version of Brin de Jasette (French for "A Bit of Bander"), the active player choose a question from his or her card and read it loud. Each question ask something from the active player. Here are some examples:
"What would I bring on a desert island?"
"If I would design a new computer program, what would it does?"
"What makes me look cool?"

Every player now answer loud to the active player, who has to give secret points for each answer. He can give 0 to 10 points. After one round (each player was active once), players reveal their point. If one has 30 (or more), he wins. If not, you make another round.

name: Syzygy Four
description: Syzygy Four is the game of strategic alignment and maneuver for two to four players. Arrange the tiles into one of an endless number of 8x8 configurations. Then follow Syzygy Four's unique rules of movement as you maneuver your four glass stones into the "syzygy" that is shown on the card you have drawn. Score by creating your syzygy on tiles of the same color. Your opponents will try to thwart you by blocking your path and "swapping" your stones off to far-reaching corners of the board. Lots of skill and a little bit of luck are required if you are to successfully beat your opponents to the final round, which is double score.

name: Combined Arms 2000
description:
Combined Arms 2000 is a light wargame simulating armored warfare using modern technology. It features a realistic scale for both movement and fire (1 space = 1 kilometer), a good selection of vehicle and infantry types, off-board fire support, and fixed-wing air support.

Players build armies from parts of a shared deck, then fight! The attacker has only ten turns to seize his objectives. Wise use of reserves, clever scouting, and bold maneuver are all needed to attain victory.

This is a free print & play release on BoardGameGeek. Print cards and box to 110 lb cardstock, and rules to a single sheet of typing paper. Heavy lines on the box are cut lines; lighter lines are all mountain folds.
categories: Card Game, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: The Penguin Game
description:
The little penguins are striving to stay atop a melting iceberg. Unfortunately the body heat of the penguins is melting the ice. Who can stay afloat the longest?
Each player will take on the role of a penguin. On your turn, you will make a move, then remove (or melt) the spot that you left. If you can't make a legal move then you're out of the game. Last player on the iceberg wins!

name: Par Golf
description: Par Golf from National Games published in the 1950's is described on the game cover as a 'fascinating,authentic, new GOLF GAME'.

name: Level Headed
description:
(from the box)

The Crazy Game Of Balance And Skill

Are you level headed enough?

Roll the dice and prepare for hysterics as players attempt to balance blocks on their heads. An action packed game for all the family!

(How to play)

Each player puts on a "hat." Players roll a special die, and one or all of the players place foam blocks on their head. The winner is the last to keep all of the blocks on their head!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Sneak
description: This game is played with one or two standard decks of cards (depending on the number of players). Each player in turn has two possibilities: he can draw a card or play a combination (cards of the same rank, suit, or in sequence) face up or down. Then he wins those cards unless other players challenge it by playing the same number of cards. Than the more valuable combination wins. This continues until all cards have been won. Then every cards won score 1 point.

name: Trivia Junior Russia
description: Russia trivia game now has a junior version. Packed with 1500 fun questions that every child should know about the their country – music, sport, geography, nature, culture and much more
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Guilin Zhipai
description:
Also known as "Er Qi Shi" or "2-7-10" is a traditional Chinese card game, closely related to Majiang and the Rummy family of games. It can be found in Guang Xi province of southern China, particularly to the city of Guilin (from which it derives one of its names), as well as in Sichuan province (specifically Leshan where a particularly ornate style of writing for the numerals is used) and in the city of Chongqing. It is rare, but not unheard of, to see it played outside of these environs.

It is traditionally played by 4 people, three players and one dealer. Cards are divided into two suits - informal and formal characters numbered from 1-10 and one "Phoenix" or joker card. There are 4 duplicates of each, with the 2's, 7's and 10's of both suits picked out in red (which are worth extra points when scoring). Play proceeds in a manner similar to Majiang, with players attempting to create a variety of different "melds" or special hands, with the winner's score being calcualted on the strength of his or her hand.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: 2 x 2 Napoleonics
description:
DBA-inspired miniature rules specifically designed for use with 2mm scale Napoleonic figure blocks, to be played on a 2 foot by 2 foot (2' x 2')table. Players build up units of soldiers by expending Army Points (AP), and typically fight engagements with 40 AP of units aside. The turn sequence is the familiar structure of:

Player 1 moves
Player 1 rallies
Player 2 shoots, cavalry countercharges
Player 1 melees

Then the reverse:
Player 2 moves
Player 2 rallies
Player 1 shoots, cavalry countercharges
Player 2 melees

Each unit represents a regiment and each player controls the equivalent of a corps of soldiers. Ground scale is 1" = 400 paces, or ¼" = 100 paces. Figures should be mounted on 1" x ½" bases, representing about 1200 men. All units move in increments of ¾" or 300 paces.

Combat is resolved by a single die roll, with a long list of possibly applicable modifiers. Results are of the variety of Disrupted, Recoil, or Destroyed.

Six-sided dice and a ruler (marked in ¾" or 300 pace increments) are required to play.

name: Bluemini: My Dog's House
description:
A game for toddlers (1 1/2 to 3 yrs). The goal is to get the dog home to his water bowl. Basically, it's a memory game with only 3 different pictures.

The game box becomes the dog's yard and a 3-d dog house is built. It's only real function is to entertain the toddler.

name: "To the Last Gaiter Button": Wargame Rules for The Battle of the Frontiers – The Imperial Phase of the Franco-Prussian War of 1870-71
description:
Tactical battle rules for miniatures, nominally for 10mm figures but applicable to others.

This set of rules forms part of the Real Time Wargames series, in this case covering the late 19th century battles involving the French and Prussian armies in 1870.
publishers: Real Time Wargames, Realistic Modelling Services

name: Hunt and Seek Through History
description:
Find the greatest number of objects hidden in the game boards. In the “Time Challenge”, children are invited to locate eight objects used to measure time in each of the eras depicted on the game boards.

Bilingual (french / english). This game of observation develops a child’s visual acuity and concentration while providing an opportunity to learn a second language. Beautifully illustrated game boards allow children to explore prehistory, ancient Egypt, Grecian antiquity, the Middle Ages, the Far West, the pirate era, the discovery of America and, finally, a glimpse of the future.

Object of the game:
To locate illustrations in the game boards and collect as many cards as possible

Box contains:
4 game boards double sided
50 cards
Game rules

name: Stingray, Stingray
description:
Subtitled "The Game of 21st Century Undersea Warfare Based on the Classic TV Series."

A miniatures game of combat between underwater craft. The game is played on a hex grid. Each move equals about 15 seconds in game time and each miniature represents one craft.

From the rulebook:

"These rules are an attempt to simulate the undersea combat portrayed in the 1960's TV series Stingray."

"It tries to be true to the original, and we have resisted (as far as possible given the requirements of game design) the urge to embellish the original too much."

"The rules are divided up into three parts, The General Rules, the Titan Terror Fish Rules and the Stingray Rules. These can be divided up between player teams as appropriate (see below). It is recommended that players who use these rules regularly stick to one or other of the protagonists on a permanent basis. This will encourage greater identification with the cultural and technological characteristics of the two sides."
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Valiant Britons
description:
Valiant Britons: Tribal warfare in Celtic Briton.

An ancients miniatures wargame. Game scales are provided for playing with 15mm, 25mm, or 6mm figures. Battles may be fought between two Celtic warbands, or against Roman forces.

Excerpts from rulebook:

"This is a wargame set in ancient times, somewhere between the 4th Century BC and 1st Century AD about tribal warfare."

"In this game each player is a Big Chief in a Celtic tribe. The tribe is organised into a ‘King’ who is the first among equals, and his Big Chiefs. There is also usually a Druid - who is also from the warrior caste, but has additional insight into the mysteries of the gods."

"The King will have called out the Warband, provided the council have agreed. This usually only happens in very serious cases."

"The game is as much about the player's status within the tribe as it is about fighting a battle."

The status of a player's King is measured in "heads" (warrior heads taken in battle), cattle, followers, and kudos (representing force of personality or presence).

name: Pentox
description:
A challenging game of strategy. For 2 players, aged 7 years-adult.

The game components are:

- a hardwood box
- 25 wooden cubes, each with 4 blank faces, one face marked with a black circle, and 1 face with a white circle
- rules
The object of Pentox is as simple as noughts and crosses. The winner is the first person to make a straight line - horizontal, vertical or diagonal - with 5 cubes of the same colour.

The cubes are emptied out of the box and arranged in a 5x5 square with the blank faces upwards.

Each player chooses a colour, either black or white.

Play commences by the first player choosing any of the 16 cubes on the periphery of the square, but they may only choose a square that is showing a blank face OR showing a circle of the players chosen colour.

Depending on where the player has taken the cube from, the incomplete row must be made good by sliding any one of up to three possible blank rows into the empty space, by using the selected cube to push the other end of the row. The cube used to push the row is then left at the end of the row with that players colour face upwards.

The opponent then replies in a similar fashion.
Play continues until one player manages to form a straight line - either horizontal, vertical or diagonal - of 5 cubes of their colour,

name: Nickel & Dime Pool
description:
Nickel & Dime Pool is a dexterity, flicking game based on pool. Coins are used in place of balls. They are "flicked" with your finger instead of using a pool cue. A larger, nickel-sized coin is used as the cue ball and 10 dime-sized coins represent the rest of the balls. The small coins are split into 2 groups, solids and stripes. One player/team uses solids, numbered 1-5, the other uses stripes, numbered 6-10. The goal is to be the first player/team to sink all of their respective coins into the pockets. The board is square, molded plastic with 6 pockets. 1 at each of the 4 corners and 1 one along either side midway down the board. Just like billiards, the cue coin is used to sink the other coins into the pockets by flicking it into the numbered coins.

Game comes with board, 11 coins, plastic triangular rack and vinyl pouch to hold coins. Vinyl decals are supplied to apply to the coins, representing the different numbered balls, 1-10.

name: Zombie Chess
description:
User Summary:

Zombie Chess (A.K.A. The Case Against Humanity Winning the Zombie War) is a chess variant in which one player's chess pieces are replaced by plastic zombies. It will be the task of the "humans" to eliminate the zombie threat, which in itself is not a terrible task, but is made more complicated by the fact that, while battling the zombies, the "humans" can become infected, and also that the zombie ranks tend to replenish. Die rolls determine whether pieces become infected or destroyed, when one takes another.

name: Middleman
description:
Middleman is an Icehouse game for two players. Middleman is like a 3D version of chess, where each piece has different movement rules. Large pieces move like bishops; medium pieces move like rooks; small pieces move like knights. The large and medium pieces are restricted to moving one or two spaces. The first player to form a tree of his or her own color pieces wins the game.

Middleman is played on a diamond sized chess board with a size of six squares across the middle. This diagram shows the board shape where the Xes represent the the playing surface of the board.

00XX00
0XXXX0
XXXXXX
XXXXXX
0XXXX0
00XX00

For a full description of the rules see http://www.icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Middleman

name: X
description:
X is a simple game for 3 players which employs an ordinary rhombus board with a hexagonal pattern of cells. The three players, Red, Yellow and Green, take turns adding stones of their own color to the board. A corner of the rhombus is claimed by the player with the outermost path connecting the corner's two adjacent sides.

The object is to claim the maximum unique number of corners.

name: Thief of the Sacred Fire
description: A Stonehenge solitaire Puzzle game. The player tries to enter the innermost circle of Stonehenge to steal the sacred fire of the ritual that stands on one of the trilithons, but it is guarded by four druids on the inner ring plus the High Druid in the bluestone track. Movement is performed based on a number of points corresponding to the color of the card drawn.

name: Where's in the Bag
description:
Expansion to Who's In The Bag.
Where's in the Bag is an additional set of location cards that you can add to the main game. So aside from having to help your teammates identify famous characters, you'll now have to communicate locations such as "your trouser pocket" and "The Kremlin"

name: PentaKribb
description:
PentaKribb is billed as "Boardless Cribbage". Instead of the traditional board, players are provided a scoring sheet to post their hands and scores. Players are not dealt their own, individual hands. Instead, the dealer turns a single card face up. The players enter that card onto their own score sheet, placing it into the square of their choice in a 4 x 5 grid. This is repeated until all 20 spaces are filled in. The dealer then turns over a single cut card. The result is 5 hands of 5 cards for each player. The scores are added up for all the hands. This is repeated for five deals. The highest score at the end of the five deals wins the game.

From published rules on the box.

name: Funny Friends Rallye
description:
This game with our "Funny Friends" is convenient for the youngest. Even two years children are able to follow easy instructions. The clear shapes and colours of the game are especially age oriented.

The animals run once on the racecourse on the playing field whereby the spinning arrow decides how far each animal may run in each go. The winner is the first animal to arrive back at his start or go beyond it.

Contents:
• 1 wooden game board (400 x 400 x 10 mm)
• 4 playing figures
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box

name: Tamagotchi: El juego
description:
Roll the Tama Roulette and start discovering the Tama Planet. His districts (Patchi Forest, GuruGuru City, Mame City and Tama City) and his inhabitants have numerous surprises. In each of your trips, a test is waiting for you: a reunion with a Tamagotchi character, an unexpected expense, an exciting game, a card to collect...
But don’t forget your objective: collect the major number of cards and have the most points before the sunset!


Haz girar la Tama ruleta y empieza a descubrir el Tama Planeta. Sus barrios (Bosque Patchi, Ciudad GuruGuru, Mame Ciudad y Tama Ciudad) y sus habitantes te reservan numerosas sorpresas. En cada uno de tus de tus desplazamientos, te espera una prueba: un reencuentro con un personaje Tamagotchi, un gasto imprevisto, un palpitante juego, una carta para coleccionar...
¡Pero no olvides tu misión: coleccionar el mayor número posible de cartas y reunir el máximo de puntos antes de que se ponga el sol!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: African Empires
description: Board Game for 3-6 players. Theme: Rise and fall of various Native Empires in Western and Sub-Saharan Africa circa 1100-1700 AD. Empires come and go. Each empire is described by ratings in Government, Religion, and Economy. Players simultaneously build up, vie for control, and cause the downfall of multiple Empires.

name: Farbenfische
description:
The players assemble fishes from cards in different colors. For this, they roll a die. With a result of one or two fish, they take the corresponding number of fish cards. When they roll a worm, they skip a turn.
A completed fish is swimming to a worm pile, trying to eat as many worms as possible. For this, the player keeps flipping over worm cards and can keep all worms in any of the colors of his/her fish. When a worm in the wrong color is flipped open, the fish is discarded and all worms are lost.
The first player to collect 16 worms is the winner (or most worms, when all worm cards are used up)

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Himmel und Erde / Die Tierschau
description:
A very old pair of games (1930s?) in German. Himmel und Erde is a chutes and ladders type game where players travel from Spring through Christmas by either going on the Earth or through Heaven. The description on the box cover states "Das lustige Wurfelspiel der bunten Welt im Jarheslauf".

Die Tierschau has pictures of animals with a pair of dice with different totals on a board. The players apparently work their way across the board by advancing a pawn from animal to animal along the way. There are four different sets of rules, for shorter, longer and "Doppelspiel", or "double play". The box top describes the game as "Im Spiel kreuz und quer durch das Tierreich".

name: Viable
description:
[EN] You play a young businessman interested in invest in a growing business: the railroad. Build stations, sign mercantile contracts, buy shares, and don't forget the passengers! Relive the history expanding your rails through the cities that saw the spanish railroad grow during the 19th century.

Players must decide not only which are the proper actions to take during their actual turn, but also where actions may be favorable their next turn. The heart of the game is card drafting, so a little luck is involved. Three scoring rounds will take place through the game, all player-induced. Players who have been ready for the scoring rounds, will take the lead.

[SP] Representas a un joven emprendedor interesado en invertir en un negocio en expansión: el ferrocarril. Construye estaciones, firma contratos con compañías mercantiles, compra certificados de acción, ¡y no olvides a los pasajeros! Revive la historia extendiendo tus vías entre las ciudades que vieron crecer la red ferroviaria española durante el s. XIX.

Los jugadores deben no solo decidir cuáles son las acciones más propicias durante su turno actual, sino también prever dónde les será conveniente realizarlas en su próximo turno. El corazón del juego está en el robo de cartas, así que un poco de suerte resulta favorable. A lo largo de la partida se producirá un total de tres rondas de puntuación, inducidas por los propios jugadores. Aquellos jugadores que hayan sabido anticiparse a las rondas de puntuación resultarán aventajados.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Snack Street
description:
Officail description from Wit Mine Games:

"Snack street" is a light auction game for 2-6 players.

Several snacks businessmen, launched a fierce scramble of the ownership of snack stores on the Snack Street，in order to sell snacks to the gluttonous customers and made enormous profits……

As a businessman,players have to manage both the snacks stock, and the acquisition of stores at reasonable prices.

At the end of the game ,certain snacks will be sold in the corresponding snack store and will score for the owner!Also be careful !If one don't have the corresponding snack store,that kind of snacks will rot and caused economic losses!

Players who end with the highest score will win the game and become the commercial giant of Snack Street!

name: Ancient Historical Battles, Volume 2
description:
This books describes 40 battle scenarios during the ancient period, from Acragas in 406BC to Yarmuk in 636 AD. Each scenario is given on one page. Troop order of battle is described for use by De Bellis Antiquitatis/Multitudinus (DBA/M). The author gives the number of men represented by each stand, so it should be simple to adapt the scenarios to other rule sets.

Example: Early Macedonian army at Crocus Plain:
"20000 Foot: 8 Auxilia (5 I(I), 3 R(O)), 6 Psiloi I(O), 6 Spear R(O)
3000 Mounted: 1 Knight R(F), 2 Cavalry R(O)
1 General Knight R(F)"
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: The Tarot of the Black Cat
description: Each player has the tarot cards on hand. The start player declare a number from 1 to 22. It is discarded by the player that has the card of the number. The turn is played clockwise. If the player is no hand, the player is removed in this game. The last player is the winner.

name: Bamberg-Quiz
description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the German town of Bamberg. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Texas Holdem Trivia
description:
Play trivia Texas Holdem style. You can play heads up one on one or play with a full table of players playing in a sit n go tournament style. You act and bet the same way as in Texas Holdem, but instead of going for a straight or flush to create your best hand you answer trivia questions to create your best hand.
You must also use your poker skills and strategies in this game like, raising, checking, sensing weakness, value betting, limping in, going all-in, and even folding when you think you are beat. If you don't know the answers you can try the bluff strategy, but watch out an opponent might be slow playing the hand!

name: Trio Mordillo
description:
Memory variant in which each player flips open three (out of 90) tiles with comic strip pictures. When the three form an actual story, the player can keep them. If not, the tiles are flipped back again. The player with most tiles at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Our USA: The Game of Landmarks
description:
This is part of a series of educational "Our USA" games from Selchow and Richter. The series also included "Our USA: Products and Resources" and "Our USA: Heroes and Events". (There may be others.)

This game was copyrighted in 1962 and is basically a roll & move historical game about famous American Landmarks that you try to visit. The game is designed for players ages 7-12

name: Kusa Moeru
description:
This game covers the Genji-Heike campaign in the 12th century.
The game uses the "Hannibal" engine.
Play is based on card. But, battles are resolved by die instead of card matching.

1 map
140 counters
64 strategic cards
1 playaid sheet


Issue game of old Game Journal 57.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Bonspiel Curling
description:
Bonspiel Curling is a game that was a promotional item for the White Rose Oil Company in Canada. The side of the box states that it was 'Created exclusively for Canadian Oil Companies Limited'.

The game was endorsed by Ken Watson "Canada's Mr. Curling".

The following is a message from Ken Watson located on the inside cover of the Rules of Play:

Whether you are a curler or not, countless hours of fun are in store for you and your friends with the intriguing game of Bonspiel Curling. Both young and old will be fascinated by the possibilities of strategy and play that this exciting game offers. Draws, guards, raises, take-outs, in-wicks, rolls and double kills can be executed with surprising skill after a little practice with this miniture curling board, and the lessons learned can be put to good use in a real curling game.

Bonspiel Curling is a thrilling team game for as many as eight players. With sixteen stones in play each end, the combinations of shots are unlimited. The scoreboard will add to the glamour of winning a close game or even scoring an eight-ender.

So choose up sides, toss the coin and let's play - Bonspiel Curling!

Yours from the hogline in,

Ken Watson

name: Hanniball
description:
Hanniball is a two-player soccer-like abstract board game.

Both players have 11 pieces: 1 Monkey (the Keeper), 2 Lions, 4 Elephants and 4 Horses. There is a special piece used in the game that represents the Ball.

Pieces move similar to Chess pieces. They can take control of the Ball and move it with them from one square to another, leave it behind or shoot the Ball to other squares.

The goal is to shoot the Ball into opponent's goal.

name: NFL Game Time Talking Football
description:
User review: The game players face off at opposite ends of the game field (board) and choose run, long pass, or short pass and a ball carrier via knobs and buttons hidden behind a panel on each end. Once the plays have been entered. The offense pushes a button to hike the ball and starts the wheel in the middle of the gameboard spinning. The defense then pushes the blitz button to stop the wheel from spinning. Depending on the letter the wheel stops on and the plays picked. The results of the play will then be announced through the speaker and visually on the display. The football marker is then moved to keep track of the yardage.

Play continues just like a real football game until the end of the fourth quarter. You can also choose between for different lenghts for each quarter to adjust the game length.

name: Dinosaurs Adventure Board Game
description: A budget priced Korean roll-and-move game. Part of the infamous Daiso 3000won series. The game has a format similar to monopoly. Players movie around the outside of the board collecting money and dinosaur cards while trying to avoid the other player's dinosaur spaces. There is also a "shortcut" on on courner of the board that players may use if given the right roll.

name: San Antonio-opoly
description:
We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some culture, awesome fiestas, Tex-Mex, a great big Alamo, some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; San Antonio-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, San Antonio! It’s Your Roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Warcosm Assault (Supplemental Edition)
description:
Expand your Warcosm games with boarding actions.

This add-on provides quick-playing rules for using assault squads. Board enemy vessels and either sabotage or commandeer them, but be ready to fight off defending contingent squads. Maintaining the same game mechanics as ship to ship battles, this addendum to the Warcosm game introduces new rules for assault craft, troops, hyper-shunting, and ramming, as well as new systems like assault bays, chaff launchers, plasma bursters, and tractor emitters.

Available in both PDF and printed formats.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Fallen Kingdoms
description:
From the introduction and website

Each player is a Norse god that will control various viking kingdoms which will evolve and change thought the passage of time. After a while, new kingdoms will invade the land to destroy the older kingdoms. This process will continue until all the kingdoms evolve enough to unite themselves as one nation.

Players must try to do their best out of each civilization in order to win. They accumulate glory points every turn for each city they control and they can acquire trophies which will make them score extra points. There are three kinds of trophies, when two of them are depleted, the game ends. The player who accumulated the most glory points wins.
categories: Civilization, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers
publishers: (Web published), Larienna's Library, Print & Play Productions

name: Øisteins tegnespill
description: On each turn a card is flipped. The card shows a small drawing that is a part of one of the figures on the board. The first player who finds the figure that is shown draws one of the cards on his/her hand and follows the instructions. Each instructions adds to the players drawing. The first player who draws all his/her cards is the winner.

name: Mastermind Ultimate Cribbage
description:
Mastermind Ultimate Cribbage (also called "Masters Cribbage") is a card game stemming from the classic Cribbage, with some additional cards. It is played with a standard deck of cards,along with six new types: Super Fives, Zero Card, Super Ace, Wild, Super Card, and the Master Card. In addition it uses a cribbage board which is a signature piece of equipment with holes and pegs for scoring.

Players are each dealt a hand of 6 cards, of which they discard 2 into a special pile called the Crib. One card is then cut from draw pile and turned face up - it is considered part of each player's hand and of the Crib. The players then alternately play a card, scoring points for hitting certain totals, or for making sets or sequences. Score is kept by moving pegs around tracks on the cribbage board. This is repeated until all players have exhausted their hand of cards. Once all players are out of cards, each player picks up his hand and determines all possible scoring combinations, pegging points again on the cribbage board. The dealer then picks up the Crib and scores it for all possible points. Then the cards are shuffled, the deal alternates, and the process is repeated.

2-players and teams of two play a full length game to 181 points. 3 individuals end play until 141 points. 4 individual players play to a standard cribbage length game of 121 points.

The six special cards are the crux of the game.

The Zero Card: When someone plays a card for a 15 or 31 during pegging, play the Zero-Card next to collect an additional 2 points for the 15 or 31. You must play the Zero-Card if you can played in a run or double run with zero, ace, and two.

The Super Ace: A Super-Ace pairs every ace. You can use a Super-Ace as a high ace for a run of queen, king and Super-Ace for both counting and pegging. The Super-Ace can be played as 1 or 11 during pegging. The value of the Super-Ace is 1 and[/] 11 during counting (as though you had one of each card). The holder can also use as 1 and 11 with fours to total 15 points during counting the hand total.

Special Fives: Extra fives in play allows the high hand to go from 29 to 45 with 5 fives. The total points of five 5’s is 20. The 15 combinations are 20 and five pairs is another 20 making a total of 40 points.

Wild Cards: During pegging play you must use the Wild Card at the same face value as the point counting portion of the hand. Play a Wild Card as a seven during pegging, you must count it as a seven when you total your hand

The Super Wild: The Super-Wild is a Wild Card with one extra feature. It can be played during pegging as one face value and counted at another. You can play a Super-Wild as a seven during pegging and use it as a five during counting. If you play it as a 10 value you must specify it as a 10 or other face card value.

The Master: The Master is like a Super-Wild played as a separate face value during pegging and counting. The Master allows the extra option to play it after calling ‘go’.

name: Pieces of Eight: Rules of Pirates of the 17th and 18th Centuries
description:
From Publisher:

These rules have got a lot in them. They take the form of a "campaign in an evening". The land raids are fought in 15mm on a 3 x 2 foot board. Quick and fun with prisoners, looting, alarms, getting lost etc...
The sea fights are fought using 1/450th scale ships (men are 4mm high).
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Pirates, Wargame

name: Fussball
description:
2 or 4 players are playing soccer for 2x 6 minutes on a 11x14 squares field.Squares are coloured light and dark green. Each player (or team) 'owns' the fields of one colour.

The player with the ball chooses the direction he wants to shoot and rolls the die. This shows how far the ball is rolling. If the balls ends on an own field, he play further on, otherwise the opponent takes over the ball.

Each player (or team) tries to score as much as possible in the 12 minutes.

name: Airline: The 'Big Business' game
description:
From the rules book

In Airline: The 'Big Business' Game the goal is to run your airline in the most efficient, profitable way, enabling you to make more money than your competitor's airline. You buy, sell, and lease aircraft, plan and develop routes and detail jet aircraft in you race to the top.

This game is branded with air New Zealand - and all routes are in the pacific. The board looks like a monopoly board.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mauseschlau&Bärenstark: Weltreise
description:
The children's game Mauseschlau&Bärenstark: Weltreise features the lovable cartoon characters in a race around the world. The mouse and bear answer questions about geography, culture, flags, landmarks, and much more!

The whimsical spinner has two sides: one with pictures and another with text. The game is designed to be enjoyed by kids of all ages with different play levels.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel

name: Deadlands: The Great Rail Wars – A Fist Full o' Ghost Rock
description:
From the Back of the Book:

Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned. And this woman was spurned by the devil himself!
This book offers expanded rules for one-on-one duels, experience and veteran troops rogues and downtime between campaigns. A Fist Full O' Ghost Rock also features three full campaigns for Deadlands: The Great Rail Wars:

A Fist Full O' Ghost Rock features 'The Gal with no name' takin' on Enforcers from every rail baron at once.

Trail O'Blood is the tale of the huntin' of Ben Stern's band o' thugs, an you'll be followin' em to perdition itself!

The Many Tasks of Grimme forces the players to vie for the favour of Reverend Grimme in the City of Lost Angels.

A Fist Full O' Ghost Rock also features an innovative system for secretly briefing players so no-one can ever be sure exactly what's going to happen and a number of new troops for Deadlands: The Great Rail Wars.
categories: American West, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures

name: Le Mot le plus Court
description:
In Le Mot le plus Court ("The Shortest Word"), you don't actually want to find the shortest word – but given the interference of opponents, that's what you might have to settle for.

Each round, one player rolls the three consonant dice included in the game, then everyone tries to think of a word that includes all three consonants (in any order, with repeats allowed). As soon as a player thinks of a word, she announces the number of letters in it, then starts counting down from that number, e.g., "Eight letters! 8, 7, 6..." If someone else thinks of a shorter word that includes all three consonants, he interrupts the countdown to announce his letter count and start a new countdown. If no one interrupts a countdown, the counter announces the word and scores as many points as the number of letters in the word; if she goofed, giving a non-word or a word that doesn't contain the consonants, everyone else scores that many points.

If a player thinks that no word can be created with the letters rolled, she announces, "Impossible!", then counts down from ten, scoring three points if no one interrupts with a shorter word count.

The first player to score 36 points wins.

A six-sided vowel die is included that allows younger players to compete with older ones. The young players use any two consonants and the vowel, while older players use the original game rules.

name: Golden Goal
description:
Free downloadable game of Football (Soccer) played on table top with paper figures or 25mm minatures. Turn based with 45 turns per half. Uses a D6 system where individual player stats and measurements decide failure or success on individual tests.
Create your own teams with included paper cut-out figs or 25mm figures available from the same company. Field is 40"x 60" and instructions are included to create your own pitch.

name: Spanish Fury, Duel!
description:
This is module number 7 of the Spanish Fury Renaissance Warfare series. It can be played as a stand-alone game, or in the middle of other games in the series, when a duel occurs (instead of the even simpler original rules).

The players simultaneously choose what they do in their turn, reveal it and then fate cards decide the result.
categories: Fighting, Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Renaissance, Wargame

name: BattleTech: Record Sheets – 3060
description:
You’ve grasped the tactics involved with the additional units and weapons from Total Warfare to defeat your opponents. Now you own Technical Readout: 3060 and want to deploy some of those ’Mechs, ProtoMechs and vehicles on your gaming table. Grab your dice and start rolling, because these sheets are for you!

Record Sheets: 3060 contains 55 pre-printed ’Mech record sheets that will have players firing autocannons, missiles and PPCs at each other in no time. More than forty vehicle and ProtoMech sheets bring the excitement of combined-arms game play to any table top. Two ready-to-play scenarios focus on the highlights of this volume, while an extensive Rules Addendum section provides a sneak peak of all the advanced rules options provided in Tactical Operations
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Nature Trail
description:
User summary -

Nature trail is a turn based game. Each player rolls 1 die and moves around the board landing on (spotting) various animals that you might find in the English countryside. Once spotted the player gets a card depicting the animal, which they collect and at the end add up to give a final score. There is a 100 point bonus for the 1st person to finish. There are also red arrows that if landed on give either a penalty ranging from -5 to -15 or a bonus of +5 to +15. The player picks one of these card from the stack and they may contain bonus plants & animals or a penalty for littering, leaving gates open or other contraventions of the 'countryside code'.

This game came with no printed box - just a plain white card sleeve. Inside is a plastic tray, 1 board, set of rules, x1 6 sided die, 4 player counters (coloured tidily winks), x30 penalty and bonus cards for landing on red arrows, 24 animal cards, 1 100 point wining bonus card, and black card tiles to cover animals that have been spotted by players on the board.

History - I believe it was bought from the RSPB shop (The Royal Society for the Protection of Birds) UK, which is based a few miles from where I lived when I was younger. It seem it may have been a short test run of games - or only sold direct by the RSPB -

The game has stayed at my parents and is played a lot by grandchildren and adults when we get together. The game works well, with a slight imbalance in the second half of the board, or if you use the bonus points card - that lead people to race round the board.

name: AirWar: 1917
description:
Try it for free! AirWar: 1917 is a free downloadable PDF available exclusively from Wargame Vault. A stripped down version of the AirWar: 1918 (2nd edition)rules, AirWar: 1917 allows you to fight out dogfights between Sopwith Camels and Fokker Dr.1s.

Includes:

Stripped down core 2nd edition rules
Stats for Sopwith Camel and Fokker Dr.1.
Printable counters of the aircraft in case you dont have the particular models.
The excitement and heroism of WWI air combat is simply and easily presented. 2 stringbags engage over the trenches of Europe in planes that were truly "creatures of the air".
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Quest Crawler
description:
Quest Crawler is a solitaire game that allow player to travel fantasy land, performing quests, fighting creatures and malicious bosses and strength party of brave heroes to fulfil final quest - to defeat the Dragon of Death.

Game is free to download, print and play. Game require D8 dice. Game can be played during journey due to minimal space and resource requirements also can be paused and restored at any moment.

Gameplay is based on turns which are divided into separate phases:
- Quest generation phase if party isn't on quest - with use of random quest generator
- Movement phase allowing player to move his party across land from region to region from zone to zone
- Combat phase if quest or encounter test brings enemy - combat divide in combat rounds when all actions take place simultaneously
- Quest resolve phase - returning quests, delivering items (some quests ends by themselves during other phases)
- Party manage phase - when in city player can buy levels and learn abilities, sell or enchant items

What QC have:
- party of 3 heroes (choose from 9 different characters, each described with HESDIAR parameters)
- experience, levelling, abilities and talents system
- land contains 4 zones to travel and of hostile creatures to fight with
- dungeons in each zone with more powerful bosses
- randomly generated quests of 5 types
- randomly generated loot (equipment)
- enchanting equipment

What QC do not have:
- modular board
- cards
- complicated rules

What QC really is:
- board roll'n'slash

Check "Forum" section for downloadable files.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Nestortiles Octopus
description:
Nestortiles Octopus is a game for 2 to 6 players in the line of Knizia's masterpiece Ingenious. You'll need one set of Nestortiles in order to play.

Players score points by creating rows of equally numbered or colored tiles. The player with the highest score at the end of the game wins.

SETUP

Shuffle all the tiles and randomly distribute them facing up so each player receives the same number of tiles.

Determine the starting player. This player places one of his tiles in the middle of the playing surface.

PLAY

The game is played in turns in anticlockwise order.

On his turn, each player must place one of his tiles adjacent to an already played tile (horizontally or vertically). Then he scores points and the turn passes to the next player.

SCORING

To score points, do the following:


In each of the 8 directions (orthogonally and diagonally), count the number of adjacent tiles of the same color as the tile just played (the tiles must not be interrupted by blank spaces or other tiles of a different color). The played tile doesn’t count. Add these points to your total score.
In each of the 8 directions (orthogonally and diagonally), count the number of adjacent tiles with the same number as the tile just played (the tiles must not be interrupted by blank spaces or other tiles of a different number). The played tile doesn’t count. Add these points to your total score.


END GAME

The game ends when all the tiles have been played. The player with the highest score is the winner.

VARIANT

For longer games, you can use 2 sets of Nestortiles instead on one.

name: Second World War at Sea: Combined Fleet
description:
(from the APL website :)

During the late spring and early summer of 1942, the Imperial Japanese Navy launched a series of aggressive operations. Barely taking time to refuel, Japanese carriers and cruisers struck the Dutch East Indies and Ceylon. Committing a basic error of dividing their forces, the Japanese then split their fleet carriers into two groups for Operations MO and MI, which resulted in the Battles of Midway and the Coral Sea.

Combined Fleet is a 64-page book supplement to the Second World War at Sea series, focusing on Japanese and American plans and options for these two climactic battles. There are 20 scenarios, or separate game situations, based on both actual actions and potential battles that could have taken place with the forces that both sides either could have committed or discussed sending to the battle zone.

This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Coral Sea and Midway to enjoy most of he scenarios, with some pieces also drawn from Bismarck, Bomb Alley, Strike South and Eastern Fleet.


http://www.avalanchepress.com/gameCombinedFleet.php

System Description at http://www.avalanchepress.com/line_WWIISea.php
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Deckbuild Mobile Suit Gundam
description:
The system is like the system of Dominion. It's called "Deck building".

The player is the commander. The object is a player collect the territory card by using a partner card and a mobile suit card.
The difference of Dominion is a player has a partner and a mobile suit on the front. This cards are able to use any own turn. And the territory card is added as the more point card.

The mobile suits and characters are from Mobile Suit Gundam: One year war and Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack.

This will be sold as only preorder in Japan.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Hiyokomame
description:
A game to learn how to eat with chopsticks. You pick up plastic chick peas from a bowl using chopsticks. Several small games (sorting, turning, etc) are described in the small booklet that also teaches you manners when eating with chopsticks.

The rules are all in japanese although a english translation exists.

name: Het Grote Puzzel & Crypto Spel
description:
Each player gets a puzzle card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the puzzle card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the puzzle card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

name: Boojum
description: Boojum is a set collection card game, using auction and deck building mechanics. It uses two decks of Decktet cards, plus some tokens to keep score. Groups of cards are auctioned, with players bidding using other cards from their hand. The winning bid for each group gets incremented by a card, and then auctioned in the next round. Sets to be collected are typical rummy/poker-like sets: straights, sets, flushes, etc., plus a few sets peculiar (in at least two senses of the word) to the Decktet. A sister game to Snark which uses the same mechanics, but with a Rainbow Deck.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Assideum
description:
From the box:

Welcome to a world of the Imagination
Where subtle, yet cunning decisions pave the way to Victory

In this time of peril, your most trusted and elite Forces have heard your call to Battle. As you watch them assemble, you recall the previous Victories were gained through intelligence and a keen sense of strategy. Explore every option, then choose your course of action - but, remember, your opponent will be doing the same...

Tactics must be used which recognize the strengths and weaknesses of your opponent's battle forces, as well as your own. Slow-moving ground forces can successfully defend key sectors of the Battle Grid, while swift-moving ground forces race through alley-ways to the attack. But always be aware of the power of the air forces and the Ranger which, when skillfully positioned, can be devastating.

Now, it is time to clear your mind so that you can imagine the impossible. Be prepared to change course in a heartbeat, yet always keep the ultimate goal firmly in mind. You are ready.

Play: Players execute one option per turn and alternate turns until victory is attained. The battle forces consist of the army under the command of a player. Siege occurs when you can attack your opponent's commander on your next turn. Victory is attained when your opponent cannot excape siege. Opening setup is similar in look to a chess game, and each individual type of fighter is able to move in a different way. The fighters include both ground and flying forces.

Ground forces can be positioned by movement, or in certain cases through spinning, or through BOTH spinning and movement. Flying forces can fly in the flight zone established by the ground forces (portals).

name: Commonwealth
description:
Like many of the great interstellar conflict games of our time, the story centers around a war where one empire emerges victorious. The game of Commonwealth, however, immerses players into a universe where that war has already happened. In a galaxy not so far away from our own, the victor of this old war has endured for centuries after the last of their adversaries were completely extinguished. After some time though, the very heart of their species began to rot with the knowledge of their forefathers and the annihilation they had wreaked upon their galaxy. In penance, the children of the last race searched the stars endlessly for some form of redemption and reprieve from their ageless guilt. And the day soon came when they found it. In the form of a small galaxy outside their own, they discovered several infant races untouched by hyperspace travel, and untouched by war. The Ancients came to our galaxy and swore they would protect its inhabitants from the same fate that befell their own. And so they introduced peace and order to the Milky Way, for only the Commonwealth could unite all the galaxy's races and prevent them from descending into the endless abyss of battle. If you remember, this is not a story about a great war. This is a story determining how the next age of our galaxy will unfold. Will you protect the Commonwealth and quell all rebellion, or will you dissent and usher in the next age of empire dominance?

Welcome to the Commonwealth universe where three to six players clash economically, politically, militarily, and even covertly in an epic conflict that rides upon the ground-breaking game mechanic of simultaneous turns. By choosing one of twelve unique alien races, you will create customizable fleets, explore the galaxy coordinate by coordinate, acquire powerful technologies, and launch secret covert attacks that even your enemies (or friends) can't originate. For the more politically inclined players, the in-game government provides a dynamic experience that will test your mettle as you try orchestrate a series of legislative masterstrokes to cripple or empower the Commonwealth.

All this to provide a real-time simulation of interstellar civilization and warfare at its finest.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Exploration, Negotiation, Real-time, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Metal Shogi
description:
User Summary:

Gameplay: A shogi variant that adds dice-driven combat, modified by using effect cards (only one card--selected at the beginning of the game). Figures are pewter. Collect figures (power levels from 1 to 5) to construct your 5-combatant team (using two of six colors). More powerful characters can only be summoned if a certain number of colors are on the table.

Theme: Uses characters from Dragon Ball Kai, pitting one team of combatants against another. The same character can be found across multiple colors, roughly corresponding to allegiances found in the manga (comics). For example, Goku is found in both a low power level and a high power level (super), but even characters without supers are represented.

Goal: There are two variants, basic and advanced. In the basic, simply having characters breakthrough (reach the opponent's starting line) completes the game. In the advanced, there are three win conditions, including having the majority of your characters occupying the Dragon Ball area in the middle of the playing field.

Components: There are preconstructed starters (currently 3 available), and booster singles (currently 2 available). Starters include 5 figures (using two colors), a die, a double-sided effect card, a rule sheet, and a play mat (paper). The third starter play mat sports different coloring and English. Singles include a figure and a tip sheet showing how all the figures from the set might be used.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Vital Statistics
description:
Back of the box: This game of humorous, fascinating, quirky and insightful tidbits offers knowledge on everything from sports and fashion to literature and architecture and everything in between. Packed with an enormous array of factoids, minutiae and random bits of wisdom, Vital Statistics is perfect for both knowledge hounds and pop culture fiends alike. From the cost of the first pair of jeans to the name and release date of the first color movie,rest assured, Vital Statistics has the answers.

When it is your turn you roll the die to determine what category the question will be from. The options are "Multiple Choice", "High/Low" and "Closest to".

Once you read the question, ALL players include you will write down your answer on your dry-erase board (6 boards and 6 dry-erase markers are included with the game) and once everyone has their answer written, all players reveal their answer and correct answers get a check on everyone board. Everyone knows everyone's score at all times (like golf).
First player to 10 correct answers WINS!

Very laid back game and extremely well written questions. Unlike any other trivia game. Questions are unique and really fun. You definitely learn a thing or two while playing but because of the way the questions are done, you have a chance at getting any question correct (sometimes with a pure guess).

name: Lost 'The End' Board Game
description:
In this epic ‘Print and Play’ board game you will play as either Jack, Kate, Sawyer or Hurley, as you travel around the island encountering not only fellow 815 survivors but also the island’s natives known as the ‘Others’. You may even come across polar bears, boars or the mysterious and deadly Smoke Monster.
As well as being uniquely structured to encompass the events of 6 seasons of LOST, this game is very heavy on theme and detail.
The sheer depth of the game, and the large number of Encounter cards, ensures that even after several plays there will still be more surprises left for you.
So step aboard Flight 815 and be prepared to begin the ultimate LOST experience...

A summary of play
You will start the game rolling a die and moving around the outer track of the Island Game Board, visiting locations such as the Barracks, the Cockpit section, the Black Rock and the Hatch. When rolling the ‘Eye’ symbol you do not move and should instead draw one of your Flash-backwards card (later in the game Flash-forwards and Flash-sideways cards are used). Your ‘Flash’ cards usually instruct you to increase or decrease your Skill points or gain Fate points.

When you visit certain locations, and have encounters, the marker on the story track will be steadily advanced. When the story track reaches certain points, changes will be made to the game; for example the Encounter Deck being used may change to another one, or certain Friends counters may become de-activated.
The story track will also instruct you and the other players to move to one of the separate game boards or a different game track on the main board.

As you progress through the various stages of the game, the Encounter decks will continually change so that you meet people and find items from the different seasons of the LOST saga. Also your chosen character’s skill points will gradually improve making future challenges easier, and you will gain all important Fate points.

You will receive Mystery Counters as rewards. Each of the various mysteries depicted (for example Jacob, the Numbers) is made up of a set of 5 cards. If you can collect a complete set, they can be traded in for additional Fate points.

Eventually the action will move to the centre track on the game board where one of the players will be chosen to succeed Jacob. The end game will then commence. Along with the other players you must defeat the Man in Black and play the Desmond card at the Light Source space in order to save the island and win the game. Whichever player has the most Fate points at this point is declared the winner, but should your fail and allow the Man in Black to survive, all players lose the game.

LOST ‘The End’ is a Print and Play board game from MM Games, for 2 to 4 players, due for release in November 2010.
It takes on average between 2 to 3 hours to complete a game.

This game is non-profit making and is a fan-made project intended for the entertainment of fans of the the TV series LOST. No copyright infringement is intended.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Dinosaur Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Step back in time with this special Dinosaur Edition of the MONOPOLY game. Learn fun facts about popular dinosaurs as you buy, sell and trade the Spinosaurus, Velociraptor, Stegosaurus and more. Game includes beautiful illustrations of dinosaur species and six collectible fossil tokens depicting a dinosaur egg, footprint, skeleton, T-Rex skull, Triceratops skull and claw. A prehistoric relic for dinosaur enthusiasts of all ages.
